loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is a very hard-working person, who explains that thanks to her effort she has been able to get ahead. The previous Kiva loan has been a big help to her and she is very grateful for it.
Today, she comes again, to be able to supply her shop with bales of second hand clothes with which she will be able to continue offering a good variety and good prices to her clients. She is again grateful for the opportunity she is receiving because it will help her a lot.

loans.use: to purchase bales of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Angel Vinicio

texts.es:
ANGEL tiene 31 años de edad su estado civil es soltero vive con sus padres vive en la ciudad de Ventanas en la Provincia de los Rios

La VRC Bendición de Dios se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Rancho Grande de la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche, se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

 ANGEL se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar de urea, liquido mata plagas, insecticida, ranger.

Con la ayuda del credito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. La compra los realiza en Ventanas. El sueño es salir a delante gracias al crédito que nos otorga la cooperativa. Los desafíos es no contar con un capital propio. Su tiempo libre se dedica hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Angel is 31 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Rios.  The community bank Bendición de Dios is located in the Rancho Grande area of the parish of Puerto Pechiche.  It works with farmers and fishermen.  

Angel works as a farmer planting corn and rice.  He is requesting this loan to purchase urea, herbicide, insecticide, and Ranger (a brand of herbicide).  With the help of this loan, he will be able to purchase all the necessary supplies for his crop.  He will purchase the items in Ventanas.

His dream is to improve his life thanks to the loans offered by the cooperative.  His biggest challenge is not having his own capital.  In his free time, he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to purchase urea, liquid herbicide, insecticide, and Ranger.

loans.name: Ángela María

texts.es:
Ángela, es una mujer que lucha por garantizarle a su hija de trece años mejores condiciones de vida. Por su condición de madre soltera se convirtió en una guerrera capaz de soportar situaciones extremas y adversas que se le han presentado en la vida. Agradece la oportunidad que Dios le ofrece cada día para compartir con su familia.

Aunque su nivel educativo no es el mejor debido a la carencia de oportunidades para el acceso a la educación. Ángela es una mujer diligente que busca como ganarse la vida día a día, por lo cual vende productos por catálogo que le genera recursos para brindarle a su hija alimento y educación.

Su mayor sueño es crear una tienda en donde comercializar sus productos de belleza, pero tiene claro que será un proyecto a mediano plazo. En la actualidad se encuentra en búsqueda de un crédito que invertirá en la compra de Compra de productos de belleza por catálogo con el fin de mejorar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos que le permitan mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ángela is a woman who fights to ensure that her 13 year old daughter has a better quality of life.  Since she is a single mother, she became a warrior capable of surviving the extreme and adverse conditions that life has presented her with.  She is thankful for the opportunity God offers every day to share with her family.

Although her education level is not the best thanks to a lack of opportunities to access education, Ángela is a diligent woman who looks for ways to earn a living day by day.  She sells products by catalog that generates income to provide her daughter with food and education.

Her dream is to have a store where she can sell beauty products, but she knows that it will be a medium-term project.  Currently she is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of beauty products by catalog in order to improve her sales and increase her income, which will improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products by catalog.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a single mother of seven children, two of whom go to school.  She also takes care of her grandchildren. She has been running a shop for 10 years and sells retail goods to all kinds of people. 

Edith has applied for a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more sugar, salt, bread, rice and maize flour.  She generates additional income through roasting maize and works seven days a week in her shop. Her major business challenges include seasonality, the ever increasing price of commodities in Uganda, and defaulters. 

Edith aspires to own a fully stocked shop and also to build rooms that she can rent out. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, soap ,bread, rice and maize flour

loans.name: Hamidi

texts.en:
Hamidi is a 23-year-old single woman, who has been working as a tutor since 2010. Hamidi works from her house where she provides education help to three children since she started to work in order to cover her educational expenses.
It was hard for her at the beginning to manage between her own education and this business. Now she has gotten used to the parallel work and is more efficient in managing them.
Hamidi is working on expanding her available work area. She is applying for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to buy a car that will help her improve and expand her business, by providing education to students who can't come to her house that live in nearby villages.
Hamidi is planning to open a special teaching center where she can attract more students and expand her working area.

loans.use: to buy a car that will allow her to travel to students that need her tutoring services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: renovate her shop.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is 32 years old and lives in Sinkor, Montserrado County. She is a single high school graduate and for three years she been selling charcoal in her community. One of the problems she faces is the rain season because she does not have a good storeroom. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business and her plans are to expand it in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Diego Alexander

texts.es:
Diego Alexander es un joven de 27 años de edad, que lucha por salir adelante y tener la oportunidad de terminar su secundaria ya que sólo estudio hasta el  grado quinto, razón que le ha impedido acceder a un buen empleo. 
Por la precaria situación económica que padece su familia, Diego buscó empleo para colaborar con los gastos del hogar y desde hace cuatro años labora como repartidor en un supermercado de su localidad. Para la realización de esta actividad es necesaria una motocicleta, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de una nueva, ya que la que posee actualmente se encuentra en malas condiciones. Actualmente no cuenta con los recursos propios para realizar dicha inversión.
Diego sueña con poder terminar sus estudios, pues asegura que a su edad aún puede convertirse en un gran profesional y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Diego Alexander is a young man of 27 who is fighting to get ahead and have the opportunity to finish secondary school since he only studied until fifth grade, which is why he has not been able to access good employment. 

Due to the precarious economic situation his family has suffered through, Diego looked for employment in order to help with home expenses and has been working for four years as a provider to a supermarket in his area. 

In order to do this work it is necessary to have a motorcycle, which is why he is requesting a loan for the purchase of a new one, since the one he currently has is in bad condition. Currently, he does not enough of his own resources to make this investment. 

Diego dreams of being able to finish his studies, since he is sure that at his age he can still become a great professional and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda, a 55-year-old widow who lives with her son, daughter-in-law and two young grandchildren in Vanadzor, is a graduate of the State Medical College of Vanadzor. For many years Nadezhda has worked as a nurse who provides her neighbors with help when they have any health problems. She enjoys the love and respect of her patients.

Nadezhda has had a very hard life. She raised her son in difficult conditions, without any support, but never lost her optimism and kindness. The time was hard not only for her family, but also for the citizens of Vanadzor city following a horrific earthquake and the collapse of the Soviet Union. She helped her fellow citizens with her warm attitude and medical knowledge.

In addition to working in the hospital, Nadezhda works from her house; she treats and helps Vanadzor's citizens and receives additional income from this activity. The loan will help Nadezhda to buy new medical tools and equipment such as a blood pressure gauge, syringes, a glucose meter, etc.

loans.use: To buy new medical tools and equipment such as a blood pressure gauge, syringes, and a glucose meter.

loans.name: Yokonia

texts.en:
Yokonia is a 45-year-old married man with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda. For eight years now, he has been in the shoe business, and with the proceeds he has been able to provide basics to his family and buy land. He also practices farming to supplement his business.

The good father that he is, he desires to educate his children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification. The ever changing customer preferences coupled with inadequate capital affects his business, while his dream is to own a boutique. 

Yokonia intends to use the loan to buy shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Athanasie

texts.en: Athanasie is aged 43. She is married with four children. She works together with her husband in the business of selling cellular phones and accessories. She wants this loan to buy more cell phones and accessories for sale. The profits from her business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: To buy more cell phones and accessories for sale.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen lives in Montserrado County, the capital city of Liberia. It is well known as the commercial city of Liberia. She is 32 years old and is married with 3 children between the ages of 6 and 16. 

For the past 7 years she has been running a table market where she sells under-clothes. She started this business with help from her father and learned this way of selling from him. She likes her business because it gives her more profits and makes her popular. 

Helen is requesting a loan to buy more under-clothes for her business. Since she has a piece of land, she wants to earn more money to build her house.

loans.use: to buy more under-clothes for her business.

loans.name: Nicodeme

texts.en: Nicodeme is 30 years old. He has sold foodstuffs for a period of eight years. He wants the loan for buying more soaps, salt and potatoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more soaps, salt and potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de 33 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su esposa y sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por las calurosas y acogedoras calles de su ciudad.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Carlos trabaja como vigilante brindando servicios de seguridad en una empresa municipal de su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Carlos se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea poner piso de cemento a su hogar, pues actualmente su piso es de tierra de esta manera el podrá brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues Carlos seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 33-year-old man who lives in the city of Pucallpa with his wife and their two small children who he loves and who are his main purpose in life. He is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who, together with his wife, dedicates all his effort to moving their family forward.

Regrettably, due to a lack of economic resources, he was unable to study a professional major, but he would very much have liked to do so. In his free time he likes to take walks through the warm and friendly streets of his city.

Carlos works on his own initiative, with much determination and dedication, as a guard providing security services to a municipal business in his city. He works every day for approximately eight hours and believes it is going well for him due to his responsibility and the kind treatment he offers to others.

Carlos is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since, thanks to the help they offer him, he will be able to make improvements to his home. He hopes to put down a cement floor in the home as his current floor is made of wood. In this way he can offer better security and well-being to his family.

Thus Carlos will continue working and striving to achieve his great dream of seeing his children become good professionals.

loans.use: to improve his home

loans.name: Mamie P.

texts.en:
Mamie lives in Montserrado County, in the capital city of Liberia. It is well known as the commercial city of Liberia. She is 32 years old and married with three children between 3 and 14 years old. The children are in school and live at home.

For the past 12 years she has been selling oranges, bananas and plantains in the community market. She started this business with the help from her mother and learned this way of selling from her. She likes her business because it gives her more profit.

She is requesting a loan to buy more oranges, bananas and plantains for her business. She wants to get more money to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more oranges, bananas, and plantains for her business.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is a 29-year-old single man who has been working in his convenience store since 2000. His shop is well known in the region since it opened in 1980, but he took over from his father in 2000 and is working hard to develop it.

His business is going just fine but, as most of the businesses in Lebanon, it requires an external push, which he used to request from Al Majmoua, to add a special item to his shop. Through the previous loans, Elias turned the shop from a only a convenience shop to a money transfer shop and international call center, selling stationary and magazines. In addition he sells mobile phones and prepaid cards.

This diversity in his business attracts additional customers every day and attracts customers' attention when they are in his shop.

Today, Elias is applying for his third loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua. This Youth Loan will increase his business merchandise through buying special requested items and increasing special offered products, which attract customers attention.

He hopes to keep on expanding his business and to be capable of moving to a better and wider place in the future.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with special requested items.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 29 years old. He is married with two children; only one goes to school. He sells beer and sodas. With the loan, he wants to buy more different types of beers and sodas for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: To buy more beer and sodas for sale.

loans.name: Yassah

texts.en:
Yassah lives in Montserrado County, in the capital city of Liberia. It is well known as the commercial city of Liberia.

She is 35 years old, and she is married with four children between 11 and 20 years old, who are in school and live at home. For the past 10 years now, Yassah has been selling used clothes in the market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband, and learned this way of selling from her mother. She enjoys the way customers respond to her business. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. In the future, she wants to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en:
Tarana is 31 years old and has two daughters who are school-aged. Tarana has a business selling home and dowry products, such as blankets, glass figurines, slippers, coverlets, clothing hangers and other items.  With this loan, Tarana will invest in more products that will provide greater profits for her and will also be in accordance with client requests and her family's needs.

Her businesses has been located in her home for the last five years. She began with very little money that she saved through a lot of effort. 

Tarana needs a loan in order to buy school supplies and gifts. For the school year, her clients have requested supplies from class lists.

loans.use: To invest in more products like school supplies and gifts.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en: Minda earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and commodities to the people in her place. She is asking for a loan to buy additional groceries to sell like canned goods, candies, rice, soap and toiletries, soda and beverages. With this, she will be able to attract more buyers to her store.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell like canned goods, candies, rice, soap and toiletries, soda and beverages.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a 47-year-old single mother of two children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been operating a drug shop for three years, and she started the business to supplement her low salary as a medical personnel. Stringent government regulations and inadequate capital pose a challenge, while her dream is to own a pharmacy. Caroline intends to use the loan to buy drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell.

loans.name: Josiane

texts.en: Josiane is 24 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been running that business for two years. Her husband works as a motorcyclist. With the loan, she wants to buy more rice and corn flour for sale. With the profits, she will expand her business by making more savings for the future.

loans.use: To buy more rice and corn flour for sale.

loans.name: Solange

texts.en:
Solange is 30 years old. She is married to a businessman. They both have three children aged between 3 and 7 years, and they all attend schools. 

With the loan, Solange wants to buy more types of beer and soda for sale. The profits from the business will be used for savings and to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy more types of beer and soda for sale.

loans.name: Quirino

texts.en:
Quirino is a 37-year-old married man and a father of five children. He is from Trinidad, Bohol. He is engaged in dried fish vending and has been in the business for more than ten years now.

Quirino is asking for a loan to buy more fish to dry and sell.

In the future, Quirino hopes to make his business a success.

loans.use: to buy more fish to dry and sell.

loans.name: Katonzi Nyakabingo Group

texts.en:
Joseph is a 50-year-old married man with nineteen children; fourteen of them go to school. 

For seven years he has been in butchery and also earns a pension as additional income. Price fluctuation and inadequate capital affect his business growth, while his dreams are to own a ranch and educate his children up to the university, although he never had a chance to go to school.

Joseph intends to use the loan to buy cows to sell. He is a member of the above mentioned group where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy cows to sell.

loans.name: Kerly Mishell

texts.es:
Kerly es una jovencita de apenas 18 años, terminó los estudios de la escuela secundaria en un plantel de educación pública. No tuvo posibilidad de pagar sus estudios universitarios, por lo que decidió autosustentarse instalando una tienda en el barrio donde vive con surtido suficiente para ganar varios clientes de la zona. Kerly vive en la Parroquia de Río Verde de Santo Domingo, la capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, una provincia de Ecuador que en los últimos años ha tenido un alto crecimiento sostenido. Su capital  es una ciudad en donde lo más atractivo y llamativo son sus deliciosas frutas, y la gastronomía que ofrecen en el lugar. También cuenta con un comercio considerable  ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio comercial entre las regiones Sierra y Costa del país. Además cuenta con varios atractivos turísticos que acompañados de su clima cálido son muy concurridos por turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Es por esto que la mayoría de sus habitantes han emprendido con alguna actividad comercial o de servicios para habitantes y turistas.
Kerly ha solicitado un préstamo a Fundación Alternativa para poder comprar una waflera y licuadora que le ayudarán a ofrecer otros productos en su negocio para aquellas personas que no les quedó tiempo para desayunar en casa y puedan pasar por el negocio de Kerly sirviéndose un jugo o un delicioso sanduche preparado en waflera. En muchas instituciones financieras se cerraron las puertas para obtener un crédito y poder financiar este crecimiento de su negocio, sin embargo, Kerly no se ha dado por vencida y en busca de mejorar su estilo de vida e incluso en un futuro retomar sus estudios, ha encontrado una institución que gracias a la intervención de Kiva puede apoyarle en sus sueños sin poner muchas trabas y haciendo partícipes a varias personas alrededor del mundo. Para Kerly es muy importante que su negocio crezca para que su vida mejore y también pueda aprovechar el espíritu emprendedor muy característico de los habitantes de Santo Domingo.
texts.en:
Kerly is a young woman, hardly 18 years old, who has just finished her secondary education in public school. Paying for university studies wasn’t possible, so she decided to support herself by setting up a store in the neighborhood where she lives. She has enough merchandise to win over some customers in the area. 

Kerly lives in the Río Verde parish in Santo Domingo, which is the capital city of the Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas province. This province in Ecuador has had a high level of sustained growth in recent years. The capital city’s most attractive features are its delicious fruits and its local cuisine. It also has a considerable amount of trade since it has become an inland port for trade between the mountainous and coastal regions of the country. In addition, it has many tourist attractions that, coupled with its warm climate, are very busy with both national and international tourists. Because of this, most of the inhabitants have set up commercial businesses or services for inhabitants and tourists. 

Kerly has requested a loan from the Fundación Alternativa to be able to purchase a waffle iron and a blender that would allow her to offer more products in her business. People that don’t have time to eat breakfast at home can come by Kerly’s business to have juice or a delicious sandwich prepared with the waffle iron. A lot of financial institutions have closed their doors to the possibility of giving her a loan to finance the growing of her business. Nevertheless, Kerly has not given up. Looking to improve her quality of life, including in the future taking up her studies again, she has found the Fundación Alternativa. Thanks to Kiva, the foundation involves many people around the world and supports her dreams without putting many obstacles in the way. For Kerly it is very important that her business grow so that her life can improve and so she can take advantage of the entrepreneurial spirit that characterizes the people of Santo Domingo.

loans.use: purchase a waffle iron and a blender to offer new kinds of food in her store

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado County that is good at producing fish for the Liberian market. She is 40 years old and has a 28-year-old child who lives at home and is out of high school. For the past 8 years, she has been selling used clothes from a table market. One of the problems she faces is the rainy season. She enjoys interacting with her customers and the profit she makes. Being busy makes her proud of her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business.

Her dream is to have a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Haykush

texts.en:
Haykush is a pedagogue with many years experience. She graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical University and works in one of the schools of Vanadzor city as a teacher of physics.

She loves her profession very much and works with children with great pleasure. Besides teaching in school, she also does tutorial physics lessons in her own house. 

Haykush is 56 years old and lives with her son in Vanadzor city. Her husband now works in the Russian Federation and helps his family in Armenia to solve their family needs. 

Haykush has a good reputation as a teacher and many pupils. She confessed that it's a great pleasure for her to give to the younger generation a great store of knowledge of physics and prepare them for a specialty. 

Haykush needs a loan to buy a computer and printer in order to conduct her lessons in more upgraded conditions.

loans.use: to buy a computer and printer in order to conduct her lessons in more upgraded conditions.

loans.name: Ivane

texts.en:
Ivane is 50 years old. He is married and lives with his wife in Sagarejo District, East Georgia. Ivane requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

Ivane serves local people as a taxi driver with his car and earns income. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Ivane requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to the country’s rural poor. The rural poor do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Ivane will start a grocery shop. He has a place near his house where he will build a shop. Ivane plans to purchase all the building materials and will build himself. After opening the grocery store, his wife will work as a saleslady and the family will increase their income. 

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials for starting a grocery shop.

loans.name: Mohira

texts.en:
Mohira is 32 years old. She is a smart and clever woman. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a migrant in Russia and sends a little money that is not enough for living. 

Mohira is a good sewer and has "golden hands." She sews wonderful dresses. She plans to organize her own business with sewing. She studied at the course called "To Get Ahead" at a woman organization and got enough skills about business. She plans to organize the business in her house. She will manage her business alone as her children are small. 

She is asking for a loan to buy a sewing machine and other equipment for organizing her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and other equipment for organizing her new business.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 41-year-old married man with eight children; seven of them go to school. A local brew dealer in Kagadi, Uganda, he has been in this business for five years. He also deals in produce.

He set up this business to get income to support his growing family. Inadequate capital and the poor state of roads in rural areas are the leading factors hindering the fast growth of his business, while his dream is to become the leading alcohol supplier in the region, and also to be able to process it and export it to outside countries.

Francis intends to use the loan to buy local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy local brew to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 37-year-old hardworking mother to three children living in Kagadi, Uganda. She owns a bar and retail shop where she sells sodas, beer and general merchandise. She has been in this business for six years, and she supplements it with income from making local brew and from the sitting allowances as a women councilor. She dreams of educating her children up to the university and owning a hotel.

Ruth intends to use the loan to buy beer and soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Shmagi

texts.en:
Shmagi is a 40-year-old man. He is married and lives with his wife in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia. Shmagi requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is the monthly income of his wife, who is working as a nurse. It totals 350 Laris per month. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Shmagi requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Shmagi will install gas equipment in his own car and will serve local people as a taxi driver. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to install gas equipment in his car and work as a taxi driver.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 35-year-old woman with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She offers secretarial services and her major clients are schools and hospitals.

Her business dream is to own a more efficient secretarial service; Ruth intends to use this loan to buy an efficient photocopier to help achieve that goal.

She has a dream of constructing a permanent house to live in, and to educate her children up to the University.

loans.use: to buy an efficient photocopier for her secretarial service.

loans.name: Mugisa

texts.en:
Mugisa is a 58-year-old married man with four children living in Kagadi, Uganda. He deals in juice packaging and processing and has been in business for six years. He is also in a local brew and lodging business. He set up this business to get income to support his family.

Price fluctuations and the seasonal nature of the business affect his business since fruits have two seasons in a year, while his dream is to own a big juice-processing plant. Mugisa intends to use the loan to buy preservatives to use in juice making.

loans.use: to buy preservatives to use in juice making.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena is 32 years old and lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known market areas in Montserrado county. She is married and has 7 children between 3 and 13 years old. All of them are in school and live at home. For the past seven years she has been selling chicken, plantain, fish, potatoes, etc. in her community. She has a lot of customers and makes a good profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more chicken, plantain, fish, and potatoes for her business.  She hopes to improve her business and send her children to a quality school.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken, plantain, fish, and potatoes for her shop.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia used the previous loan to buy general merchandise to sell. The 53-year-old widow still lives in Kagadi, Uganda. With the profits, she has been able to promptly pay school fees for her last born child. Her challenge is inadequate capital to meet the different preferences of clients. Her dream is to have one of the biggest hotels in the area and a wholesale shop. Patricia intends to use this loan to buy food and general merchandise like sugar, salt, and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy food and general merchandise like sugar, salt, and soap to sell.

loans.name: Siah

texts.en:
Siah, 46, lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado county.   She is married, with four children ages 7, 8, 19, and 26.  They are in school and live at home. 

She has been operating a shop in her community for ten years.  She sells used clothes; she received a small amount from her husband to start this business, and learned it from her mother.  She likes her business because she makes a profit. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her  business.

loans.name: Seyran

texts.en:
Seyran is 54 years old and sells fruit and vegetables in Vanadzor. He hass engaged in this occupation for more than 10 years. He obtains the fruits and vegetables from villages in the Ararat region, and then transports them to Vanadzor to sell.
Seyran was born and lives in Vanadzor with his wife. He has two daughters, who are married and live separately from their parents. Seyran graduated from secondary school and has many years worked as a laborer. His wife, from time to time, supports him in his activity.
The loan from Kiva will help Seyran to increase his fruit and vegetable inventory. He intends to use the anticipated profits for repairing his house, which has been many years in disrepair.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy beans to sell.

loans.name: Maria Orbelina

texts.es:
Maria, decide optar por un nuevo crédito para surtir el negocio. Con ello pretende comprar carnes, bebidas, cereales, gas propano, frutas, hortalizas entre otros.
El préstamo anterior le sirvió para el negocio y de sus ingresos cancelar deudas y realizar gastos del hogar, compra de medicina para el esposo y pagar el crédito. Ha podido mantenerse en el mercado  gracias a los préstamos que se le dan oportunamente cuando los necesita.
texts.en:
Maria has decided to request a new loan to stock-up her business. With the loan she intends to buy meat, drinks, grains, propane gas, fruit and vegetables, among other items. 

Her previous loan benefitted her business. From the income she paid off debts, covered household expenses, bought medicine for her husband and paid off the loan. She has been able to keep herself in business thanks to the loans which have been granted to her when needed.

loans.use: to buy meat, drinks, grains, propane gas, fruit and vegetables, among other items.

loans.name: Becky

texts.en:
Becky, 29, lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado county. She is single, and has two children ages four and seven. They are in school and live at home.

For the past three years she been running a beauty salon in her community.  She got the money from her oldest boyfriend to start this business. 

Becky is requesting a loan to purchase more artificial hair, etc. for her business.  She wishes to buy land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more artificial hair, etc. for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for his general store.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 19 years old and lives in the town of Sironko in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married, with one child. For the past three years, Esther  has been working hard to manage her second-hand clothing store.

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes and boost the business.  It will help Esther generate greater profits and improve her standard of living. Esther hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Esther is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and boost the business.

loans.name: Maria Dora

texts.es:
María,  tiene un negocio de venta de ropa  y crianza de aves de corral. Ella es madre soltera y vive actualmente con su familia, su mama y sus 3 hijos de edades 19, 15 y 8 años, 2 de ellos estudian y el otro trabaja. 
María se dedica  a la venta de ropa variada, pantalones, camisas, blusas y lo hace  de forma ambulante en el cantón,también realiza actividades agropecuarias como crianza de cerdos y granja de pollos de engorde, dicho trabajo lo lleva acabo desde hace 4 años; además vende antojitos y se dedica a hacer oficios varios del hogar. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más pollos para incrementar la granja y también comprarles el concentrado requerido. 
El préstamo le ayudara a tener un negocio mas amplio que le permitirá mejorar las condiciones de vida tanto personal como para sus hijos. Uno de los riesgos que podría tener es una posible enfermedad en los pollos. Su sueño es crear un negocio rentable que le ayude a obtener mas ingresos económicos y así seguir trabajando para brindarles a sus hijos una buena educación y alimentación.
texts.en:
Maria has a business selling clothing and raising farm birds. She is a single mother and presently lives with her family -- her mother and her 3 children, ages 19, 15, and 8 -- two of whom are studying and the other is working.

Maria sells a variety of clothing, including pants, shirts, and blouses. She does this on the streets of her canton. She also carries out stock-breeding activities, such as raising and fattening pigs and chickens. She has done the latter for some 4 years. In addition, Maria sells snacks and does various tasks around the house.  

This loan will be invested in purchasing more chickens in order to enlarge her farm and, also, to buy the chicken feed required. The loan will help Maria to expand her business, and that will improve their conditions of life, her own as well as her children's. One of the risks she could face is the possibility of illness among the chickens.

Maria's dream is to create a profitable business, helping her obtain more income and, thus, continue working to offer her children a good education and proper nourishment.

loans.use: to buy more chickens to increase her poultry farm, plus more chicken feed.

loans.name: Lasha

texts.en:
Lasha is 23 years old. He lives in Rokhi village, Baghdati district, with his 47-year-old father and retired grandparents. Lasha requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The family has a milk cow and a vineyard. They are milking the cow to make cheese. From the harvested grapes, they are making vodka, and they sell it all locally at the markets to get a small monthly income.

Lasha requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Lasha wants to build a greenhouse. He will purchase all the needed building materials and vegetable seeds (tomato, cucumber and greens). Lasha and his father will cultivate the land and plant the seeds; after the plants have grown, they will harvest the product and sell them locally at the markets. This will significantly increase the family's income, and he will be able to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seeds and building materials for the greenhouse.

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is a 36-year-old married woman, the mother of two children. She has been working in the Hookah business since 2010.  She has a small cafe which is a supportive income source for her family. Rana helps her husband in all of their family's expenses, and is well-known in her region.

In her cafe she sells a special Hookah (known as Arguileh, which is a tobacco-based item with special added tastes to please customers).
To increase her income and her family's standard of living, Rana started a new business with daily income.  She opened a small grocery store, for which she requested a loan to support from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. 

This loan will be invested to increase her inventory of canned food and sweets to meet customer's needs.  She is making sure that her shop will met the needs of her customers in a very attractive way.

In the beginning she didn't have a lot of customers, but today she is well-known in the region, and her happy face and special customer service are the best things she can provide.

She hopes to keep on expanding her businesses as much as she can to keep on providing her family with the best standard of living ever.

loans.use: To support her newly established business with special canned food and sweets

loans.name: Alaisha

texts.en:
Alisha is lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children; three of her children go to school. She has one additional family member, a sister. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

Alisha sells green bananas, sweet potatoes, cassava and fruit in the market. She gets additional income from rental houses. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 2,300,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy boxes of oranges, watermelon, pineapples, bunches of green bananas, sacks of sweet potatoes and cassava. 

Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals are to buy a truck for transporting her stock to the market and also to start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more green bananas, sweet potatoes, and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Algin

texts.en:
Algin is a 28-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She is from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than eight years now.

Algin is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets. With this, they will be able to improve their fishing business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Bintu

texts.en:
Bintu is a 27-year-old woman who lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado County. She is a college student. She is married and has a three-year-old child who attends school. 

For the past seven years she has been selling cosmetics. Sometimes it is difficult, but most of the time she realizes a profit, which she uses to sustain her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics for her business. She hopes to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella has two additional family members. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and food. 

She operates a retail shop at the market. She has been in business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 600,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy boxes of soap, sugar, cooking oil, flour, and rice. Her major business challenges are transportation, ever-increasing prices of commodities and unreliable electricity. Her goals are to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of soap, sugar, cooking oil, flour and rice.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a married man with three children living in Kagadi, Uganda. For three years, he has been in the produce business. He also farms and has a motorcycle for a transport business. He set up this business to support his family and himself. 

He hopes to construct a good residential house and educate his children, while his business dream is to own a food store that can sustainably supply the region despite the challenges of inadequate capital. Simon intends to use the loan to buy maize and groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Gulrakat

texts.en:
Gulrakat is 31 years old. She is divorced and does not have any children. She lives with her parents. She is a seller in the food shop and gets a small salary. She wants to organize her own business by sewing the national women's dresses. She is a good master. She studied at the course of "To Get Ahead" in the women's organization and got a certificate. She will manage the business perfectly, as she is a hardworking woman. 

She wants to organize her business quickly, but she needs to buy a new sewing machine and fabrics. She is asking for a loan of $600 USD to buy a sewing machine and fabrics. She promises to make her payments on time. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabrics for organizing her new business.

loans.name: Regie

texts.en: Regie is a fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He needs a loan to buy fishing nets, floaters, and fish hooks. With this, he will be able to improve his fishing business and augment his income. In the future, Regie hopes to make his business a success.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, floaters, and fish hooks.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en: Hadjah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with two children, and one of her children goes to school. She has no additional family members. She sells green bananas and charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She also earns additional income washing people’s clothes in the neighborhood. She has been in business for the last three years. She works six days a week. Hadjah requested a loan in the amount of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas and bags of charcoal to sell. Her major business challenges are transportation and the seasonality of her goods. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and to build rental houses. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas and bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is 44 years old, from Nyahururu, and married with two children who are both in school.

Abraham used his first loan well, and repaid  it without much difficulty. He is now applying for his second loan, to buy more stock of groceries like beans, peas, and raw bananas to sell to his customers.

He hopes to see his business expand in the near future, and to be able to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries like beans, peas, and raw bananas for his store.

loans.name: Juan Boanerges

texts.es:
El señor Boanerges es originario de san Rafael del sur, Nicaragua. Trabaja para una empresa del estado como guarda de seguridad tiene cinco años de laborar, es casado su esposa tiene una pequeña  ventecita de granos básicos en su casa de habitación, tienen cuatro hijos todos casados mayores de edad.


solicita un  financiamiento para mejoras de su casa terminar de construir la cocina de su casa.
Se siente muy bien trabajar con ceprodel ya que con todos los créditos que le han otorgado los ha invertido en casa poco a poco la ido mejorado.

Agradece a  ceprodel y kiva, ya que sin este apoyo hay personas como Juan Boanerges  de bajos recursos, que han llegado a ser realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Mr. Boanerges is a native of San Rafeal del Sur, Nicaragua. For the past five years he has worked as a security guard for a government-run business. He is married. His wife has a small stall located in their home which sells basic grains. They have four children, all of whom are adults and married.

He is requesting a loan to pay for home renovations; to finish building the kitchen in his home.

He feels very good to be working with Ceprodel. He has invested all of the loans they have given him into his house which has been improving little by little.

He is grateful to Ceprodel and Kiva. With their support, people with low incomes like Juan Boanerges have been able to make their dreams a reality.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, ceramics, cement and tiles.

loans.name: Alfredo Patricio

texts.es:
Alfredo es un hombre de 38 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su esposa y sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Alfredo no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Seco de Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Alfredo trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de limpieza, adicionalmente en su vivienda vende bebidas, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Alfredo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un pequeño puesto de ventas en el mercado central de su ciudad, de esta manera Alfredo podrá conseguir mayor cantidad de clientes, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en: Alfredo is 38 years old. He lives in the town of Pisco with his wife and their two small children, whom he loves very dearly, and who are his main reason for living. He is very nice, hard-working, and enthusiastic. Together with his wife, they do everything in their power to make ends meet. Unfortunately, due to his economic situation and the need to start working at a very young age, Alfredo was unable to study business management, which is what he would have liked to do. In his spare time, he likes to listen to music, and sometimes cooks a delicious chicken dish called 'seco de pollo', which he shares with his family. On his own initiative, sparing no efforts, and with admirable dedication, Alfredo works in his own tiny shop that sells cleaning products. He also sells drinks at his house. He works every day for about ten hours and attributes his success to his amiability towards customers. Alfredo is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since, thanks to their help, he will be able to buy a small stall at his town's central market. He hopes this will help him attract more customers and keep working towards his great dream of expanding his shop.

loans.use: to buy a stall at the local market.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa, a 39-year-old woman, lives in West Point which is one of the most populated and well known market areas in Montserrado county. She did not attend school. She is married with two children that live at home. She has been selling dried fish in the local market since 1991. Sometimes business is slow, but most of the times she earns a profit and she use it to sustain her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dried fish for her business, and she hopes to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known market areas in Montserrado county. She is 26 years old, a high school graduate, and she is married with three children between 2 and 10 which are in school and live at home. For the past year she has been operating a shop in her community where she sells cold water, rice, pepper, soap, vita, and others items. She received a little amount from her husband to start this business, and she learned the business from her mother. She likes her business because she makes a profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase cold water, rice, pepper, soap, vita, and others items to expand her business inventory. Her plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase cold water, rice, pepper, soap, vita, and others items to expand her market inventory.

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra is a 66-year-old married woman, and mother of two children. She has been working at her convenience store since 1996. Zahra is a hard worker who has been working to make sure that her family is getting what they need, and at the same time fulfilling her customers’ needs.
Zahra is well known in the region because of her good reputation and hard work. Today she is applying for her 12th loan cycle from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, who has been the main supporter in helping her to expand her business and secure its continuity. Zahra's previous loans were used to add new products to her business, the same reason why she is applying now. She will invest it in increasing her merchandise with special spring and summer beverages.
She hopes to keep on supporting her family and developing her business at the same time.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with special spring and summer beverages.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Renacer” está conformado por 08 mujeres trabajadores y responsables que con el fruto de sus esfuerzos han sacado adelante a sus familias. Ella Maritza de  54 años, casada con 02 hijos actualmente sigue apoyando a 01 de ellos. Hace más de 08 años que se dedica al alquiler de cabinas de internet, contando actualmente con 12 máquinas, poco a poco ha logrado mejorar su negocio pues también ofrece golosinas y útiles escolares. Se siente feliz con los que ha logrado. Ver a sus hijos profesionales es su mayor deseo. Con el fin de seguir mejorando solicitó el crédito ya que comprará útiles escolares como cuadernos, lapiceros, fólderes entre otros. El grupo agradece a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Maritza se encuentra en la parte posterior es la primera del lado derecho y viste polo celeste.
texts.en: The group 'Renacer' (meaning 'rebirth') is comprised of eight hard-working and responsible women, who managed, through all their hard work, to improve their families' lot in life. Maritza is 54 years old. She is married and has two children, one of whom she still provides for. She has owned an internet café for eight years. It currently boasts 12 machines, and Maritza also sells sweets and school supplies, a recent improvement. She is very happy with her achievements. Her greatest wish is to see her children have a career. She asks for a loan in order to keep improving her business, and she will use the funds to buy school supplies to sell, such as notebooks, pens, folders, and the like. The group wishes to thank all lenders. Maritza is in the background of the picture, the first one from the right, wearing a light blue shirt.

loans.use: to buy school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Willian Raul

texts.es:
Willian es un hombre de 28 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Willian no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Computación e Informática, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Willian trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, adicionalmente tiene un pequeño negocio de crianza y venta de conejos, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Willian se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la construcción de un corral para sus conejos, él podrá comprar cañas, palos de madera y malla metálica para diseñar un corral adecuado para conejos, de esta manera Wiilian espera incrementar la cantidad de conejos para su venta y en desea lograr su gran sueño de poder estudiar una carrera profesional y poco a poco desea salir adelante.
texts.en: Willian is 28 years old. He is single, and lives in the town of Cañete, in the district of Imperial. He is a very nice, hard-working, and enthusiastic person, who always wants to do his best. Unfortunately, due to his economic situation and the need to start working at a very young age, Willian was unable to study information technology, which is what he would have liked to do. In his spare time, he likes to play football with his friends, and sometimes cooks a delicious chicken-and-rice dish called 'arroz con pollo', which he shares with his family. On his own initiative, sparing no efforts, and with admirable dedication, Willian works as a labourer on a farm in his town. He also has a small business of his own: he raises and sells rabbits. He works every day for about twelve hours and attributes his success to his efforts and his amiability towards other people. Willian is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since, thanks to their help, he will be able to build an adequate enclosure for his rabbits. To this end, he will buy cane, wooden sticks, and wire mesh. He hopes this will help him raise and sell more rabbits and keep working towards his great dream of learning a profession and improving his lot in life.

loans.use: to build an enclosure.

loans.name: Patricial

texts.en: Patricial, a 25 year old lady, lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known market areas in Montserrado county. She lives with her four children. Patricial did not attend school and she is single. Her three year old child attends school and lives at home. For the past three years she has been selling bananas, plantains, and oranges from a table in the local market. Sometimes business is slow, but most of the times she realizes profit which she uses to sustain her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bananas, plantains and oranges to expand her sales. She hopes to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas, plantains and oranges to expand her sales.

loans.name: Wilman Antonio

texts.es:
Wilman, solicita otro préstamo porque necesita invertir en el sector agropecuario. Este lo utilizara para pagar arrendamiento de 5 manzanas de terreno por $500.00 y comprara abono para cultivar jícamas y maíz, entre otros gastos que conlleva el cultivo.
El crédito anterior le permitió incrementar sus ingresos y también para la compra de la alimentación para el hogar, a traves de la produccion del cultivo. Aumentaron sus ingresos económicos gracias a la inversión que realizo con el crédito de KIVA, se encuentra muy bien de salud al igual su familia.
texts.en:
Wilman is requesting another loan because he needs to invest in his farming activities. Five hundred dollars of this loan will be used to pay the rent on five plots of land and the rest will be used to pay for compost for cultivating jicama and corn and other expenses related to growing these crops.

His previous loan enabled him to increase his earnings and also buy food for his household as a result of producing his crop. Wilman’s income increased thanks to the investment made with the Kiva loan. His family is also doing very well in terms of health.

loans.use: to pay the rent on five plots of farmland and to buy compost.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a married man aged 42, from Kyamate, Ntungamo municipality. He is a professional builder but also trades in goats as an additional source of income. 

His capital not being enough, he decided to come to Ugafode for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to help him buy more goats and also pay tuition for his children. 

He hopes the goats will grow and will then be sold when they have increased in value.This will help him to meet his other family needs. He is a hard-working man. In the photograph is Daniel with his wife (above), then below the third person is the Ugafode staff at the goat farm.

loans.use: To buy goats.

loans.name: Tengiz

texts.en:
Tengiz is 50 years old. He lives in Senaki, West Georgia with his 42 year old wife, retired mother, retired aunt and three children, all of whom go to school. Tengiz requested a loan for his family business start-up from local financial institutions several times without any success. His loan request was rejected because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. Tengiz is working in an ice-cream shop and as a mechanic; he gets a small monthly salary. In addition, his family has income from the monthly pensions of his mother and aunt. 

Tengiz requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. His loan request was approved via the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, which do not have access to credit products as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to low income. With the received credit, Tengiz will purchase a metal protective grid used for smoking fish. The demand for smoked fish is high in the villages, so Tengiz hopes his business will be profitable. The profit will be used to reinvest in the same business. If successful, Tengiz will have more income and will be able to provide better living conditions for his big family.

loans.use: to purchase a metal protective grid to smoke fish.

loans.name: Shushanik

texts.en: Shushanik is from Armavir region. She lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and grandchild, Marianna, who is 4 years old. Together with her family, Shushanik is involved in agriculture. She runs a farm which currently includes 40 chickens and 3 cows. Shushanik also owns a plot of agricultural land where 45 apricot, 25 plum and 30 apple trees grow. The whole family works hard to gather good harvests and sell the produce in the local market. Agriculture is the only source of income for this family. As it is very hard for Shushanik to sustain her family and cover its basic costs, she would like to expand her farm. With the help of the loan, Shushanik will purchase 3 bulls, livestock feed and she will renovate her greenhouse which is too old. The loan is very important for Shushanik to expand her farm and ensure a better life for her family.

loans.use: to pay for three bulls, livestock feed and to renovate her greenhouse.

loans.name: Ajat

texts.en:
In the photo posted, Ajat stands on the left, while Arya, Ruma's Field Officer, is on the right. 

Ajat runs a small stall which sells mobile phone airtime credits. Recently, he has been working as a house guard/security guard. His wife is a housewife, and they have three persons living in their house. 

Ajat joined Ruma in May 2012 because he trusts Ruma and wanted to explore other business opportunities in selling mobile phone airtime credits. He still feels really excited to expand his business of selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments for customers. 

For the last month, he has had around $90/day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues, he needs a loan of more working capital in order to be able to do transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie, who lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known market areas in Montserrado county, is a 31-year-old single woman. For the past 11 years now, Mamie has been selling bread, biscuits and soft drinks in her community. Although she makes only a small income, she enjoys the interaction with her customers, and her profits enable her to buy food for her family.

Mamie is requesting a loan to purchase more bread, biscuits and soft drinks for her business. In the near future, she hopes to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase bread, biscuits and soft drinks for her business,

loans.name: Tini

texts.en:
In this photo, Tini is on the left, and one of her customers is on the right. 

Tini runs a small stall which sells snacks, drinks and mobile phone airtime credits, and also services bill payments for customers. Recently, she has been working as a kindergarten teacher. She has four persons living in her house. 

Tini joined Ruma eight months ago because she wants to increase her income and is interested in expanding business opportunities by selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments for customers. 

For the last three months, she has had around $30-$60/day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues, she needs a loan for more working capital in order to be able to do transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Pedro Roberto

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre de 48 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con su esposa y sus dos hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Pedro no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Seco de Cordero para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Pedro trabaja como chofer de taxi, brindando servicios de transporte en su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien porque conoce las zonas donde encontrar mayor cantidad de pasajeros.
Pedro se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mantenimiento de su vehículo, ya que sea cambiar las llantas y amortiguadores de su vehículo, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su empresa de taxis.
texts.en: Pedro is 48 years old. He lives in the town of Nazca with his wife and their two children, whom he loves very dearly, and who are his main reason for living. He is very nice, hard-working, and enthusiastic. Together with his wife, they do everything in their power to make ends meet. Unfortunately, due to his economic situation and the need to start working at a very young age, Pedro was unable to learn a profession, which is what he would have liked to do. In his spare time, he likes to listen to music, and sometimes cooks a delicious lamb dish called 'seco de cordero', which he shares with his family. On his own initiative, sparing no efforts, and with admirable dedication, Pedro works as a taxi driver in his town. He works every day for about twelve hours and attributes his success to his knowledge of where to find fares. Alfredo is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since, thanks to their help, he will be able to perform maintenance on his taxi, such as changing the tires and the shock absorbers. This will help him keep working towards his great dream of having his own taxi company.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his taxi.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramón, tiene un negocio de venta de frutas y verduras. El vive con su esposa y  sus 2 hijos que ya están el a escuela, las edades de ellos 8 y 10 años.
El negocio surge hace 10 años como fuente de ingresos para su familia y con el fin de obtener  entradas de dinero para incrementar el negocio. El prestamo le ayudara a comprar melones, sandias, naranjas, entre otras en grandes cantidades.
La inversión le permitirá llevar el sustento diario de su familia y a tener una mejorar calidad de vida. Su objetivo es remodelar la casa para así optimizar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Ramón has a business selling fruits and vegetables. He lives with his wife and two children, ages 10 and 8, who are now in school. He started his business ten years ago to have a source of income for his family and to have money coming in to expand the business.   

Ramón will use the loan to buy melons, watermelons, oranges and other fruits in large quantities. The loan will help him provide for his family’s daily needs and to improve their quality of life. His plan is to renovate his home to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy melons, watermelons, oranges and other fruits in large quantities.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 36 years old and from Ndunyu Njeru. She is married with four children who are between 14 years and six years old.

Naomi has a farming business that she has been doing for the past two years and has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy fertilizers and seedlings to use in her farm.

She hopes to be the leading farmer in her area.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is a trader. He sells households goods to shops in the Shirak and Lori regions. He has provided them with goods in more than 135 shops. The necessary merchandise he obtains from Yerevan’s wholesale markets and transports them to the Lori area and sells them to shops.
 
Armen is 31 years old and also works in the Ministry of Justice of the Republic of Armenia as a specialist in the security department. He is married and lives with his mother and wife. Armen’s father now works in the Russian Federation and shares with his family in Armenia their monthly expenses. 

Armen is requesting a loan from Kiva to buy a new batch of household goods. Armen is a successful young businessman who is important, because he is the main provider of households goods in north Armenia.

loans.use: To buy a new batch of household goods

loans.name: Sara Esmeralda

texts.es:
Sara, requiere de un nuevo crédito por la facilidad de pago que la institución brinda y que poco a poco ha ido incrementado su negocio. Lo necesita para comprar mas productos tales como frijol, arroz, azúcar, etc.
Con el préstamo anterior incremento el producto de la tienda y mejores ganancias por las ventas que realiza. Las circunstancias han cambiado porque ha ido mejorando su  utilidad y así estar mas solventes.
texts.en: Sara asks for a new loan because she finds it easy to work with the field partner, and because her business has been growing steadily. She needs the funds to buy more products such as broad beans, rice, sugar, etc. With her previous loan, Sara was able to improve her inventory, and thus her daily sales and her income. Her economic situation is getting better, since her business is more useful to customers, which enabled her to have more funds at her disposal.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Yesica Janet

texts.es:
La señora Yesica es contadora trabaja para una empresa del estado tiene cinco años de laborar.
Es felizmente casada, su esposo trabaja para una financiera.

Con mucho esfuerzo y empeño han venido ahorrando y con los financiamientos que le han otorgado han podido construir su casa de habitación.

Ahora necesita un financiamiento para hacer una habitación más en su casa ya que la casa es pequeña.

espera le sea otorgado el financiamiento para sufragar las necesidades en el hogar y poder tener su casa propia. agradece de antemano el apoyo.
texts.en: Yesica is an accountant who has been working for a state enterprise for five years. She is happily married, and her husband works for a financial institution. She has worked hard and has been saving. She has been able to build her house with financing. Now she needs a loan to add a room to her small house. She hopes to receive this loan so that she can pay household expenses and have her own home. She thanks the lenders in advance.

loans.use: to buy construction materials: stone, iron, and cement.

loans.name: Ephrance

texts.en: Ephrance is married with two children and only one of her children goes to school.  She also takes care of additional family members (a young brother). She has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for 3 years. She sells to all categories of people on a retail basis. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Besides this charcoal business she also sells firewood and is also a part-time teacher at a nearby school seven days a week.  Her major business challenges include the transportation of charcoal and seasonality. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to own a delivery van to ease in the transportation of charcoal. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, utility bills, and school fees for her child.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Najla

texts.en:
Najla is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children. She has been working in a tailoring business for 25 years. In 1990, she started her own business to help her husband, who works as a taxi driver, in covering their big family's expenses and paying for their needs.

Najla is a hard-worker with an excellent reputation in her area, and she is recommended by all of her customers. She tailors almost all types of wedding and special occasion dresses, in addition to special requests.
 
She is applying for her third loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy a new tailoring machine that costs $500 and pay for the necessary maintenance for her husband's car, which will cost him $500, and this is the only business he knows how to do.

Najla is a good-standing borrower with a special reputation. She hopes to keep on developing her business and increasing her income.

loans.use: To buy a new tailoring machine and pay for the necessary maintenance for her husband's car

loans.name: Maura María

texts.es:
La Señora Maura María es originaria del municipio san Rafael del sur Nicaragua, es comerciante venta de ropa usada en su casa de habitación tiene un espacio donde coloca su mercadería. 

Es una señora luchadora, mayor de edad, pero le gusta estar siempre entretenida sentirse útil.
 No le gusta depender de nadie, le gusta trabajar y saber que tiene sus propios ingresos para sufragar sus gastos y necesidades del hogar.

Tiene tres hijos mayores de edad casados y le ayudan para su alimentación. Uno de ellos vive en su casa y una nieta.
 Tiene  casa propia pequeña  humilde pero con mucho calor humano.

se siente muy agradecida con ceprodel y kiva por todos los financiamientos que me han brindado y ayudado muchísimo en su crecimiento como comerciante.
texts.en: Maura María comes from the commune of San Rafael, in the south of Nicaragua. She sells used clothing in her home, where she has a space dedicated to selling her merchandise. She might be a senior citizen, but she is no less full of fighting spirit for it. She likes her business because it gives her something to do and makes her feel useful. She likes working because it allows her a measure of independence, knowing that she has her own income with which to pay for household and personal expenses alike. She has three children, all adults and married, who help her make ends meet. One of the couples lives at her house with their daughter. Maura María's owns the house she lives in, which is full of warmth and companionship despite its small size. She is very grateful to field partner Ceprodel and to Kiva for all the loans, which have helped her immensely with her business.

loans.use: to buy various types of used clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Rosa Yanet

texts.es:
Rosa, quiere optar por un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de comprar comida para el ganado e insumos para la elaboración de pupusas. Con ello quiere comprar concentrado para las reces, vitaminas así también para las pupusas; quesillo, harina, aceite, chicharrón entre otros. 
Con la inversión que tuvo anteriormente mejoro el negocio de ventas, logro vitaminar el ganado y debido a ello ya posee otras más. La familia se ha podio sustentar, ingresos incrementaron al igual aumento en la ganadería; su sueño es obtener un chalet también mejorar en su casa y ofrecer un mejor cuidado a sus hijos.
texts.en: Rosa wants a new loan because she needs to buy animal feed for her cattle as well as ingredients to prepare 'pupusas', a traditional dish consisting of a corn tortilla filled with beans, cheese, and meat. She will buy feed and vitamines for her cattle. To make pupusas, she needs cheese, flour, oil, and fried pork rinds, among others. With her previous loan, she improved her pupusa sales, and was able to keep her cattle healthy with vitamins, which is why she was able to buy more cattle. She managed to feed her family thanks to her improved earnings. Her dream is to own a sales post for domestic products, to make improvements to her house, and to give her children a better life.

loans.use: to buy animal feed as well as ingredients to make the food she sells.

loans.name: Nasira

texts.ru: Насире 49 лет, замужем. Мать 3 детей. Насира начала заниматься животноводством, ставшим основным источником финансирования ее семьи. Насира начала свой бизнес со стартовой суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS) в 1992 году после развала СССР,  смогла развить свое хозяйство. В настоящее время содержат хорошее хозяйство  дойная корова, МРС. На вырученные деньги от животноводства построили хорошие условия для содержания скота, построили пристройку к дому.
