Ежемесячная прибыль от бизнеса составляет 15,000 сом (KGS) от перепродажи скота и сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Скот она откармливает и продает на местном скотском рынке. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Насира обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на приобретения ГСМ и удобрения для весенне полевых работ. Доходы Насира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, а в будущем -мечтает купить автомобиль.
texts.en: Nasira is 49 years old and she is married with three children.  She raises livestock as the main source of income for her family.  She started this business with 15,000 som (KGS) in 1992, after the fall of the USSR, so she could improve her family's finances.  Today she has a good farm with a dairy cow, sheep and goats.  With the income she has earned from raising livestock, Nasira has created good conditions in which to raise her animals, and she built an extension to her house.  Her monthly income from her business is 15,000 som (KGS) from the sale of livestock and farming activities.  She raises her livestock and sells them at the local market.  With the goal of increasing her business further, Nasira has turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to purchase fuel and fertilizer for her spring field work.  Nasira plans to use her income to increase her head of livestock, and in the future she dreams of buying a car.

loans.use: To prepare for spring field work, to purchase fuels for tractor and fertilizers

loans.name: Mayra Del Socorro

texts.es: Mayra de 66 años, casada, madre de 5 hijos, de una familia muy humilde y trabajadora inicio un negocio de panadería hace 32 años con su esposo ya que su esposo era panadero y necesitaban salir adelante comenzaron con muy poco pero con sacrificio y esfuerzo han podido salir adelante, es una panadería que abastece su comunidad y por su experiencia ya son muy conocidos, el lugar donde se encuentra la panadería a través de los años se ha deteriorado y ella quiere mejorarla ya que está ubicada en su casa de habitación. Mayra solicita este crédito para hacer unos arreglos a la panadería como cambiar parte del techo y hacer una pequeña pared ya que se acerca el invierno y su panadería se puede inundar y ocasionara graves pérdidas en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mayra is 66 years old, married and has five children. She is from a humble and hardworking family. Her husband is a baker, so 32 years ago Mayra and her husband started a bakery because they needed to get ahead. They started with very little, but with sacrifice and effort they have been able to get ahead.

Mayra and her husband supply their community with baked goods, and they are very well known for their experience. The premises of the bakery – which is located in Mayra’s home – have deteriorated over the years, and Mayra would like to repair it. Mayra is requesting this loan to do some repairs to the bakery such as change part of the roof and construct a small wall. Mayra says these repairs are needed because winter is approaching and the bakery could flood, which would cause serious losses for her business.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheeting, iron, cement, blocks, sand and other materials to construct a wall and repair the roof of her bakery.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a 52-year-old food kiosk owner in Voi, Kenya. She is married, and the husband provides additional income since they support two people. She has been in this business for the last four years and has done great.

This marks her fourth loan with KADET LTD to purchase wheat flour, beans, and cooking fat for her kiosk. She will use the anticipated profit to pay her loan, and she hopes to expand her business into a full-time cafeteria.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, beans, and cooking fat for her kiosk

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: Francisco de 52 años, casado, padre de 5 hijos, Gracias a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica venta de verduras y a la crianza y venta de cerdos a los comerciantes de la localidad. La cual lo utiliza para elaborar comidas típicas de la región. el diariamente sale a las comunidades aledañas a comprar cerdos al mejor precio para la futura venta. Y que en un futuro no muy lejano obtener mejores ingresos, negocio que lo tiene desde hace 7 años, El se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, responsable, lo cual lo ha demostrado en los créditos anteriores en cuanto a la responsabilidad de sus pagos en tiempo y forma. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria cuando aun era joven él se dedicó a este negocio al igual que también se dedica a la agricultura  siembra  cultivos como yuca, quiquiste entre otras verduras del sector.  Francisco solicita el crédito para compra de cerdos y agradece a los inversionistas Kiva que gracias a ellos ha mejorado mucho su negocio
texts.en:
Francisco, 52, is married and the father of five children. With enthusiasm and the desire to get ahead, he sells vegetables and raises pigs to sell locally. His products are used in local dishes. Every day he goes to neighboring communities to buy pigs at a good price to resell later. He hopes to soon have higher income from the business he started seven years ago.

He is hardworking and responsible, which he demonstrated by making his previous loan payments on time. He lacked the money to go to college. He started at this profession at a young age. He also plants crops such as yuca, quiquiste, and other local vegetables. Francisco is applying for a loan to buy pigs and thanks the Kiva lenders for helping him improve his business so much.

loans.use: to buy pigs to sell.

loans.name: Ivania

texts.es: Doña Ivania es una mujer con 49 años de edad, soltera y madre de dos hijos. Vive en unión libre con el padre de sus hijos. Muy trabajadora y esforzada. Hace seis años se vió en la necesidad de generar ingresos al hogar, debido a que su compañero tuvo un accidente laboral y quedó incapacitado. Desde ahí se dedica a hacer repostería en general sin descuidar a su familia. Cuenta con la ayuda económica de uno de sus hijos. Le va muy bien, gracias al buen trato que le brinda a sus clientes y a la buena calidad de sus productos. Es primera vez que solicita financiamiento a la Fundación para su negocio.
texts.en: Ivania is 49 years old. She is not married, but is in a civil union with the father of her two children. She is a very hard-working person, who spares no efforts. Six years ago, she saw she would have to work to earn money for the home, since her partner had an accident at work and became invalid. She has been a baker since, without neglecting her family. She can count on one of her children for financial support. Her business is going well, thanks to her amiability towards customers and the high quality of her products. This is the first time she asks the field partner for a loan.

loans.use: to buy an oven and raw materials.

loans.name: Nercy

texts.es: La Sra. Nercy tiene 49 años casada tiene tres hijos de las edades de seis, nueve y doce años, ella se dedica  a la confección de prendas de vestir, ella es cliente antigua en nuestra institución, en el momento de la evaluación del crédito la Sra. Nercy demostró una actitud buena, Cortez y amable, la Sra. Nercy, vive en el Municipio  de la Guardia, de la ciudad de Santa Cruz Bolivia, ella en la actualidad vive con su esposo, ambos trabajan confeccionando chamarras y variedad de prendas de vestir, la Sra. Nercy, saco este crédito para la compra de telas para surtir su taller y entregar un importante pedido, uno de sus metas es comprar  su propia casa  y ahí establecer su taller más amplio, perseverando siempre en el trabajo piensa lograr sus objetivos.
texts.en: Nercy is 49 years old, married, and has three children, aged 6, 9, and 12. She sews clothes and has worked with the field partner for a very long time. She has always been punctual in her repayments. A very polite and amiable woman, Nercy lives in the neighbourhood of La Guardia in the town of Santa Cruz, in Bolivia. She lives with her husband. They both sew different types of clothes, including jackets. Nercy took out this loan in order to buy cloth wholesale. Her aim is to have more cloth in stock and to fulfil a large order. One of her goals is to buy a house of her own in which to have a bigger workshop. She is confident that hard work will help her achieve this goal.

loans.use: to buy cloth wholesale.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, le surge la necesidad de un nuevo préstamo para invertir más en el negocio, en la compra de ganado y mejorar en la agricultura. Este crédito le servirá para la compra de concentrado para la ganadería y adquirir una vaca.
El obtuvo con el préstamo anterior un incremento en su inventario, sus ingresos y aumento en el ganado. Sus condiciones familiares se mantienen pero se han optimizado un poco las condiciones económicas.
texts.en: José needs a new loan to buy cattle and improve his farm production. He will use this loan to buy animal feed concentrate and a cow. He increased his inventory, earnings, and livestock with the previous loan. His family's status is the same, but their financial situation has improved a bit.

loans.use: to buy animal feed concentrate and a cow.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel, le surge la necesidad de optar por un nuevo crédito para invertir mas en el negocio. Este le servirá para comprar 3 cerdos, alimento para engordarlos, preparar media manzana de tierra para cultivarla.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a mejorar sus ingresos y obtener utilidades. Sus condiciones de vida han mejorado, en su familia enfrento una situacion dificil, falleció un hijo y tuvo muchos gastos, y sus condiciones económicas  se mantienen igual.
texts.en: Manuel needs another loan to invest in his business. He will use the loan to buy three pigs and feed to fatten them and to prepare his manzana of land for planting. The prior loan helped him increase earnings and profits. His living conditions improved. His family had to face a difficult situation when a son died, and the related costs were high. The family's financial situation remains the same.

loans.use: to buy three pigs and feed and to prepare his land for planting.

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
Harutyun is from Dimitrov village. His family consists of seven members: his father, mother, brother, wife, and three daughters. Harutyun is 37 years old, and has been involved in agriculture for 15 years. He keeps ten chickens, and owns a plot of agricultural land where he cultivates vegetables. As it is very difficult for Harutyun to sustain such a big family and cover its daily costs, Harutyun has applied for this loan.

With the help of the loan, he will purchase tomato and cucumber seeds. This would enable him to cultivate more vegetables, increase the harvest, and sell it in the local market. Harutyun owns a greenhouse which is too old and needs to be renovated. Additional money from the loan will be spent on renovation of the greenhouse.

This loan is very important for Harutyun to expand his agricultural activity and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for tomato and cucumber seeds, and renovate his old greenhouse.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is 47 and lives in Paynesville South, one of most populated areas in Montserrado County. She is married and her husband is a businessman; both of them have three children between 16 and 31. Only three are currently in school and live at home.

For the past five years, she has been selling charcoal in the local market. She make a good profit and has lots of customers. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her plan is to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grazing cattle.

loans.name: Tinatin

texts.en:
Tinatin is a 62-year-old retired woman. She lives in the Gori District with her 61-year-old husband. Tinatin has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, without success. Her loan request was rejected every time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The family owns an agricultural plot of land where they grow maize, nuts, plums, tomatoes, and apples. The harvested fruits and vegetables are sold locally at the markets, providing a small income for living. 

Tinatin requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program has a provision for business start-up and re-startup with credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products since they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to low income. 

With the received credit, Tinatin will purchase a milk cow. She will milk the cow to make dairy and milk products which will be sold locally at the markets and significantly grow the family income. 

In the future, Tinatin wants to reinvest profit in the same business to purchase more cows and develop her farming. This loan will give Tinatin and her husband a chance for better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius used his previous loan to purchase farm inputs and right now his monthly income from the business is KES.20,000. He is borrowing a loan of KES.80,000, which he will use to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

Pius plans to purchase a lorry with the anticipated profit from the business. This is his fifth loan and he successfully paid his previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers in preparation for the planting season.

loans.name: Teuta

texts.en:
Teuta operates a handicraft business. She makes and sells handicraft items for her local customers from her home; she has been running this business for the past six years.  Teuta is the married mother of four children ranging in age from 6 to 15.  Her husband works in construction. They all live in the southern part of Kosovo.

Teuta genuinely enjoys her work. She is requesting a loan to buy material for her work. She has been sustaining her business through her own efforts. She hopes to earn a higher income, and to expand her business in the future. 

She is happy for the financial support from Kiva lenders because it helps her to secure a stable future for her family.

loans.use: To buy material for her work.

loans.name: Nara

texts.en:
Nara is 27 years old and graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical University in faculty of Mathematics. Now she works in one of the schools in the Lori region as a teacher of mathematics and informatics. She teaches pupils not only mathematics, but also introduces them to computer and software programs. Nara also does tutorial math lessons with 10 pupils in her own house.

Nara was born and lives in Vanadzor city with her husband. She doesn't have children yet.

Nara is seeking loan amount 500.000 Armenian drams from Kiva to buy a new computer and technical literature to carry out further tutorial lessons of informatics in her house.

loans.use: To buy a new computer and technical literature to carry out tutorial lessons of informatics

loans.name: Araceli

texts.es:
La Señora Araceli es originaria de san Rafael del sur, Nicaragua, ella trabajaba en una panadería haciendo pastel por la mañana de las siete de la mañana hasta la una del día, después llegaba a su casa y empezaba a salir a visitar clientes y ofrecerle articulo para el hogar y ropa de varios estilo nuevo empezó a hacer clientela, después vio que no daba abasto solo el medio día y dejo de trabajar en la panadería y empezó en lleno a atender su negocio. 

Visita siete comarcas del municipio ofreciendo producto por encargos al crédito de un mes, ahora es increíble cuanto cliente ha podido captar. 

Se le han financiado varios créditos los cuales los ha invertido en su negocio y otra parte en su casa de habitación.

Su esposo trabaja como conductor de equipo pesado y con la ayuda de él han salido adelante con la educación de sus hijos y su casa que la han construido con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo, son personas jóvenes que han sabido trabajar y luchar por la vida a tener mejor condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Araceli is a native of San Rafael del Sur, Nicaragua. She used to work in a bakery from seven in the morning until one in the afternoon making cakes. After arriving home from the bakery, she would go back out to sell household items and various new styles of clothing to a growing number of customers. She realized that she could not keep up with her sales working only half a day, so she left her job at the bakery to work at her business full-time. 

Araceli takes orders for products on one-month terms of credit in seven districts of her municipality. She says it is incredible how many customers she has been able to attract.

Araceli says she has received other loans that she invested in her business and her home. Her husband works operating heavy machinery, and with his help they are getting ahead with the education of their children and with their home, which they have built through much effort and sacrifice. Araceli and her husband are a young couple who have learned to work and fight to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pants, T-shirts, shorts, bathing suits, shoes and sandals.

loans.name: Debora

texts.en:
Deborah is a 39-year-old firewood and charcoal vendor in Bamburi, Mombasa, Kenya. She is a married mother of five, who has been in this business for the last 10 years. She has done great; her spouse earns additional income.

This marks her fourth loan in KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more firewood and sacks of charcoal for sale. She will use the anticipated profit to repay her loan and educate her children. She hopes to live a prosperous life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood and sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Nora Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Nora es originaria del Municipio San Rafael, es comerciante tiene un tramo en el mercado municipal venta de productos artesanales como: Floreros de barro, Comales de barro, que se utilizan mucho en la zona para la elaboración de las tortillas, maseteros de barro que se utilizan para sembrar plantas, al cancillas de barro que las buscan bastante los estudiantes  para ahorrar sus monedas que le sobran cuando van al colegio, tiene variedad de producto.

También hacen piñatas compra los accesorio y sus dos hijos le ayudan a hacerla y venderlas las entregan por mayor.
Esta casada su esposo tiene un taller de mecánica en su casa, el ayuda para los gastos del hogar.

Con la ganancias de su negocio siempre lo va invirtiendo comprando mas producto y variedad para así obtener mayores ganancia he ir creciendo cada día más.

Ahora necesita otro financiamiento para invertir más producto.
texts.en:
Nora was born in the city of San Rafael. She has a stand in the city market where she sells a variety of handicrafts items such as clay vases, clay grills that are used to make tortillas, pots for plants, and clay banks that students look for so that they can save money for college. She also buy accessories to make pinatas, work her two children help with, to sell at wholesale. 

Nora is married, and her husband has a mechanics workshop in the house to help with household expenses. She always reinvests her profits in purchasing more supplies so that her profits and business keep growing. She now needs a loan to buy more supplies.

loans.use: to buy supplies for floral arrangements and pinatas: flowers, clay pots, baskets, and paper.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 32 years old and lives in Migori county, which is found in the western part of Kenya. He is married to Jane and they have four children whose ages are 16, 14, 12 and 6 years old respectively.

Richard operates a motorbike transportation business. He has been doing this business for the last four years and makes a monthly income of KES.30,000. He is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to repair the motorbike so that it returns to good condition. 

He will use the anticipated profit to accumulate and buy another motorbike to expand his business. He has a dream of expanding his business and educating his children.

loans.use: to repair his motorbike

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 35 years old and lives in Paynesville south, one of the populous areas in Montserrado County. She lives with her three children, who are between 5 to 18 years old and who are in school. Joyce is married and is a high school graduate.

For the past ten years Joyce has been running a cook shop (restaurant) in the local market. She make a lot of profit and has many customers. Joyce is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, fish meat, charcoal, vita, etc. for her business.

Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, fish meat, charcoal, and vita for her business.

loans.name: Melba Idania

texts.es:
La Señora Melba Idania  es originaria del municipio san Rafael del sur Nicaragua es profesora de educación primaria tiene seis años de trabajar para este ministerio. 

Doña Melba con una herencia del abuelo de un solar, ahorro y un financiamiento  empezó a comprar materiales de construcción para hacer su casa.
 
Esta casada tiene tres hijos menores de edad, dos de ellos en edad escolar. Tiene casa propia pequeña humilde con mucho calor humano, gracias a sus esfuerzos.

Ahora la Señora Melba ya tiene casa propia pero necesita un financiamiento para terminar de construir la parte de la cocina y otra habitación para su hijo menor.
texts.en:
Melba is a native of the municipality of San Rafael del Sur, Nicaragua. She has worked as a primary school teacher for six years.

Melba inherited a piece of land from her grandfather, and with her savings and a loan she began to buy construction materials to build her own home.

Melba is married with three young children, two of whom are school-age. She now has her own small, modest but very cozy home thanks to her efforts. She is requesting this loan to finish construction of the kitchen and to build an additional bedroom for her youngest child.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, tiles and cement blocks.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna has been involved in agriculture for 15 years already. She keeps 10 chickens, cultivates wheat and tomatoes, as well as grows apricot, peach, plum and apples trees with great love and pleasure. 

Anna is a very hardworking mother of two sons, and together with her husband, Gagik, she works hard to gather a high income and sustain her family. Anna owns a greenhouse which is too old and needs to be renovated. She has applied for this loan to renovate her old greenhouse as well as to purchase tomato seeds and fertilizer. 

The loan is very important for Anna to expand the cultivation process and gather more income, which is vital for covering her family's daily costs.

loans.use: to pay for tomato seeds and fertilizer and renovate the old greenhouse.

loans.name: Alice Doe.

texts.en:
Alice Doe. is 28 years old and lives in Paynesville South, one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County. She is married, and her husband is a businessman; both of them have a 9-year-old child who is currently in school and lives at home. 

From 2000, she has been involved in a business in the local market. She now sells artificial hair. She makes a lot of profit and has more customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more artificial hair for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase more artificial hair for her business.

loans.name: Perus

texts.en:
Perus is married with four children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. 

Perus has a retail shop and has been in this business for three years. She rents a shop and works there six days out of every week on a retail basis.  She generates additional income by running a restaurant. Her major business challenges include transportation, defaulters and seasonality. Perus aspires to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. 

She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more products such as sugar, cartons of soap, bread, rice and cooking oil.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cartons of salt, rice and cooking oil

loans.name: Fitim

texts.en:
Fitim is 23 years old and single. He lives in the southern part of Kosovo and is very friendly and very hardworking. 

Fitim has worked in construction installing ceramics for more than six years. He installs electricity and ceramic tiles for new homes and for those who want to make renovations. Fitim is very experienced and very successful in his business. He begins his work day very early each morning.

Fitim is now requesting a loan to buy a vehicle for his job. The loan will help him to work faster and more easily. He hopes in the future to expand his business even more.

He is really appreciative of support from Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy a vehicle for his job

loans.name: Brenda Esmeralda

texts.es:
Brenda, solicita un nuevo préstamo para seguir invirtiendo en la compra de merienda y a la vez hacer más grande la productividad de pollos de engorde. Este le servirá para la compra de maíz, leña, gas, concentrados, pollos y granza.
Con el crédito anterior logro hacerse de otro tipo de negocio, lo cual es la crianza de pollos, crecer económicamente así como también continua educando a sus hijos y darles lo necesario. Ha obtenido mejores ingresos económicos y a la vez otra actividad como lo es la crianza y venta de pollos de engorde, el fortalecimiento de las condiciones de vida de su familia ha mejorado (salud, educación, etc.).
texts.en: Brenda is requesting a new loan to continue investing in the production and sale of snack foods and likewise in increasing the productivity of her broiler chickens. The loan will be used to purchase corn, firewood, gas, concentrates, chicken, and feed. With her previous loan, Brenda was able to start another business raising chickens, giving her more economic stability and allowing her to continue educating her children and providing for their needs. She has been earning more money, and with her new business raising broiler chickens, the quality of her family's living conditions has improved (health, education, etc.).

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, gas, concentrates, chickens, and feed.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina makes and sells handicraft items to earn her living. She is the married mother of one child who is 8 years old. Her husband is an erector. Sabina operates her business from her home in Kosovo. Customers visit her every day. She has run this business for ten years and it is going very well, thanks to the committed effort she puts into her work.

She has requested a loan in order to buy materials for making her handicraft items. Sabina's goal is to improve the living conditions of her family and to save money toward her children's education.


She is grateful to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy materials for handicraft items

loans.name: Esin

texts.en:
Esin is a hair dresser. She is the married mother of three children between the ages of 6 and 16 years old. Her husband works in construction with a very low salary. Esin started to work as a hair dresser 10 years ago. 

She is requesting a loan to do a renovation of her hair dress salon. The loan will help her develop her business and increase the number of her clients. 

Esin uses her income to support her family. Esin notes that this loan will improve her business and allow her to attract more clients. In the future, she plans to develop her business more. She is grateful to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To renovate her hair dress salon

loans.name: Eveling Isabel

texts.es:
Eveling es una microempresaria que tiene su pequeño taller de costura donde elabora una variedad de prendas de vestir como blusas, faldas, vestidos, entre otras cosas.

Gracias a su  excelente trabajo ha mantenido a su clientela contenta con los trabajos que realiza, por lo que actualmente necesita una fuente de financiamiento para comprar tela y atender algunos encargos de sus clientes.

Antes de tener su negocio personal se dedicaba al trabajo de domestica donde obtenía ingresos para los gastos del hogar.

Por iniciativa propia decide estudiar un curso de costura donde aprende el arte de elaborar ropa.
Es madre soltera y con muchos deseos de superación personal.

El día sábado estudia en la universidad la carrera de licenciatura en psicología, estudios que le permitirá crecer profesionalmente.
texts.en:
Eveling is a small- businesswoman who has a small sewing workshop where she makes a variety of garments such as blouses, skirts, and dresses, among other things. 

Thanks to the excellent job she does she has kept her customers happy with the work she carries out, so she currently needs a source of funding to buy fabric and to attend to some of her customers' orders.

Before she had her own business she did domestic work where she earned income for the household expenses.

On her own initiative she decided to study a sewing course where she learned the art of making clothing. She is a single mother and has a great desire for self-improvement. 

On Saturdays she studies for a degree in psychology at university; studies which will allow her to grow professionally.

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale.

loans.name: Marcia Dinora

texts.es:
Doña marcia es una microempresaria que tiene su pequeño taller de costura donde elabora una variedad de prendas de vestir como blusas, faldas, vestidos, entre otras cosas.

Gracias a su  excelente trabajo ha mantenido a su clientela contenta con los trabajos que realiza, por lo que actualmente necesita una fuente de financiamiento para comprar tela y atender algunos encargos de sus clientes.

Antes de tener su negocio personal trabajaba en una empresa de confeccion de ropa en la ciudad de matagalpa donde aprende el oficio de sastreria.

En vista de quedar en el desempleo, empieza a trabajar en su casa en donde contribuye activamente en el mejoramiento de su familia.

Es una persona honesta y trabajadora.
Es madre de tres hijos, dos de ellos en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Marcia is a microentrepreneur with a small sewing workshop where she makes a variety of articles of clothing such as blouses, skirts, dresses and others.

Marcia’s excellent work has kept her customers happy, so much so that she now needs a source of financing to buy fabric and fill some of her customers’ orders.

Before having her own business, Marcia worked in the garment industry in the city of Matagalpa, which is where she learned to be a seamstress. Upon becoming unemployed, she began to work from her home, where she actively contributes to the improvement of her family.

Marcia is honest and hardworking. She has three children, two of whom are school-age.

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale.

loans.name: Mario Donaldo

texts.es:
Don Mario es un microempresario que se dedica al arte de elaborar muebles de madera como camas, roperos, sillas mecedoras, tiene once años de dedicarse a este oficio.

Antes de tener su propio negocio era vendedor de espejos y muebles, además de gestionar su respectiva recuperación, gracias a su experiencia en ventas, se le ocurre comprar herramientas para poner su propio negocio personal en donde actualmente tiene sus propios clientes que atiende de manera personal.

Su negocio ha crecido, sin embargo necesita de un financiamiento para capital de trabajo para atender la demanda de muebles, en especial las camas de madera.

Cabe mencionar que la actividad comercial de don Mario genera tres fuentes de trabajo que de igual manera beneficia a tres familias de su comunidad.

Es una persona emprendedor y con un alto potencial de crecimiento como microempresario.
texts.en:
Mario is a microbusiness owner who makes a living by crafting wooden furniture such as beds, closets, and rocking chairs. He has had this job for 11 years. Prior to having his own business he sold mirrors and furniture. In addition to managing the recovery of payments, thanks to his sales experience, it occurred to him to buy tools to start his own business where he currently has his own customers whom he attends personally.

His business has grown, but nonetheless requires financing for working capital to address the demand for furniture, especially for beds made of wood. It is fitting to mention that Mario's commercial activity generates three job sources that equally benefit three families in his community.

Mario is an enterprising person with high potential for growth as a microbusiness owner.

loans.use: to buy laurel and Guanacaste wood

loans.name: Occi

texts.en:
Occi is a 36-year-old business man who lives in Nimule. He is married with 4 children between the ages of 3 and 10. All of his children go to school. 

Occi runs a general store and has been in business for 6 years. He has no employees. His major challenges include high market prices and high transportation costs. He has no sources of income besides this business.

He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 3000ssp to purchase more body lotion, hair lotions, and many other products. 

In 5 years Occi would like to expand his business and open other branches. He says he is happy for the loans given by finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like body lotions and hair lotions

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en:
Wycliffe is 40 years old, from Migori County which is located in western part of Kenya.

Wycliffe makes bricks for construction. He has been in this business for the last 12 years and makes a monthly income of KES 10,000. He is taking his fifth loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy more stock of firewood and pay laborers for their work. He will use the anticipated profit to plough back into the business.

He has a dream of expanding his business enterprise so that he can earn extra income to support his family.

loans.use: to buy more firewood and pay laborers for their work

loans.name: Kasifa's Group

texts.en:
Kasifa's group is comprised of six hard working women. Kasifa, 21, lives in the town of Sironko in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past three years, Kasifa has been working hard to manage her produce business, selling beans, flour and maize.

To help expand her business, Kasifa has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add more produce in the store such as beans, flour, and maize and will help Kasifa to generate greater profits by increasing her stock. Kasifa hopes that in the future she will be able to buy land and construct a home.

Kasifa is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to add more produce in the store such as beans, flour, and maize.

loans.name: Jhony Mauricio

texts.es:
Jhony es un hombre de 30 años, creció en un hogar de escasos recursos donde siempre le inculcaron el valor del trabajo honesto y esforzado. Pudo estudiar hasta terminar la escuela secundaria y está separado de su esposa con quien tuvo 3 hijos que a raíz de la separación dejaron de vivir con él, pero Jhony no los ha descuidado ni un solo día, dos de ellos tienen 8 años y el tercero tiene casi 3 años. Este hombre trabajador ahora vive solo en el Cantón Santo Domingo de la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas. Santo Domingo se encuentra conectando la Región Sierra con la Región Costa del Ecuador, es una ciudad que se ha convertido en un eje comercial con varios sectores en crecimiento y como prueba se tiene a varias familias emprendedoras que hace algunos años comenzaron con pequeños negocios y ahora son microempresarios que aportan a la generación de empleo. Los estudios revelan que todos los negocios en su mayoría, empezaron empíricamente y han tenido acogida por el paso de turistas, empresarios y viajeros que se trasladan de una región a otra y además que es la tercera ciudad más habitada en el país. 
Jhony desde que salió del colegio trabajó como empleado en el sector de la agricultura y en la crianza de cerdos, de estas experiencias aprendió la actividad a la cual se dedica desde hace 10 años en su terreno. Todas las mañanas se dedica a la limpieza de las chancheras y la alimentación de los cerdos y las tardes visita a sus hijos o va a la feria de animales a ofertar sus chanchos y además a recolectar el alimento para sus animales. A pesar de que la separación de su cónyuge le afectó y frustró mucho, Jhony siguió trabajo con el sueño de un día ver a sus 3 hijos convertidos en profesionales de excelencia como el no pudo llegar a ser. Es su primer crédito en Fundación Alternativa y está muy satisfecho con la confianza, asesoría y eficiente gestión que le brindaron, principalmente porque han contado con el producto Kiva. Con este crédito, realizará la ampliación de los criaderos para una mejor crianza de los cerdos y también para poder traer más cerdo y así incrementar sus ventas.  Jhony agradece a quienes aportan la financiación de este crecimiento laboral que además aportará para que pueda empezar la construcción de su casa propia.
texts.en:
Jhony is a 30-year-old man. He grew up in a home with limited resources where the value of honest and hard work was always instilled in him. He was able to study until the end of his secondary education, and he is separated from his wife with whom he had three children. Since the separation, the children no longer live with him, but Jhony has not neglected them for a single day. Two of them are 8 years old and the third is barely 3 years old.

This hardworking man now lives by himself in the canton Santo Domingo of the province Santo Domingo in Tsachilas. Santo Domingo connects the mountainous region with the coastal region of Ecuador, and is a city that has become a commercial center with several growing sectors. It contains various enterprising families that started small businesses some years ago and now are microbusiness owners that support a generation of employment. Studies show that most of the businesses began empirically and have grown with the passage of tourists, businesspeople and travelers that move from one region to another and in addition it is the third most populated city in the country.

Jhony since leaving school worked as a laborer in the agricultural sector raising pigs. From these experiences he learned the activity which he has devoted himself to for 10 years on his land. Every morning he bathes and feeds the pigs and in the afternoons he visits his children or goes to the animal market to sell his pigs and in addition to pick up feed for his animals.

In spite of the separation from his wife which affected him and frustrated him greatly, Jhony continued working with the dream of one day seeing his three children becoming professionals of excellence, as he failed to become one.

This is his first loan from Fundacion Alternativa and he is very happy with the trust, consulting and efficient management that they offer him, principally because they could depend on Kiva loans. With this loan, he will expand the nursery to improve the growth of the pigs and also to be able to bring more pigs and thereby grow his sales. Jhony is grateful to those who support the financing of his job growth that will also help him to begin construction of his own house.

loans.use: to accommodate his pigs and expand their number

loans.name: G.s Los Hermanos Group

texts.es: El G.S. Los hermanos, está conformado por dos integrantes Seneyda y Flor Iselda, originarias de un municipio de Chinandega ubicado al norte de este departamento. Estas integrantes de este grupo son hermanas por lo tanto decidieron optar al crédito bajo la modalidad de grupo solidario  para ayudarse mutuamente e invertir en sus respectivos negocios. Seneyda es la coordinadora de este grupo lo cual se encarga de la responsabilidad y cumplimientos de los planes de pago, es casada, madre de dos hijos que estudian en la secundaria, ella tiene una pulpería donde vende productos de consumo como granos básicos, golosinas y refrescos ubicada en su casa de habitación  empezó este negocio hace 13 años como una forma de salir adelante y sacar adelante a su familia,los cuales uno de sus sueños es poder sacar adelante a sus hijos el verlos terminar su estudios siendo unos profesionales, flor Iselda casada, madre de tres hijos en edades escolares vende frijoles cocidos y tortillas inicio este negocio para subsistir ya que ella es una mujer trabajadora,honrada y honesta ya tiene 12 años de tener este pequeño negocio, uno de sus sueños principalmente es poder ver a sus hijos todos profesionales e independientes y el darles una mejor calidad de vida. El G.S. Los hermanos agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva la ayuda que les brindan a los pequeños comerciantes de países pobres como es Nicaragua para poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Los Hermanos [The Siblings] is made up of two members, Seneyda and Flor Iselda. They are natives of a municipality located in the north of the department of Chinandega. Seneyda and Flor Iselda are sisters, so they decided to request a joint loan to help each other and invest in their respective businesses. As the coordinator of this group, Seneyda is the person responsible for making loan payments and complying with the terms of the loan. 

Seneyda is married with two children, both of whom are in high school. She has a grocery business in her home where she sells products such as basic grains, candies and soft drinks. Seneyda started this business 13 years ago to help her family get ahead. One of her dreams is to be able to help her children get ahead and see them complete their studies and become professionals. 

Flor Iselda is married with three school-aged children. She works selling cooked beans and tortillas. Flor Iselda is hardworking and honest. She started her small business 12 years ago in order to make a living. One of her greatest dreams is to see her children become independent professionals and to give them a better quality of life.

The solidarity group Los Hermanos thanks Kiva lenders for the help they give to small business owners to get ahead in developing countries like Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy basic grains such as beans and corn, candies, firewood, soft drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, all of whom go to school. She has two additional family members, her elderly parents.

Sarah sells chips at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last six years and works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy sacks of Irish potatoes, cooking oil, beef, and sausages. Her major business challenges are  transportation and seasonality.

Sarah's goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked restaurant and to educate her children up to university. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of Irish potatoes, cooking oil, beef and sausages.

loans.name: Beautiful Group

texts.en:
Josephine is the featured borrower of Beautiful Group. She got together with her other group members to apply for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, because they have known each other since they came to work in Lebanon. 

Josephine is a 51-year-old divorced woman who came to Lebanon to work as a housekeeper in order to provide her children with the best education that she dreams of providing them. Josephine is the second from the left. She will send the loan amount to her children to pay for their requested educational fees.

Ronelyn is a 26-year-old single woman who works as a housekeeper to support her parents in the Philippines. The loan amount will be sent to her parents to make sure they are having a healthy life and fulfilling their needs. She is the first from the right.

Jean is a 27-year-old single woman who works as a housekeeper to support her parents in the Philippines. The requested loan amount will be sent to her parents to cover their needs. She is the first from the left.

Linelyn is a 27-year-old single woman who works as a housekeeper since she came from the Philippines to make her own living. She will invest the applied for loan in a small business to increase her income.

loans.use: To send the money for her children to pay their educational fees.

loans.name: Juan Inocente

texts.es:
Juan es un microempresario que se dedica a la fabricación, elabora muebles de madera como camas, roperos, sillas mecedoras,  tiene once años de dedicarse a este oficio.

Antes de tener su propio negocio era estudiante de secundaria y por iniciativa propia entra a trabajar en un taller de muebles de su comunidad donde muy pronto aprende a elaborar y decorar artículos de madera, gracias a su habilidad en trabajos manuales decide comprar herramientas para poner su propio negocio personal en donde actualmente tiene su propio taller.

Su negocio ha crecido, sin embargo necesita de un financiamiento para capital de trabajo para atender la demanda de muebles, en especial las camas de madera.

La aspiración personal de don Juan es crecer como microempresario y estudiar una carrera universitaria que le permita obtener mejores oportunidades de trabajo en su microempresa.
texts.en:
Juan is a microentrepreneur who makes wood furniture such as beds, wardrobes and rocking chairs. He has worked in this trade for 11 years.

Before he had his own business, Juan was a high school student. On his own initiative he started to work in a furniture workshop in his community, where he quickly learned to build and decorate wood items. Because of his skill for manual tasks, he decided to buy tools and start his own business, which is his current workshop. 

Although his business has grown, Juan needs a loan for working capital to meet the demand for his furniture, which is especially high for wood beds.

Juan aspires to grow as a microentrepreneur and study a university career that will give him better opportunities to expand his small business.

loans.use: to buy laurel and Guanacaste wood to make furniture such as beds, wardrobes and rocking chairs.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik, 41, lives in Vanadzor city with his wife and two sons. He graduated from technical school in the robotics department. However, as he never found work in this profession, after graduating he found that cooking was more attractive for him and for a long time he worked as a cook in many restaurants in Vanadzor city.

After some time, he became jobless and in order to sustain his family, he started to work as a floor grinder. In a short time, he gained good repute in this occupation and now he has many clients from Vanadzor and the nearest villages of Lori region. He has been engaged in floor grinding for more than 10 years.

With the profits from grinding, Gagik is able to meet his family's needs as well as possible. As with many of Vanadzor’s dwellers, he doesn't want to leave his motherland to work abroad. He prefers to stay in Armenia and hopes that the social and economic state in his city will go well in the near future. 

Gagik is asking Kiva lenders for a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams to buy a new modern grinder so that he will be able to work more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy a new modern grinder for his floor grinding business.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children, all of whom go to school. She has no additional family members.

Dorothy sells fish at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last five years, working six days a week. She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more baskets of fish. Her major business challenges are transportation, thieves, and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to start selling on a wholesale basis and to build a residential house. Dorothy lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more baskets of fish for resale.

loans.name: Luz Jimena

texts.es: La Sra. Luz tiene 36 años, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su  tienda de barrio que se encuentran en la zona de Villa Victoria este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio como abarrotes, dulces y refrescos,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la mucha demanda que tiene y es ahí donde incrementa sus ventas, y necesita surtir su mercadería la Sra. Luz enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen varias tiendas en la zona, va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de mas mercadería para surtir su tienda y seguir creciendo más cada día, su deseo para  su negocio es de seguir vendiendo y tener una tienda más grande y surtida, así poder hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Luz is 36 years old and makes a living selling products of primary necessity in her neighborhood store which is located in the Villa Victoria zone. This loan is her first one with the institution, and she will use it to buy merchandise to stock her business such as groceries, sweets and soft drinks. 

Her reason for requesting this loan is the strong demand which she has, and for which to increase her sales, she needs to restock her merchandise. Luz faces challenges in her business including competition, since several stores already exist in the area. She will use the benefits of the purchase of more merchandise to restock her store and to continue growing more every day. 

Her desire for her business is to continue selling and to have a bigger and more well-stocked store, and thus be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Harry

texts.en:
Harry, 61, is the married father of four children. He operates a posho mill in Malindi and earns a monthly income of about 10,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).

Harry was introduced to KADET Ltd by a credit officer. He has applied for a business loan of 20,000 KES to purchase spare parts needed to repair his posho mill machine.

Harry intends to continue growing his business as he focuses on bettering his family's financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts needed to repair his posho mill machine.

loans.name: Sera

texts.en:
Sera is 26 years old and a firewood and charcoal dealer in Bamburi, Mombasa. She is a married mother of three whose husband gives additional income. She has been in this business for the past year, and she has done well.

This marks her first loan with KADET to purchase firewood and sacks of charcoal in anticipation of the long rains. 

She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business, and she hopes to own several businesses of the same kind in different estates in the future.

loans.use: To purchase firewood and sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Lesvia Esperanza

texts.es: Lesvia de 57 años. Soltera, madre de 5 hijos, viven en el departamento de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país es una mujer, trabajadora, responsable, ella es propietaria de un negocio de destace de cerdo y mercadería en general, también vende comida los fines de semana, hace unos riquísimos nacatamales una comida típica de este municipio, ella inicio este negocio hace 21 años como medio de subsistencia ya que era madre soltera y tenía 5 hijos que darles de comer, como mujer emprendedora ella decidió además de hacer nacatamales y el destace de cerdo vender chinelas y ropa de manera ambulante para obtener más ingresos, porque ella en un futuro aspira a arreglar su cocina que está dañada, El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar un lote de cerdos para la crianza y venta, ya que se lo están dando a buen precio. Lesvia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua.ya que gracias a ellos ha podido mejorar su negocio y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lesvia us 57 years old, is the mother of five children, and lives in the Department of Chinandega in the western part of the country. She is a hardworking, responsible woman who owns a business selling general merchandise and butchering pigs. She also sells food on the weekends. She makes very delicious nacatamales, a traditional dish in her region. She started this business 21 years ago to make ends meet as she was a single mother and had five children to feed. As an enterprising woman, she decided that in addition to making nacatamales and butchering pigs she would also sell slippers and clothing as a street vendor in order to make more money. One day she hopes to fix up her kitchen which is in need of repairs. 

The goal of this loan is to invest in working capital and purchase a litter of pigs for growing and selling now that they are fetching a good price. Lesvia is grateful for the assistance that Kiva donors provide to persons of limited resources and impoverished countries such as Nicaragua. Thanks to these donors she has been able to grow her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and ingredients for making nacatamales.

loans.name: Emin

texts.en:
Emin is a 24-year-old young farmer from Vayk. He keeps 12 chickens and five cows, as well as cultivates peaches, apricots, nuts, apples and pear trees. Emin lives with his parents who help him run a farm. Emin's mother gets milk and uses it in cheese production. Emin sells the cheese at the local market and earns an income, which is vital for him to cover the family's daily costs.

Emin has applied for this loan to purchase two pigs and a cow. This loan is very important for Emin so that he can increase his livestock and income.

loans.use: To pay for two pigs and a cow

loans.name: Camino Al Futuro Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Gaby María tiene 51 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo. Ella es socia del grupo "Camino al Futuro" que actualmente está formado por 6 integrantes, es un grupo recién formado que se han unido con una misma finalidad la de salir adelante con sus negocios.
La Sra. Gaby María se dedica desde hace 25 años a prestar servicio de Masoterapia de manera particular, es decir hace tratamientos de limpieza de cutis, reducción de medidas, masajes de relajación, etc.
Ella solicita el préstamo para invertirlo en materiales, cremas que utiliza en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Gaby Maria is 51 years old, married and has one son. She is a member of the group "Camino al Futuro" [Road to the Future] that presently consists of 6 members. It is a recently formed group that has united with the common purpose of succeeding in their businesses.

Gaby Maria has offered private massage therapy services for 25 years. This includes treatments such as facials, weight reduction, relaxation massages, etc. She is requesting the loan to invest in materials and creams that she uses in her work.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of creams and materials to carry out her work as a massage therapist

loans.name: Blanca Raquel

texts.es:
Blanca,  decide adquirir un nuevo crédito para mejorar y seguir su negocio. Con lo cual le ayudara para seguir comprando ropa  y así para movilizarse en su negocio.
Ella logro que su negocio se mantuviera y seguir empliándose, también para cubrir sus gastos habitacionales. Ha podido obtener estable su negocio y seguir trabajando en el.
texts.en: Blanca decided to secure another loan in order to improve and continue her business. With the funds she will continue purchasing clothes and in doing so keep her business going. She has successfully maintained her business and used it to remain self-employed and to cover housing expenses. She has managed to keep her business stable and to continue working.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She operates a shop at the market and sells her products at retail. She has been in this business for the last 2 years. She works seven days a week.  She has requested for a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy boxes of soap, sugar, cooking oil, flour and rice.

Sofia's major business challenges are transportation, seasonality and electricity. Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked retail shop and to buy a delivery van to ease in transportation. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, flour, rice and cooking oil

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, and all of her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells cow ghee at the market. She has been in this business for the last six years. She works six days a week.  She has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy tins of cow ghee. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals are to become a wholesaler of cow ghee and also start selling fruits and vegetables. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more tins of cow ghee

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en:
Christine's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Christine is 22 years old and lives in the town of Sironko in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with one of them currently in school. For the past four years, Christine has been working hard to manage her local brewery, and she makes and sells the brew. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy millet to make the brew and will help Christine to generate greater profits and meet her customer's needs. Christine hopes that in the future she will be self-relaint. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: To buy millet to make the brew

loans.name: Milly

texts.en: Milly lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children, and all of her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells green bananas at the market. She has been in this business for the last four years. She works six days a week.  She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals are to increase her capital and start selling other types of foods and on a wholesale basis. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, and all of her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells charcoal at the market. She has been in this business for the last five years. She works six days a week.  She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges are thieves and seasonality. Her goals are to become a wholesaler and to educate her children up to a university level. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
Abass is a 29-year-old married man and a father of two children, who has owned a convenience store since 2009. Abass is well-known in the region with his good reputation.

Abass is a hardworking man who seeks perfection, a good living for his family, and a good education for his children.

Abass is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to support and develop his vegetable-selling business. This will be his second loan cycle. His previous loan helped him a lot in increasing his income and developing his store.

Abass is willing to expand his business more in the future through expanding the fruits and vegetables he offers. This will ensure that his family's needs will be covered.

loans.use: To support and develop his vegetable-selling business

loans.name: Petrona Del Carmen

texts.es:
Petrona, solicita un nuevo crédito  para invertir  un poco en pescado y camarón para la respectiva venta, por la temporada de semana santa. Con esto le ayudara a comprar pescado, camarón y otro tipo de mariscos para el comercio. 
Con el préstamo anterior pudo hacer una granja de pollos, sostener a su familia y de las ganancias  hizo milpa; tiene silos con maíz aproximadamente 15 sacos por todo.  También le permitió comprar   vehículo para usos personales en donde le sirve para desarrollar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Petrona is requesting a new loan to invest a little in fish and shrimp for respective sale during the Easter season.  This will help her to buy fish, shrimp and other kinds of seafood for sale. 

With the previous loan she was able to build a chicken farm, support her family and from the earnings she built a cornfield  She has silos of corn that hold approximately 15 sacks altogether.  Also, it allowed her to purchase a vehicle for personal use which is useful to her in developing her work.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp and other kinds of seafood for production.

loans.name: Armanush

texts.en:
Armanush is a retailer from the Getap village. She lives with her husband and two children.
Armanush runs a little grocery store where she sells food. Due to her friendly attitude and high-quality service, Armanush has gained many loyal clients during her two years running the shop. Now she wants to increase the variety of products she sells to meet her clients' demand. She has applied for this loan to purchase food for the shop. It is important for Armanush to develop the business to earn more income and ensure a better future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase food for her shop

location.town: Getap village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Estrella Del Mar Group

texts.es: El G.S. Estrella de mar anteriormente estaba formado por tres miembros pero por fallecimiento de una de ellas ahora el G.S. está conformado por dos integrantes Deysi y Alicia, son originarias del departamento de Chinandega, el cual está ubicado en el occidente del país. Estas integrantes de este grupo son madre e hija por lo tanto decidieron optar al crédito bajo lo modalidad de grupo solidario para ayudarse económicamente e invertir en sus diferentes negocios. Alicia es la coordinadora de este grupo es la que se encargara de responsabilidad y cumplimientos de los pagos, Alicia es una micro empresaria la cual tiene venta de dulces ( cajetas, atol entre otros) además de cigarros, gaseosas y tres mesas de billar donde pueden llegar el público y alquilarlas para que puedan jugar.  Deysi tiene una mini pulpería la cual ha ido ampliándola y ahora tiene una tienda donde vende ropa, calzado y mercadería en general, ella inicia su negocio con un pequeño bolso el cual salia a vender a las calles su mercadería y con los prestamos ha ido creciendo su negocio hasta el tener una hermosa pero pequeña aun tienda. Ellas solicitan este crédito para seguir ampliando su negocio agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva la ayudan a los micro empresarios de países pobres como es Nicaragua.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Estrella del Mar [Star of the Sea] was originally made up of three members, one of whom has passed away. The two surviving members are Deysi and Alicia, natives of the department of Chinandega, which is located in the western part of the country. Deysi and Alicia are mother and daughter, so they decided to request a joint loan to help each other economically and invest in their different businesses. As the coordinator of this group, Alicia is responsible for making loan payments and complying with the terms of the loan.

Alicia is a microentrepreneur with a business selling candies such as dulce de leche and atole [a sweet corn-based drink] in addition to cigarettes and carbonated soft drinks. She also has three pool tables that she rents to the public who come to play. 

Deysi has a small grocery store that she has been expanding and she also now has a store where she sells clothing, footwear and other merchandise. She began selling her merchandise in the streets from a small bag she carried with her. With the loans she has received, her business has grown to the point that she now has a beautiful small shop. 

Alicia and Deysi are requesting this loan to continue expanding their businesses. They are grateful to Kiva lenders for the help they give to microentrepreneurs in developing countries like Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy clothing, candies, footwear, softdrinks and other merchandise.

loans.name: Bujar

texts.en:
Bujar is 33 years old. He lives in the southern part of Kosovo with his wife and two daughters. He works at a gas station and earns a very low salary. His wife is a housewife.
They live in an area which is consistently poorer than the rest of the country according to all definitions of poverty. Bujar puts forth effort to make a better life for his family. Because his salary is not enough for their needs, he is planning to keep a cow.
Bujar requests a loan to build a stable for his cow.
The loan will help him and his family as the cow will provide daily milk. In this way, he will improve the welfare of his family.
His goal is to improve his situation in order to offer his family a better life. In the future, he plans to invest more and increase the number of cows he owns. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, he wants to thank all the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To build a stable for his cow.

loans.name: Buken

texts.ru: Букен 67 лет, вдова, воспитала 5 взрослых детей. Букен начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве после того как вышла замуж. Имея многолетний опыт и знания которые проникли глубоко в кровь. Букен имеет очень хорошее хозяйство. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Букен  обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 бычка. На доходы от проекта в дальнейшем будет вкладывать в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Buken is 67 years old, a widow, and has raised 5 children.  She started her own livestock and farming business after her husband passed away.  She has years of experience and knowledge which runs through her veins.  Buken has very good faculties.  With the goal of further developing her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 20,000 KGS to buy 1 bull.  The income the loan provides will be reinvested in further business expansion.

loans.use: To purchase 1 bull

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh was born in 1978. She has two children. Her daughter is learning in the 10th grade, and her son is in the 7th grade. Her husband is a carpenter. His income is about 4,000,000 VND a month. Thanh also is a carpenter to earn a living. She has done this job for 15 years. Her income is about 4,000,000 VND per month. Her family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 VND per month.

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy wood to do carpentry.

loans.use: to buy wood to do carpentry.

loans.name: Bayramali

texts.en:
Bayramali is a 51-year-old man, who is married and has three children. He is a sheep breeder and has 20 head of sheep in his herd. He has 16 years of experience in this field. His brother helps him in his business. Bayramali also has a garden, where he raises seasonal fruits and vegetables.  His wife is a housekeeper, and she looks after the house and helps her husband to look after the sheep. 

The village where Bayramali lives is located in the southern part of Azerbaijan, with very rigorous climate conditions. In summer, the temperature reaches 105 degrees, Fahrenheit, and the main problem in the region is water for irrigation and for animals.  Bayramali is not able to build a water channel for his garden and animals, by himself. This is quite an expensive process, which requires a labor force and special equipment.

When he heard about water loans, he was extremely excited and applied for a 2,000 AZN loan. He will use this loan to pay for special equipment, like tractors, and for workers who will dig the land, to make a water channel. He is a trustworthy client of AqroInvest and has a good client history.

loans.use: to pay for special equipment and labor, to dig the land to make a water channel

loans.name: Shukur

texts.en:
Shukur is a 23-year-old farmer who raises crops such as fruits, vegetables, wheat and corn. He is single and lives with his parents. His brother helps him to continue the family business. Shukur says that the year-to-year climate has become more vigorous than previous years, with especially hot summers and cold winters. In the summer, temperatures reach 105 degrees Fahrenheit, and the main problem in the region is water for irrigation. People are suffering and order special cars with water to irrigate crops, especially in summertime, when temperatures reach 105 degrees Fahrenheit.

Raising crops has been his life project for the last four years, and this business brings him stable income, his only financial resource. Shukur is not able to build a water channel for his garden alone. This is quite an expensive process that requires a labor force and special equipment. When he heard about water loans, he was extremely excited and applied for a 2000 AZN (Azerbaijani new manat) loan. He will use this loan to pay for the rental of special equipment like a tractor for making the water channel and for workers who will dig the land.

loans.use: to pay for special equipment and labor to dig a water channel.

loans.name: Hakim

texts.en: In the photo, Hakim stands on the left, with his daughter, his wife, and Ruma's field officer. Hakim runs a small stall where he sells snacks, drinks and mobile phone airtime credits. Currently, he has three persons living in his house including his one-year-old daughter, Siti Amelia. He joined Ruma four months ago because he wanted to expand to other business opportunities and still feels really excited to expand his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments for the customers. For the last three months, he has around $50/day sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues, he needs more working capital in order to be able to do transaction on weekends.

loans.use: To obtain more cash to process mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Abel Ernesto

texts.es:
Abel, le surge la necesidad de invertir más en el negocio  del cultivo de maíz, ya que ha generado mucha más producción. Con esto podrá comprar abono, semilla, fertilizantes, preparación de la tierra.
El crédito anterior le ayudo mucho a  mejorar sus ingresos, incremento la cantidad de maíz producido que en otras ocasiones. Al igual sus condiciones familiares han mejorado en gran medida también su situación económica.
texts.en:
Abel needs to invest more in his business of growing corn, since he has been able to produce more. With this he will be able to buy manure, seed, and fertilizer, and prepare the soil. 

The previous loan helped him a lot to improve his income. He increased the amount of corn he produced, as compared to other occasions. His family’s living conditions have improved, and his economic situation has improved quite a bit, too.

loans.use: to buy manure, seed, and fertilizers, and to prepare the soil

loans.name: Cholponbu

texts.ru: Чолпонбу 45 лет, замужем, имеет 4 сыновей. Чолпонбу на протяжении 15 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Чолпонбу в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется земельный надел 1,76 га где она выращивает картофель, зерновые культуры,эспарцет и васоль. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса Чолпонбу составляет 8,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чолпонбу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку качественных семян, ГСМ для трактора и удобрений что позволит получить хороший урожай . Доходы от кредита Чолпонбу планирует построить сарая для скота.
texts.en: Cholponbu is 45 years old, married and has 4 sons.  For the last 15 years, she has worked with livestock, having started her business with 10,000 KGS.  Thanks to her hard work, Cholponbu today has 1.76 acres of land where she grows potatoes, corn, herbs and beans.  Her business provides her with a monthly income of 8,000 KGS.  With the goal of further developing her business, Cholponbu has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 KGS to buy quality seeds, tractor fuel, and fertilizers that will help with a rich harvest.  The income from the loan will be used to build a barn for the livestock.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and tractor fuel.

loans.name: Ade

texts.en: Ade runs a small stall where he sells snacks, drinks and mobile phone airtime credits. He is an entrepreneur and has four persons living in his house. He joined Ruma four months ago and he feels really excited to expand his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments for the customers. For the last three months, he has around $40/day sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues, he needs more working capital in order to be able to do transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To obtain working capital to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Rauf

texts.en:
Rauf is a 27-year-old man, very smart and full of energy. He raises seasonal fruits and vegetables in his garden and sells them. His monthly income is 300 AZN. His brother helps him to raise and sell the crops. He is married and has three children.

Raising crops has been his life project for the past five years, and this business brings him stable income that is the only financial source of support for the family. Rauf says that year to year, the climate has become more vigorous than in previous years, with especially hot summers and cold winters. In summer, the temperature often reaches 105 degrees Fahrenheit, and the main problem in the region is water for irrigation. Rauf is not able to build a water channel for his garden, by himself. This is quite an expensive process, which requires a labor force and special equipment.

When he heard about water loans, Rauf was extremely excited and applied for a 2,000 AZN loan. He will use this loan to pay for rental of special equipment, like a tractor, and for workers who will dig the land, for making a water channel.

loans.use: to pay for rental of special equipment and for workers who will dig the land, for making a water channel.

loans.name: Virgen De La Puerta Group

texts.es: Eileen  es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “Virgen De La Puerta”, la cual está conformado por 08 socios entusiastas, que llevan trabajando con el grupo más de 02 años. Eileen de 36 años separada con 01 hija.  Actualmente cuenta con un bazar, lleva trabajando de esta manera hace más de 10 años. Este negocio surgió a raíz de la separación con el padre de su hija. Se siente orgullosa pues gracias a su trabajo y perseverancia a mejorado su negocio y apoyar a su hija en su educación. Su más grande deseo es ver a su hija realizada profesionalmente. El dinero obtenido lo destinará para la compra de zapatos y sandalias de temporada. El grupo “Virgen De La Puerta” agradecen el crédito brindado. Eileen se encuentra sentada, es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste polo verde.
texts.en: Eileen is a member of the “Virgen De La Puerta” communal bank, which is made up of 8 enthusiastic members who have been working as group for more than 2 years. Eileen is 36 years old, separated, and has 1 daughter. She currently has a store that sells a variety of items, and she has had this business for more than 10 years. She started her business as a result of separating from her daughter’s father. She feels proud because it is through her work and perseverance that she has improved her business and supported her daughter in her education. Her greatest wish is to see her daughter become a professional. She will use the money from the loan to buy shoes and sandals for the season. The “Virgen De La Puerta” communal bank group is thankful for the loan that has been granted. Eileen is seated, the second from the left, wearing a green shirt.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose has been in retail for almost 20 years. He worked his way up from associate to assistant manager, and then to a manager’s position. While working at the state prison, Jose decided to open his own jewelry store, but after 15 years, health issues forced him to close. When he got better, he embarked on a new entrepreneurial venture: a tobacco shop.

“I’ve worked for the state for 18 years. I’ve already worked for someone else all my life.  I want to work for myself,” Jose says. His main goal is to expand his business and retire. 

His new business, Blue Frog, is a tobacco smoke shop, which sells a variety of tobacco products, pipes and incense.  

Blue Frog is open seven days a week and closes late at 10 p.m. The shop carries all types of tobacco products, incense, and pipes. 

Originally from Edinburg, Texas, Jose followed his dream and moved to nearby McAllen, where he says rent is more affordable. He says he found a shop close to downtown and is paying half of what he would have elsewhere. Though the shop has only been open for a month now, Jose says a competitor has already offered to buy him out. He says, “From what I heard from customers, my store is a lot cleaner. It’s the way we have it set up compared to the other stores that makes it different.”
