A returning client of Accion Texas Inc, Jose remembered the microlender when looking for a loan, which he is using to purchase inventory. “I invested $8,000 to connect the light and water and I bought merchandise myself, but I needed more inventory. When I knew I needed a little more, I went to Accion,” he says. Without the loan, “I would have been stuck for a while. The merchandise that the customers were asking for, we didn’t have. Without the loan, I would still be waiting on the merchandise.” 

Jose runs his business while still holding down his job at the prison.  And he has one employee to help. “I’m really excited about this business,” he says. “I’ve been in retail before and now that I found someone to sell wholesale to me, I can succeed.”

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for his tobacco shop

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 17 years old and lives in the town of Sironko in the Mbale region of Uganda. For the past three years, Caroline has been working hard to manage her vegetable business, which sells vegetables (cabbage). 

To help expand her business, Caroline has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add different types of vegetables and will help Caroline to make more profits. Caroline hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a piece of land. 

Caroline is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to add different types of vegetables

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is 34 years old and lives in Migori county, which is located in the western part of Kenya. He supports a family of four members, and he is married to Mkami. He has been blessed with two children, the eldest being 16 years old and the younger one, 7 years old.

Musa has a bookshop in his location, where he sells a variety of books. He has been doing this business for the past 10 years and makes a monthly income of KES 30,000. He is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase more books to sell and to add one shelf for the books. He will use his anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

He has a dream of making his business become stable and support his family fully.

loans.use: to purchase books for sale and add one more shelf for displaying books

loans.name: Claudia Yamilet

texts.es:
Claudia, vive en casa familiar junto con su esposo, él trabaja en la alcaldía de la localidad vive en junto a tres hijos, dos de ellos aún son dependientes económicamente, Claudia se dedica a la venta de ropa y accesorios, lo hace desde hace dos años, este negocio le permite ayudar a su esposo aportando para el hogar, también en ocasiones se dedica a la costurería pues también sabe elaborar ropa.
Claudia, decide optar por un crédito porque le ha beneficiado, puede pagarlo con facilidad y  no  le es muy caro. Ella invertirá en peluches $80.00, lociones $160.00, ropa para niño $150.00 y ropa de diversa variedad por el resto del credito.
Con este préstamo espera mejorar sus inventarios de mercadería y aumentar un poco su clientela por ello requiere comprar mercadería reciente. El grupo familiar se mantiene y mas que ello ha mejorado parcialmente.
texts.en:
Claudia lives in a house with her husband. He works for the municipality for the town where they live with their three children, two of whom are still economically dependent on them. Claudia sells clothing and accessories. She has done this for two years. This business allows her to help out her husband by contributing to the household budget. Sometimes she also sews clothing for sale, since she knows how to make clothes. 

Claudia decided to request a loan because they have been beneficial to her, she can pay them back under fair conditions, and they are not too expensive. She will invest it in stuffed animals ($80.00), perfumes ($160.00), children’s clothing ($150.00), and with the rest of the loan she will buy a variety of clothing. 

With this loan she hopes to improve her merchandise inventory and increase her number of customers. In order to do this, she needs to buy recent merchandise. Her family is doing well and things have even improved.

loans.use: to buy stuffed animals, perfumes, and clothing.

loans.name: Zempira

texts.en:
Zempira is 61 years old. She lives in Teliani village, Kaspi district with her daughter, son in-law and his retired mother. The family is persecuted and they live in a special village for refugees.  Zempira requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only income for the family is from small farming. Zempira owns a small plot of agricultural land where she grows potatoes and tomatoes. They also have chickens and sell eggs and harvested vegetable to the villagers. 

Zempira requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Her loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Zempira wants to purchase grocery stock to open a shop. She has a small commercial space where she will open a grocery shop. Since Zempira will not have to pay the rent and her expenses will be minimum, she hopes to get a good income from this business. One part of the profit she will use to reinvest in the business and buy more grocery products and the rest for her family's well being.

loans.use: To purchase grocery stock to open a grocery shop

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
When the previous owner of what is now Innova Digital Systems decided to sell his company, Carlos saw an opportunity to expand on an already-made business that has a large clientele. 

Carlos says the previous owner was moving onto other projects.  “He pretty much forwarded me the company. I figured that it was good, the business is already built, and the clientele is already there,” he says.  “I called some of my partners who went to work at different companies and offered them to team up; they all agreed. The whole idea was to keep the solid team.”

For Carlos, the move was a “no-brainer.” He says the hardest work was rebranding the company name in 2009, but even that wasn’t too complicated. 

Innova Digital Systems, located in Carlos’ hometown of El Paso, Texas, is an information technology outsourcing company that works with other companies and nonprofits on providing telecommunications installation, computer repairs, network assistance, and cabling, wireless, theft and maintenance services, as well as security, firewalls, email hosting, and web design. 

“Anything that you can think of for your business, we do it,” Carlos says. “We basically become a client’s IT department. Or if the client has an IT department, we act as their consultants. We have more than 75 years of combined experience.” In addition to his experience in information technology, Carlos has a bachelor’s degree in business from the University of North Texas.

The seven-member team consists of three partners and four engineers, who constantly work out of the office, in the field. 

“I’ve always been a tech geek,” Carlos says. “That goes back to my college days. I was going for computer information systems, which allowed me to get a business administration background. All in all, it was a good move and opened a lot of possibilities.” Since taking ownership of the company, and re-opening the business three years ago, Carlos moved it to a different location and gained more clients. 

Considering his operating expenses, purchasing and payroll costs, and money needed for projects while waiting for payments from clients, Carlos decided to seek financing. Remembering his uncle’s mention of Accion Texas Inc. years ago, Carlos attended one of Accion’s seminars and met a loan officer. He says after that meeting, he felt comfortable returning to the office to apply for a loan, which he says, “keeps us on track to reach our sales goals and increase profits.” 

Without Accion’s help, Carlos says, “We would have had to pay real high interest rates on credit cards to fill those expenses. Our margins would have been cut and we wouldn’t have as much business as we do now.”  He says he plans to hire more engineers soon. “Our plans are to grow as much as possible,” Carlos says, adding that he plans to expand slowly and carefully.  

He’ll hire only one additional engineer in 2013.  He is also looking to hire someone to manage advertising and social media promotion.
To learn more about his business, check out his website at www.idselpaso.com.

loans.use: to pay for operating expenses, payroll costs and working capital.

loans.name: Hoan's Group

texts.en:
Hoan was born in 1983. She has three children. Her two daughters are learning at kindergarten and primary school. Her son is a really little kid. Her husband is a carpenter, and his income is about 4,000,000 VND a month. Hoan, herself, earns a living as a farmer and a carpentry helper. She has done these jobs for five years. Her income is about 3,000,000 VND per month. Her family’s total earnings are about 7,000,000 VND per month.
 
Hoan has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2012. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 5,152,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,048,000 VND to buy wood to do carpentry.

The other member of this group, Dai, is 57 years old. She has three children. She wants to borrow 6,048,000 VND to sell beverages in the market.

loans.use: to buy wood to do carpentry.

loans.name: Roman

texts.ru:
Со времени получения предыдущего кредита от КИВА, Роман не сталкивался с особыми трудностями. Сумма, полученная от КИВА, помогла ему поддержать бизнес и увеличить доход. 
Роману понадобилось дополнительное финансирование в размере 5 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить дополнительную партию товара под реализацию на своей точке.
texts.en:
Since receiving his first loan from KIVA, Roman has not had any particular hardships. The funding received from KIVA has helped him maintain his business and increase its revenue. 

Roman could use an additional 5000 Hryvnia loan to buy additional types of goods to sell at his kiosk.

loans.use: buy additional types of goods to sell at his kiosk.

loans.name: Canh

texts.en:
Canh was born in 1960. She has four children who are carpenters and iron scrap collecting workers. Her husband is dead. Canh is a carpenter to earn a living. She has done this job for seven years. Her income is about 4,000,000 dong (VND)  per month. Her family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 VND per month.

Canh has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last cycle, she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy wood to do carpentry.

loans.use: to buy wood to do carpentry.

loans.name: Jalil

texts.en:
Jalil is 39 years old, married, and has two sons. He raises seasonal fruits and vegetables in his garden and sells them. His monthly income is 400 AZN. His brother helps him to raise and sell the crops. Raising crops has been Jalil's his life project for the past eight years, and this business brings him stable income, which is the only financial source for his family.

Jalil says that, year to year, the climate has become more vigorous than previous years, with especially hot summers and cold winters. In summer, the temperature reaches 105 degrees Fahrenheit, and the main problem in the region is water for irrigation and for animals. Jalil is not able to build a water channel for his garden, alone. This is quite an expensive process, which requires a labor force and special equipment.

When he heard about water loans, Jalil was extremely excited and applied for a 2,000 AZN loan. He will use this loan to pay for rental of special equipment, like a tractor, and for workers who will dig the land, to make a water channel.

loans.use: to pay for rental of special equipment and laborers, to dig a water channel for irrigation of his crops

loans.name: Hudi

texts.en:
Hudi is a 36-year-old, married man with two children.  He is a cattle breeder with 10 heads of cattle in his herd.  He has 10 years of experience in this field.  His wife is a housekeeper who looks after the house and helps to look after the sheep.  He also has a garden where he grows seasonal fruits and vegetables.  The monthly income from his business is 300 AZN.  His sons help to look after the animals.

The village where Hudi lives is located in the southern part of Azerbaijan with very rigorous climate conditions.  In the summer, the temperature can reach 105 degrees Fahrenheit.  The main problem in the region is water for irrigation and for the animals.  Hudi is not able to build a water channel for his garden alone.  This is quite an expensive process which requires a labor force and special equipment.  When he heard about water loans he was extremely excited and applied for a 2,000 AZN loan.  He will use this loan to pay for the water channel to be dug (including a tractor and labor).

loans.use: to pay for a tractor and labor to build a water channel.

loans.name: Tinh

texts.en:
Tinh was born in 1967. She has three children who are workers and students. She and her husband are rice-milling workers to earn a living. She has done this job for 25 years. Her income is about 3,500,000 VND (Vietnamese dong) per month. Her family’s total earnings are about 6,500,000 VND per month.
 
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to fix and upgrade her milling machine.

loans.use: to fix and upgrade her milling machine.

loans.name: Johanna Nathaly

texts.es:
La Sra. Johanna  vive en Guayaquil, Empezó hace ya mucho tiempo cuando tuvo una pequeña liquidación hace 3 años. Actualmente ella realiza su trabajo de todos los días bajo pedido y en ocasiones da a creditos los productos y cosmeticos.

No tiene ninguna  dificultad, por el momento ni espera tenerlo .No está casada, es soltera y tampoco tiene hijos. 

Con el prestamo quiere comprar cosmeticos, cremas, perfumes, etc. EL sueño que quiere realizar es poder seguir laborando en su pequeña empresa de venta de cosmeticos y perfmes (esto lo hace registrando listado de clientes en la computadora que esta en la foto), surtirla ayudar a sus padres ya que ellos lo hicieron con ella cuando era menor poder darle una mejor vida a su familia apoyarlos en todo.
texts.en:
Johanna lives in Guayaquil.  She started her business quite a while ago when she got a small severance payment 3 years ago.  Now she works every day, selling on the basis of orders and at times selling her products and cosmetics on credit.

She has not had any difficulty with the business, nor does she expect it in the future.  She is not married; she's single and has no children.

With this loan, Johanna wants to buy cosmetics, creams, perfumes, and other products.  Her dream is to continue working in her small business selling cosmetics and perfumes (she does this by searching for lists of customers on the computer that is in the photo), and to stock up the business.  She also wants to help her parents, because they took care of her when she was a child.  She wants to give her family a better quality of life and support them in every way.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfumes and creams

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en: Jalia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children and all her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 10 years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to start going to the villages of Masaka for green bananas and to educate her children up to university level. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Luis Ernesto

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 57 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona, él es una persona muy amale, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Luis no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Agronomía, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Chicharrones de Chancho para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Luis se dedica a la agricultura, él tiene una pequeña parcela donde siembra maíz, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su experiencia y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Luis se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de abono, fertilizantes y otros, de esta manera él podrá lograr que su sembrío se desarrolle adecuadamente y podrá obtener una buena cosecha, si pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder ampliar sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Luis is a 57 years old, single man who lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Parcona. He is a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic individual who possessed of a great desire to get ahead in life. Unfortunately, due to lack of financial resources and to the need to work from a young age, he never had the opportunity to receive an education in agriculture. In his free time he likes to see movies and on occasion he cooks a delicious Chicharron de Chancho to share with his family. On his own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Luis started working in agriculture. He has a small plot where he plants corn. He works every day for about 12 hours and believes that he is doing well thanks to his experience and to the friendly service he provides to others.

Luis finds himself very grateful for the Kiva loans, seeings thanks to the help provided he will be able to purchase compost, fertilizer, and other products. This way he will be able to ensure that what he sows will grow well and he will be able to bring in a good harvest. If he continues working and putting forth tremendous effort to get ahead, his big dream is to increase his plantings.

loans.use: to purchase compost, fertilizer, and other items.

loans.name: Duc

texts.en:
Duc was born in 1957. She has three children who are workers and officers. Her husband is a worker who drills wells and makes wine. His income is about 2,500,000 dong (VND) each month. She is a rice milling worker to earn a living. She has done this job for 35 years. Her income is about 4,000,000 VND per month. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month.

Duc has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last cycle, she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy more rice to mill. She always wants to enlarge her business of milling rice.

loans.use: to buy more rice to mill.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is a single man and owns a transport business, which he has been running for five years. He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is competition. 

Juma is applying for a loan of 3,300 Kenya shillings to buy a modern charcoal stove. He believes that he will enjoy improved health because the stove does not emit smoke.

loans.use: To buy a modern charcoal stove.

loans.name: Lan's Group

texts.en:
Lan was born in 1968.  She has two children, a son who is a carpenter, and a daughter who has her own family.  Her husband is also a carpenter who makes a monthly income of 5,000,000 VND.  Lan collects iron scraps to earn a living.  She earns 4,000,000 VND a month.  Her family’s total earnings are about 15,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009.  In the last cycle, she borrowed 5,152,000 VND and repaid the loan on time.  In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,944,000 VND to collect more iron scraps to recycle.

Other members of Lan's group include Dao, Giang, Ut, and Xuan.  Dao was born in 1975 and has two children.  Giang was born in 1977 and has three children.  Ut was born in 1990 and has a child.  All three do farming and carpentry and would like to borrow 6,944,000 VND each to buy wood.  Xuan was born in 1968 and has two children.  She raises chickens and also does carpentry.  She would like to borrow 6,944,000 VND to buy chicken food and wood.

loans.use: to collect more iron scraps to recycle.

loans.name: Sulaika

texts.ru: Сулайка 46 лет, замужем, имеет 5 детей. Сулайка на протяжении 18 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Сулайка в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 1 корова 1 бычок, 13 голов овец и земельный надел 2,10 га где она выращивает картофель, фасоль и эспарцет. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса Сулайка составляет 15,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сулайка обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 бычка и на подготовка к весенне полевым работам, что позволит ей увеличить надои. Доходы от кредита Сулайка планирует вложить в образование детей.
texts.en: Sulaika is 46 years old, married, and has five children. She has raised animals for the past 18 years, a business she started with 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her tireless work Sulaika today owns a cow, a calf, 13 head of sheep, and a 2.1 hectare (5 acre) parcel of land where she grows potatoes, beans, and sainfoin. Her monthly income is now 15,000 som. To further develop her business, Sulaika turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a 60,000 som (KGS) loan to buy a bull calf and prepare for spring field work. This will allow her to increase milk production. Sulaika plans to invest revenue from use of the loan into her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase a bull and prepare for spring field work

loans.name: Tinh

texts.en:
Tinh was born in 1958. She has four children who are drivers, workers and sellers. Her husband is a guard. His income is about 3,000,000 dong (VND) each month. She is a rice milling worker to earn a living. She has done this job for 25 years. Her income is about 3,500,000 VND per month. Her family’s total earnings are about 12,000,000 VND per month.

Tinh has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle, she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy more rice to mill. She always wants to enlarge her business of milling rice.

loans.use: to buy more rice to mill.

loans.name: Chien

texts.en:
Chien was born in 1959. She has three daughters and a son. The daughters have got married. The son is a sausage seller. Chien and her husband are sausage makers to earn a living. She has done this job for 20 years. Her income is about 5,000,000 dong (VND) per month. Her family’s total earnings are about 20,000,000 VND per month.

Chien has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last cycle, she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy more ingredients to make sausages. She always wants to enlarge her business of making and selling sausages.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to make sausages.

loans.name: Tolgonai

texts.ru: Толгонай 44 года, замужем. мать 3 детей. В поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, в 1993 году Толгонай начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве, стартовав с покупки 5 овец. Благодаря упорному и настойчивому труду Толгонай, ее хозяйство на сегодня насчитывает 1 корова. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Толгонай обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян и удобрений для растениеводство. Доходы от кредита Толгонай планирует вложить в увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en: Tolgonai is 44 years old, married, and the mother of three children. In 1993 Tolgonai, in search of a source of income for her family, began her business in animal husbandry and farming, starting with the purchase of five sheep. Thanks to her tireless work and persistance, Tolgonai today owns a cow. With the goal of continued development of her business, Tolgonai turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a 50,000 som (KGS) loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for for her farm. Tolgonai plans to invest revenue from use of the loan into expanding her business.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mulkadar

texts.en:
Mulkadar is a 31-year-old farmer who breeds cattle for milk and meat purposes.  He is married and has 2 sons.  His elder son helps him a lot in his business.  He has 8 years of experience in this field and his financial income is 530 AZN. 

The village where Mulkadar lives is located in the southern part of Azerbaijan with very rigorous climate conditions.  In the summer, temperatures can reach 105 degrees Fahrenheit.  The main problem in the region is water for irrigation and animals.  Mulkadar is not able to build a water channel for his animals alone.  This is quite an expensive process which requires a labor force and special equipment.  When he heard about water loans he was extremely excited and applied for a 2,000 AZN loan.  He will use this loan to build the water channel, including tractor rental and paying for labor.

loans.use: to pay for special equipment and labor to dig a water channel.

loans.name: Buraima

texts.ru: Бурайма 42 года, замужем. Мать 6-х детей, самому старшему ребенку 17 лет. Муж и дети в свободное от учебы время помогают Бурайма в ведении бизнеса. Сейчас Бурайма занимается животноводством и полеводством. Свой бизнес она начала практически с нуля 20 лет назад. Ежемесячный доход Бурайма составляет около 15,000- 18,000 KGS. По характеру человек очень честный и целеустремленный. Все что она добилась, она добилась благодаря её трудолюбию. В целях дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на закуп скота для откорма с целью последующей реализации. На вырученные средства Бурайма собирается улучшить свои жилищные условия. В своих планах она рассказала, что хотела бы увеличить товарооборот и улучшить благосостояние семьи и обеспечить светлое будущее детям.
texts.en: Buraima is 42 years old and married. She has 6 children, the oldest of whom is 17 years old. Buraima's husband, and her children when they have free time from school, help her with the business. Currently Buraima raises animals and farms. She began the business from practically nothing 20 years ago. Her monthly income is around 15,000-18,000 KGS. She has a very honest and goal oriented personality. Everything that she has achieved is thanks to her diligence. With the goal of expanding her business, she came to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a 135,000 som (KGS) loan to buy livestock for feeding and future sale. Buraima wants to use the revenue earned to improve her housing conditions. She related how she would like to increase sales, improve her family's wellbeing and ensure that her children will have a bright future.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle for her farm

loans.name: Jose Amilcar

texts.es:
Jose, solicita un préstamo porque necesita comprar más productos para progresar en el negocio, en la venta de sorbetes, ya que cuenta con un vendedor más. El utilizara los fondos para comprar paletas de frutas , sorbete capuchino, sorbete de caja.
El crédito le sirvira en mucho porque en sus ventas y alcanzar otro frízer, se encuentra satisfecho con dicho crédito.  Las ganancias que espera le ayuden para seguir trabajando, ha tenido que reparar una bicicleta y un frízer  para el negocio por ende es un gasto, que al mismo tiempo le dara ganancias para cubrir lo necesario.
texts.en: Jose is asking for a loan because he needs to buy more products to make progress in his business.  He sells frozen treats and has an additional seller.  He will use the funds to buy fruit pops, cappuccino sorbet and packaged sorbets.  The loan will be of much use for his sales and to be able to obtain another freezer; he’s satisfied with the loan.  He hopes profits will help him stay in business.  He’s had to repair one of the bicycles and a freezer for the business which meant additional expenses so he hopes too that profits will provide enough to cover what’s necessary.

loans.use: to buy frozen pops and treats.

loans.name: Joha

texts.en:
Joha is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. He is a married father of three children. Joha sells liquor made from coconut juice. It is readily available and can be purchased by even low income earners.

Joha was introduced to Milango by his friends and joined to access credit for his business operations. Joha is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings to purchase cans for transporting the liquor. He looks forward to earning increased income from this investment to be able to pay for his children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase cans for tranporting the liquor.

loans.name: Haitali

texts.ru: Хайтали житель района Кубодиён. Ему 34 года. У него жена и трое детей. Хайтали совместно с женой занимается растениеводством. У него имеется земельный участок, где они выращивают овощи. Хайтали занимается этой деятельностью уже три года. В сезон посева Хайтали уже посеял овощи и теперь для обработки земли ему необходимы минеральные удобрения и топлива. Поэтому он обратился за кредитом. На полученный кредит Хаитали купит минеральные удобрения и топливо.
texts.en: Haitali is a resident of the Qubadiyon region of Tajikistan.  He's 34 years old, married and has three children.  He and his wife work in agriculture.  He has a plot of land where they grow vegetables.  This has been Haitali's profession for three years.  He has already planted for the season, but now to work the land, he needs minerals and fuel.  To help him makes these purchases, he's taking out a loan.  With the funds, Haitali will buy fertilizers and fuel.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and fertilizers

loans.name: Mamadali

texts.ru: Мамадали 63 года, он с женой воспитали 4 детей. В поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, в 1986 году Мамадали начал свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве, стартовав с суммы в 200 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному и настойчивому труду Мамадали, его хозяйство на сегодня приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) ежемесячной прибыли с продажи молочных продуктов и перепродажи скота. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Мамадали обратилася в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на семян и удобрений. Доходы от кредита Наргиля планирует вложить в увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en: Mamadali is 63 years old, married and raised 4 children.  In 1986, while searching for a source of income for his family, he started his own agriculture and livestock business with 200 KGS.  Thanks to his hard work and perseverance, Mamadali today earns around 10,000 KGS each month from the sale of milk products and from reselling livestock.  With the goal of further developing his business, Mamadali has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 35,000 KGS to buy seeds and fertilizers.  With the income the loan provides, Mamadali plans to further expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers to work the land

loans.name: Brenda Vanessa

texts.es:
Brenda, decidió obtener un nuevo crédito para seguir trabajando en su negocio. Este le permitirá comprar agujas para croché, hilo, tela, zíperes y así ir mejorando en su negocio poco a poco.  
Ella logro adquirir su negocio de croché  y comprar una maquina con las ganancias del trabajo que desempeña.
texts.en:
Brenda has decided to take out a new loan to continue operating her business. This will allow her to buy crochet needles, thread, fabric, and zips and so to improve her business, little by little. 

She was able to acquire her business and buy a machine with the earnings of the work she performs.

loans.use: to buy needles, thread, fabric and zips.

loans.name: Jose Gregorio

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la agricultora. El tiene 52 años de edad, vive con su esposa de 38 años, sus 3 hijos los cuales estudian y las edades de ellos oscilan entre los 12 y 18 años.
Se didica a la agricultura donde cultiva maíz, sembrando manzanas de milpa, toda su vida se ha dedicado a ello y lo realiza todos los días.  Con el préstamo podrá comprar semilla, abono y la preparación para la tierra.
La inversión le permitirá incrementar su inventario y cultivar una  manzana de tierra. Su objetivo es fortalecer su negocio y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: José works in agriculture and is 52 years old. He lives together with his wife who is 38 years old. They have three children who are enrolled in school and range in age from 12 to 18 years. As a farmer he grows corn, planting cleared fields in the milpas style. He has been working in this way all of his life and does it every day. With this loan he will purchase seed, compost, and pay for the tilling of the field. This investment will allow him to increase his inventory and cultivate a plot of land. His objective is to strengthen his business and provide a better quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase seed, compost, and work for the land.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith compró mercancías variadas y cumplió con los pedidos más importantes que le dieron mayor índice de ganancias. En su familia pudo contribuir con los gastos del hogar y se siente mas contenta. Ella envía un mensaje de agradecimiento a Kiva y dice que gracias a Kiva ha podido aumentar sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo en el gasto familiar.  Con su nuevo credikiva compró productos de belleza y de tocador su inversión proyecta ser segura pues su clientela tiene una   trayectoria de  buen comportamiento de pago.
texts.en:
Judith bought varied merchandise and filled the most important orders that produced the highest profit margins.  With respect to her family, she was able to contribute towards household expenses and she feels happier about that.  

She sends a message of gratitude to Kiva and says that thanks to Kiva she’s been able to increase income and help her husband with family expenses.  She used her new Kiva loan to buy beauty products and cosmetics and her investment bodes success because her customers have very good payment behavior.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and cosmetics.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion operates a hog fattening business as a source of income. After five months, she sells her hogs for a profitable price. She is 45 years of age and has been dedicating herself to this business for over 16 years. Now she is applying for a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy feed, medicine and vitamins. This will make her hogs healthier and will provide her a higher income.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicine and vitamins

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa is a 51-year-old who engages herself in cleaning bottles as a source of income. Their poor quality of life led her to become more hardworking. So, with her business, she patiently buys bottles, cleans and sells them. She has been doing this for two years and hopes to increase her income by asking for a loan of 9,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy additional bottles to clean. She hopes to earn more for the betterment of their lives and also to save for their future.

loans.use: to buy additional bottles to clean

loans.name: Zebo

texts.ru: Зебо женщина в возрасте 50 лет. Проживает в г.Конибадаме. Она была замужем,к сожалению несколько лет тому назад ее муж скончался. У Зебо двое детей. Ей приходится очень тяжело так как вся ответственность перед детьми на ней, но она не унывает и трудится не покладая рук. Зебо имеет высшее образование, но не работает по специальности, так как на одну зарплату она не сможет поднять детей на ноги. Она занимается купле-продажей сухофруктов. Этой деятельностью она занимается уже на протяжении пятнадцати лет. Товар она закупает в другом городе. Это ее основной и единственный доход. Ее дети в свободное от учебы время помогают ей. По совету своих знакомых Зебо решила подать заявку на кредит и обратилась в Арванд.   На полученный кредит она планирует закупить сухофруктов с другого города и продавать по дороже.  Очень надеется, что с помощью этого кредита сможет расширить свой бизнес и достойно поднять своих детей.
texts.en: Zebo is a 50 year old woman. She lives in the city of Konibodom. She was married, but unfortunately her husband passed away several years ago. Zebo has two children. She faces great hardship as she bears all the responsibility for her children and herself, but she does not get discouraged, and she works tirelessly. Zebo has a higher education, but does not work in her area of expertise since she cannot support her children on one salary. She works in sales of dried fruit, a business she has been in for the past 15 years. She buys goods in another city. This is her sole source of income. Her children help her when they are not in school. On the advice of friends, Zebo decided to apply for a loan, and turned to Arvand. She plans to use the loan to buy dried fruit from a different city and sell it at a higher price. She very much hopes that this loan will help her expand her business and adequately support her children.

loans.use: to buy dried fruits

loans.name: Sadridin

texts.ru:
Садридин мужчина в возрасте 27 лет, женат и имеет двоих детей.  После окончания общеобразовательной школы он не пошел учиться дальше,так как нужно было помогать своей семье. Семья у них большая, состоит из 6 человек. Садридин самый старший сын в семье. Его отец разнорабочий, основной работы нет, все время стоит на бирже труда. Садридину очень тяжело , ведь нужно поднимать на ноги не только своих братьев и сестер, а еще и своих детей. Несколько лет тому назад Садридин устроился работать в лепешечный цех.  Ему эта работа нравится  и у него огромное желание продолжать это производство.  Год назад Садридин открыл небольшую   собственную лепешечную у себя дома, у него не плохой доход от продаже лепешек . Теперь же у него в планах открыть отдельный цех по выпечки лепешек и других мучных изделий так как дома у него немного тесно.  Для этого пока ему не хватает денежных средств.
  Садридин обратился в Арванд  за кредитом. На полученный кредит он планирует закупить все необходимые продукты(несколько мешков муки, масло) для выпечки. Надеется что в дальнейшем  на   приобретенную выгоду начнет строить лепешечный цех  недалеко от своего дома.
texts.en: Sadridin is 27 years old, married, and has two children.  After graduating from secondary school, he could not continue his education because he needed to help his family.  He has a large family made up of 6 people.  Sadridin is the oldest son.  His father is a Jack of all trades, does not have a formal job, and spends much time at the employment office.  It is difficult for Sadridin, as he not only needs to help his brothers and sisters get on their feet, but also his parents.  A few years ago, he found work as a baker.  He likes this job and and would very much like to continue on in the profession.  One year ago, Sadridin opened his own, small bakery out of his home from which he receives a good return from selling his cakes.  Now he has plans to open an actual store from which to sell his baked goods since space is a bit tight at home.  He needs funds to do this.  Sadridin has turned to Arvand for a loan.  He will use the funds to buy all the necessary products (i .e. sacks of flour, butter) for baking.  He hopes that his future income will allow him to build his own bakery near his home.

loans.use: to buy a few bags of flour and butter

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru:
Назира  родилась 01.10.1986г, в семье чабана. В 2003г. окончила сш. в с.Чонарык, Токтогульского района. Заемщица вышла замуж 2003 году, от  брака имеет 4 сына.   В настоящее время занимается животноводство. 
Заемщица на протяжении 9 лет занимается животноводством, разведением КРС и МРС. Также параллельно занимается  полеводством, по  хозяйству помогает муж. Заемщица имеет не только практический опыт в животноводстве, но и теоретические навыки.  Заемщица  с большой ответственностью относится к своему делу. Ежегодно обрабатывает  2,8 га  земли,  выращивает  кукурузы, картофель, подсолнух,   занимается данным делом вместе с семьей. Супруг и сыновья помогают по хозяйству. В своем хозяйстве имеет 6 коров, 1 теленка, 5 овец,  имеет небольшой сарай, где имеются все необходимые условия для содержания скота. Назира обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 85,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота.
texts.en: Nazira was born on January 10, 1986 to a shepherd family. In 2003 she finished school in the town of Chon-Aryk, in the Toktogul district. This borrower married in 2003 and has four sons from the marriage. She currently practices animal husbandry. She has been raising small and large animals for 9 years. She has not only practical experience in livestock, buy also theoretical knowledge. She approaches her work with a great sense of responsibility. Every year she works 2.8 hectares of ground, where she raises corn, potatoes and sunflowers. She does these things together with her family. Her husband and sons help with the farm. They own six cows, one calf, and five sheep, and have a small barn with the requisite conditions for keeping animals. Nazira came to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a 85,000 som (KGS) loan to buy livestock.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Rhoa

texts.en: Rhoa is 19 years old. She operates a sari-sari store to help her parents promote their living. She works hard to meet her needs as well as her siblings'. With her determination to help provide for her family even in a simple way, she is asking for a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy noodles, shampoo, soap and spices to sell. She hopes to extend the business, earn higher income, and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy noodles, shampoo, soap and spices to sell

loans.name: Boboqul

texts.ru:
Бобокулу 57 лет. Он женат. У него трое сыновей и одна дочь. Он со своей семьей живет в районе Бохтар. Двое сыновей Бобокула уехали на заработки в Россию, а третий сын работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Жена и дочь домохозяйки.
 У Бобокула экономическое образование, но по специальности он не работал. Бобокул 8 лет как занимается животноводством. Он разводит крупно-рогатый скот и продает их на скотном рынке своего района. Сейчас Бобокул запрашивает кредит для купли и продажи крупно-рогатого скота с целью расширения своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Boboqul is 57 years old, married, and has 3 sons and 1 daughter. He lives with his family in the Bohtar region of Tajikistan.  Two of his sons have traveled to Russia to work, and another works on an orchard farm.  His wife and daughter work in the home.  Boboqul has a degree in economics but never worked in his profession.  For 8 years, he has worked with livestock.  He breeds cattle and sells them at a livestock market in the area.  He is now asking for a loan to buy and sell cattle with the goal of expanding his business.

loans.use: purchase and resell cattle

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en: Annaliza’s husband operates a motorized tricycle as a source of income. To help him make a higher income, she is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy tires and oil. With this loan, her husband will make more money and be better able to save for the education of their child. She aims to exceed his usual income because it’s scarcely enough for their everyday costs. She hopes that with this financial support, she and her husband will gain a higher income now.

loans.use: to buy tires and oil.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene, age 48, is selling cheap yet delicious ice cream. She needed to generate income to provide her family a better living. She wants to keep growing her business, but with an increase in demand, she doesn't have enough capital to keep up. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase milk, sugar and other ingredients for making delicious ice cream. Her goal is to supply the increasing demand of the customers in this summer season and to make more money and provide employment through hiring a saleslady/salesman. She hopes to achieve her objective soon.

loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar and other ingredients for making delicious ice cream.

loans.name: Abdulkhabir

texts.en:
Abdulkhabir is 24 years old. He is a married man and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He didn`t complete his education due to the bad situation he faced. He is the owner of an aluminum workshop. He is hardworking and strives to acquire the customers' satisfaction. 

He started up his business that was provided from his father to him; due to his experience working in this field, he could expand his business and that enables him to attract his customers. He is skillful in making cupboards and windows from aluminum. 

He applied for a youth loan of 200,000 YER (Yemen rials) to buy aluminum equipment so that he can increase his profit. He hopes to own a big house to live in for a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy aluminum equipment for his workshop.

loans.name: Nelda

texts.en:
Nelda is 36 years old and is selling “ukay-ukay” (used clothing) as a source of income. Her husband is her partner in making their living better. With her determination to achieve a higher income, she keeps on selling used clothes every day. 

She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy clothes, dresses, shoes and bags. She hopes to manage her business well and to be able to have a better living. She believes that adding more goods will attract customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes, dresses, shoes and bags.

loans.name: Adriana Natividad

texts.es: Adriana de 38 años, soltera, madre de dos hijos, es una mujer entregada a su familia como es una mujer que tiene que mantener sola a sus hijos ella decidió poner un negocio para poder ayudarse y salir adelante y ayudarse en los gastos del hogar hace ocho años, el negocio consiste en una pulpería, donde se venden todo tipo de productos como granos, gaseosas, golosinas entre otros, también vende mercadería en general,  como faldas, blusas, pantalones. Adriana solicita este crédito para ampliar su negocio compra ropa juvenil, de niño. Interior (faldas, blusas, pantalones, short entre otros). Está más que agradecida con los inversionistas Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ha podido darles una vida digna a sus hijos.
texts.en: Adriana is 38 years old, single, and the mother of two children. She is a person who is dedicated to her family. As a woman who has to provide for her two children by herself, she decided eight years ago to start a business to get ahead and be able to pay for the household expenses. Her business is a small grocery store where she sells all kinds of products, such as grains and soft drinks, among other things. She also sells general merchandise, such as skirts, blouses, and pants. Adriana is requesting this loan to grow her business and buy clothing for young people and children, underwear, skirts, blouses, pants, and shorts, among other things. She is more than thankful to the Kiva lenders, since it is thanks to their help that she has been able to give a dignified life to her children.

loans.use: to buy  clothing for young people, underwear, shirts, shorts, dresses, skirts; also things for her store, such as ice creams, basic grains, and sweets, among other products.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru:
Эльмира  родилась в 10.08.1982г. в семье чабана. В 1999 г. окончила сш. в с.Чолпоната, Токтогулького района. Заемщица вышла замуж 2000 году, от  брака имеет 4 сыновей.   В настоящее время занимается животноводством.  
Заемщица c 2007 года занимается животноводством, разведением КРС и МРС. Также параллельно занимается  полеводством, по  хозяйству помогает муж. Заемщица имеет не только практический опыт в животноводстве, но и теоретические навыки.  Заемщица  с большой ответственностью относится к своему делу. Ежегодно обрабатывает  1 га земли,  занимается данным делом вместе с семьей. Супруг и сыновья помогают по хозяйству. В своем хозяйстве имеет  2 коровы, 2 телят,  имеет небольшой сарай, где имеются все необходимые условия для содержания скота. Эльмира обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения доходов от продажи скота.
texts.en: Elmira was born August 10th, 1982 into a family of shepherds.  She finished the Cholponata school in the Toktogyl region in 1999 and married in 2000.  She and her husband have 4 sons.  She currently works with livestock.  Since 2007 she has worked breeding cattle as well as farming; her husband helps her with her work.  Not only does she have practical experience with livestock, but also theoretical skills.  She treats her responsibilities with great respect.  Each year, she works 1 hectare of land together with her family.  Her spouse and sons help her there.  She now has 2 cows, 2 calves and has a small barn where she has everything required to keep cattle.  Elmira has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy cattle to increase her income from selling them.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is 27 years old. He is a married man and has one child; he dreams to offer him a good life and education. Amer lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a taxi driver who exerts as much effort as he can to provide for his family's expenses. He didn't complete his education because he didn't find anybody to assist him in his studying. 

He said that business is not getting more profitable, and he intends to repair his taxi. So he applied for a youth loan of 100,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB to buy spare parts for repairing his taxi. He hopes to buy a new taxi one day instead of the taxi that he has to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for repairing his taxi.

loans.name: Kulpotkan

texts.ru:
Кулпоткан,  родилась в 07.02.1966г.,  в семье чабана. В 1983г. окончила сш. в с.Токент, Токтогулького района. Заемщица вышла замуж 1985 году, от  брака имеет 4 сыновей. В настоящее время занимается животноводство, оказывает услугу  населению, летом семьей выезжает на джайлоо, со своим скотом и  односельчан, на уч. Итагар. В  сезон доход  от услуг  составляет среднем 50 000- 90000 сомов, в год.    
Заемщица на протяжении с 1999 года занимается животноводством, разведением КРС и МРС. Также параллельно занимается  полеводством, по  хозяйству помогает муж. Заемщица имеет не только практический опыт в животноводстве, но и теоретические навыки.  Заемщица  с большой ответственностью относится к своему делу. Супруг и сыновья помогают по хозяйству. В своем хозяйстве имеет  2 коровы, 1 теленка, 20 овец,  имеет небольшой сарай, где имеются все необходимые условия для содержания скота.Кулпоткан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец и бычков.
texts.en: Kulpotkan was born February 7th, 1966 into a family of shepherds.  She finished Tokent High School in the Toktogul region in 1983.  She married in 1985 and has 4 sons with her husband.  Kulpotkan currently works with livestock, offering basic services to her clients when she and her family go to pasture for the summer with their cattle.  Each season, the income from services rendered is between 50,000 to 90,000 KGS.  She has also bred cattle since 1999.  At the same time, Kulpotkan also farms; her husband and sons help her with her work.  She has practical experience with livestock, but also theoretical skills.  She treats her responsibilities with great respect.  She now owns 2 cows, 1 calf, 20 sheep and has a small barn where she has everything needed to keep livestock.  Kulpotkan has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy sheep and bulls.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients for her foods, such as meat, vegetables, banana, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Chuon's Group

texts.en:
Chuon, age 57 and a widow, is a local farmer who has rice crops and raises four pigs as the main source of her income. The business that she has been with for 30 years returns her about 26,700 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

This is the first microloan of her group, which is comprised of two female members. Both of them are seeking the same loan amount, 200,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy pig feed. She highly hopes that she can raise her pigs in good health conditions and sell them for a high price so she can expand this business in a bigger scale by purchasing more pigs for raising and by making a big pigpen.

loans.use: To buy pig feed.

loans.name: Njete Group

texts.en:
Margaret is a member of Njete Group in Chwele District. She is pictured with 12 One Acre Fund farmers, all of them women. Margaret is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for half an acre of millet and sorghum cultivation. Margaret first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains season and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Margaret joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and access the best input prices. 

Margaret reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about half a bag of maize per half acre, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, she harvested 5 bags per half acre! She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and save for the future. 

During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive half an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Margaret’s group will receive six acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Ibtihal

texts.en:
Ibtihal is an Iraqi youth client, who is 26 years old, married, and has two children. Ibtihal assists her husband in providing the income for their family.

Ibtihal works from her own house and specializes in tailoring women's outfits. She has been in this field since her childhood but chose to take this as her career path in 2005 and opened her own business. She has a lot of experience in this field and has gained an excellent reputation.

Ibtihal is requesting a sum of $2,400 as a youth loan to buy a motor generator and a new sewing machine. She aims to grow her business and increase her profits so she will be able to provide her children with better life conditions and a good education.

loans.use: To buy a motor generator and a new sewing machine

loans.name: Aws Group

texts.en: This group is called Aws and is comprised of three members. They live in Taiz, Yemen. They took a loan of 130,000 YER. Lubnan is the coordinator of the group, and she is a 23-year-old single woman. She oversees the financial issues and responsibilities for her brothers and parents. She is an educated woman who likes to read and keep up on the current events in the world. She does not have a television, so she applied for a youth loan of 40,000 YER from AMB to buy a television to use in her house. She hopes to improve her living condition.

loans.use: to buy a television to use in her house.

loans.name: Margaret Njeri

texts.en:
Margaret is married with five children; four are in school and one is still an infant. She lives at Kairi sublocation in Thika district in Central Kenya. 

She is a member of VEP through her group called Nguna Mothers, which she has been a member of for the last five years. Through the group she has been able to save some money for her children's education and take loans to expand her farming business.

Margaret and her husband earn their living from dairy and poultry farming. They have three dairy cows from which they get 10 liters of milk per day. They use two liters for family tea and sell the remaining eight liters. Their 20 chickens produce at least 12 eggs per day. With earnings from these activities, they are able to make at about $125 per month, which they use to feed their family and pay for their children's school fees.

Margaret is requesting a loan to construct a biogas facility on her farm. She has already received a training on the technology and on potential savings in terms of time, money, and fuel. 

With biogas she can light her house and cook with a clean gas source, meaning that will no longer need to purchase charcoal and kerosene. Her children can also study better with better lighting. Slurry from the biogas will also improve the quality of animal feeds and increase her milk production. From fuel savings and and the income from farming, she will be able to repay her loan.

loans.use: To install a biodigester

loans.name: Lily Lom Group

texts.en:
Hechong  is one of the member of Lily Lom  and she is featured with her hand raised. Hechong and her husband live in a village with their three kids. As a saying goes, “Beggars can’t be choosers,”  and this applies to Hechong. She takes up all possible ways of earning, say for example cutting trees for firewood, construction of roads, and farming in the jungles. Her income generating activities are undependable and unreliable. 

Hechong wants to get the loan and start her own business by selling vegetables in the nearby market .  She firmly believes that this will enable her to earn more on a daily basis and have some savings because it is a non-seasonal business activity.  She wants to give a better education to her kids as she was deprived of this facility when she was a kid. She narrates the disadvantages and obstacles she faced in regards to running the family since she is not educated. 

Hechong is elated to share her dreams as she assures herself that she will work with her heart and soul  for her dreams to come true. She wants to thank WSDS for the assistance and wishes to continue working with the organisation.
   
The rest of the group members are active in selling vegetables and charcoal.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell in the market.

loans.name: Shamsan

texts.en:
Shamsan is 29 years old, a married man, and has two children who live in Sana`a, Yemen. He completed secondary school only. He is the owner of an aluminum workshop which is his principal source of income. He becomes the unique successor in his family. He is an incredibly hard-working man and, as a result, has a lot of experience. 

Through lots of effort, he has managed to make windows and doors, which provide him with the income necessary. Due to the bad situation in Yemen, he suffers from increasing prices from the market where he purchases aluminum. He took a youth loan of 300,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase aluminum supplies which will increase the sales for his business. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase aluminum supplies which will increase the sales of his business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a 47-year-old widow and mother of four grown children. After her husband passed away, Edna was determined not to live on charity. She took her skills and began selling baked and specialty goods to private customers and through stores. After discussing her prospects and negotiating with additional stores for larger amounts of her products, Edna decided she needed to upgrade her business and enable herself to produce larger numbers of products. With her larger sale numbers, Edna is increasing her profits.

Edna needed this loan to assist with buying an electric kneader, electric sieve, freezer, packing materials, kashrut certification, and publicity for her business.

Edna is on her way to developing a successful business and has huge potential. In the future she wants to further expand her business and hire staff to assist her in preparation, sales, and delivery.

loans.use: to buy an electric kneader, electric sieve, freezer, packing materials, kashrut certification, and publicity for her baking business

loans.name: Margarito

texts.es:
Margarito,  posee una tienda. El convive con su esposa y con sus 3 hijos, las edades son de 17, 14 y 10 años, El negocio lo atienden ellos, turnándose con todos los miembros de la familia, ya que trabajan de 6:00 am a 7:00 pm, el trabajo lo aprendieron realizándolo.
El préstamo que solicita le servirá para comprar mercadería, sal, azucar, frijoles, aceite, galletas, boquitas, entre otros y así poder surtir el negocio, también le permitirá competir con más tiendas y por ende adquirir mayores productos.   
Las aspiraciones que el tiene, es poder darles el estudio a sus hijos para que ellos vayan superándose en el ámbito de la educación, al igual crecer en el negocio.
texts.en:
Margarito has a shop: He lives with his wife and their three children, who are aged 17, 14 and 10 years old all whom work in the shop. Everybody takes a turn as the shop is open from 6am until 7pm and they all learned what to do on the job.
This loan will help Margarito to buy items such as salt, sugar, beans, oil, biscuits and snacks to stock up the business. It will also allow him to compete with more shops and so acquire better products. 
Margarito wants to provide his children with a good education so that they develop academically. He also wants to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, beans, oil, biscuits and snacks.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is a 32-year-old married man with one child. He has been operating a clothing store. He has experience in this business and therefore has a great deal of knowledge about the market and the demands of his customers. He is a very successful entrepreneur, partly because of his shop's great location in the central bazaar. He started his business with small amount. He is the sole source of income for his family. He intends to expand his business, so he applied for a loan of 350,000 YER from AMB to purchase more clothing and perfumes to diversify the range of goods to satisfy his customers' demands.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing and perfumes to diversify the range of goods to satisfy his customers' demands.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Don Pedro tiene 61 años, es soltero, tiene 3 hijos, vive en una aldea del municipio de Las Vegas, Santa Barbará.
Don Pedro toda su vida se ha dedicado a los trabajos de la agricultura, hace 40 años el cultiva la tierra específicamente hortalizas, como remolacha, brócoli y zanahoria. La comunidad donde el vive es apta para este tipo de cultivos. Tiene una gran experiencia para el cultivo de estos productos, ha logrado con este negocio tener buenos ingresos para el sustento de su familia. Estos productos los comercializa en el mercado local a un buen precio. 
Solicita un préstamo a Odef de 15,000 lempiras para compra de fertilizantes y preparación de la tierra para tener una buena cosecha y aumentar su producción.
La meta de Don Pedro es hacer crecer sus cultivos y seguir dando el mantenimiento necesario.
texts.en:
Pedro is 61 years old. He is single and has three children. He lives in a village near the town of Las Vegas in Santa Barbará.
Pedro has been working in agriculture all his life. For forty years he has been working the land, growing vegetables such as beetroot, broccoli and carrots. The community where Pedro lives is perfect for this type of crops. Pedro has a lot of experience growing these crops and he has successfully earned a good income to support his family with the business. He sells the products for a good price at the local market. 
Pedro is applying for a loan of 15,000 Lempiras from Odef. He will use it to buy fertliser, to prepare the land for a good harvest and to increase his production.
Pedro's goal is to increase his crop yield and keep maintaining his land as necessary.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser, prepare the land and increase his crop yield.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Don Raúl tiene 59 años de edad, es casado, vive con su esposa en el Municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa.
Don Raúl hace 40 años trabaja la tierra cultivando yuca, café y maíz, frijol. Estos productos los vende en el mercado local, con este negocio ha salido adelante con su familia. También con los financiamientos que ha solicitado le han ayudado a mantener sus cultivos en buena calidad.
Actualmente, esta solicitando el cuarto préstamo de 6,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizante y darle  mejor mantenimiento al cultivo. Esto le ayudara a sacar mejores cosechas y poder vender a un mejor precio.
Su meta es ampliar sus cosechas para tener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Raúl is 59 years old. He is married and lives with his wife in the town of Santa Cruz de Yojoa.
Raúl has now been working the land and growing yucca, coffee, corn and beans for 40 years. He sells these products in the local market and his business has been helping him to move his family forward. The loans that he has applied for have helped him to maintain good quality crops.
Raúl is currently applying for a fourth loan of 6000 Lempiras to buy fertiliser to maintain his crops. This loan will help him to improve his harvests and to sell the crops at a better price.
Raúl's goal is to increase his harvests so as to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser to maintain his crops.

loans.name: Nzara

texts.en:
Nzara is a married woman and lives with her spouse; she’s very happy with him. She owns a small, well-stocked grocery store, where she works very hard every day. She’s had her small business for three years and, thanks to her work and sacrifice, it’s been growing. She relates that her husband always helps her in everything he can, and they are growing this way.

Nzara requests the loan to buy milk, bread, meats, beverages, and other products needed to stock the store, to continue growing and providing customers with everything they need.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her grocery store, such as milk, bread, meats, and beverages

loans.name: Majani

texts.en:
Majani is 31 years old and married. He lives with his wife and four children in Samburu. He says that before he started his business he was doing a farming business. Because of that he and his wife were able to accumulate a significant amount of capital and decided to start-up his retail shop. They built their house and decided to open a store with their savings. Thanks to their effort and hard work his business has expanded. He now has a steady clientele because of the good and friendly service he provides his customers.

He is requesting a loan to purchase supplies for his store, such as beverages, groceries, vegetables and other products.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for his store, such as beverages, groceries, vegetables and other products.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Musu.  She is married and has five children, aged 19, 17, 15, 13, and 8 years. 

Musu owns a food and drinks business.  She began her business when her salary was not enough in assisting her husband at home. She decided to set up her own business for more money. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are all classes of people. Working 7 days a week and 16 hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. 

Musu would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. She requires a loan in order to increase her drinks (stock) level and purchase foodstuff, all for resale. She hopes that this loan will help with much capital, so she can buy all the taste her customers need, and sales will increase. 

In the future, Musu plans to finish her house with additional support from her husband. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for more food and drinks.

loans.name: Los Amigos Empresarios Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Los Amigos Empresarios” y está conformada por 10 socios, dicho grupo pasan a su 2 ciclo. Siendo Katty una de las integrantes. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas al por mayor, trabaja de esta manera hace mas de 3 años. A sus 30 años Katty ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y apoyar a sus padres. Su mayor deseo es de seguir mejorando su negocio. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de frutas y de esta manera cumplir con sus pedidos. Katty es soltera y actualmente vive con sus padres. El  grupo  “Los Amigos Empresarios” agradecen el crédito brindado y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien.  Katty se encuentra sentada, es la primera del lado derecho  y viste polo celeste.   En la parte superior al lado izquierdo esta la señora Irma, la cual no pudo llegar a tiempo por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en: This is the “Los Amigos Empresarios” [the Enterprising Friends] group. It is made up of 10 members and is in their second cycle. Katty is one of the members. She buys and sells fruit wholesale and she has done this for 3 years. At 30 years old, Katty has been able to improve her home and help her parents. Her biggest wish is to keep improving her business. She asked for the loan to to buy fruit so she can fill her orders. Katty is single and right now lives with her parents. The “Los Amigos Empresarios” group is grateful for the loan that has been offered and committed to keep working well. Katty is sitting in the photo, first from the right and wearing a light blue shirt. In the upper left corner is Irma,  who was unable to get there on time because of work.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Denis Miguel

texts.es: Denis es un joven que empezó a laborar desde los 18 años de edad hoy en día se desempeña como asesor de ventas, con sus ingresos paga la mensualidad de sus estudios universitarios, ahora está por culminar su profesión y necesita pagar el curso de titulación de su carrera lo que su salario no le permite pagar de una sola vez ya que es muy bajo, por este motivo el solicita apoyo de crédito para poder cubrir con este gasto, lo que le ayudara a optar por un mejor empleo en el futuro y así poder ayudar a su familia y a la comunidad con sus conocimientos.
texts.en: Denis is a young man who started to work 18 years ago. Right now, he works as a sales assistant and with his income he pays for his studies at university. Now he is about to finish his degree and he needs to pay for a course to get his degree. He can't pay for it all at once with his salary, because it is very low. That is why he is asking for the loan to be able to cover this expense. This will help him get a better job in the future and help his family and the community with his knowledge.

loans.use: to pay for a course to get his degree

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Luchadoras trabaja en su ciclo número 9, y dos de sus integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza. Ellas son personas muy trabajadoras que pese a sus problemas quieren seguir con su trabajo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Felicia, quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno. Ella hace un tiempo que se dedica a la Venta de Ropa , también se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder superar la pobreza.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de blusas, pantalones, jeans lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called Mujeres Luchadoras is working on its 9th cycle. Two of its members are under the poverty line. They are very hardworking women who despite their problems want to get ahead with their work. 

One of the members if Felicia. During the last survey, she showed a level of poverty within level one. She has been selling clothes for some time. The work of the consultants is also worth noting. They do permanent follow-ups with training and verification  that both challenge and incentivize the women to fight to overcome poverty. 

She is asking for this loan to buy blouses, pants and jeans. This will help her cement her business plan, which will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, jeans, etc.

loans.name: Central Group

texts.en:
Paul is pictured on the right with his hand raised amongst his Central Group members. The group consists of 15 members, 9 women and 6 men, who are farmers in Chwele District. Farming inputs will be delivered to him on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of millet and sorghum. Paul first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Paul joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and also because One Acre Fund educates the members about good farming practices and banking.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Paul was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize per 1/2 acre, but after joining One Acre Fund, when he planted during the Long Rains 2012, he was able to harvest 8 bags per ½ acre! He plans on using future profits from the harvest to buy a cow and start a poultry farm. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Paul’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 7.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Sagar's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée lors du premier cycle du banc villageois, il est composé de 22 femmes issu du même quartier, ou des quartiers environnants, et unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
Soukeye, la représentante du groupe, a 61 ans, elle est mariée, mère de 7 enfants et  a 7 petits enfants qui sont a sa charge. 
Elle fait de la restauration (Petit déjeuner)devant son domicile et a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.
Avec son prêt de 50 000f elle compte acheter une bonne quantité de lait, sucre, café, beurre et chocolat pour mener à bien son activité.

Avec ses bénéfices elle souhaite payer les frais scolaires ,sanitaire et alimentaires de ses enfants et petits enfants.
texts.en:
This group was set up during the Banc Villageois' first cycle and is made up of 22 women from the same district or surrounding districts; they are united by good social and professional relationships.

Soukeye, who is the representative of the group, is 61 years old, married and is mother to seven children with seven grand-children who are also in her care. 

She has a restauration activity (breakfasts) in front of her home and has good experience in this field. With her loan of 50,000 francs she is planning to buy a large quantity of milk, coffee, butter and chocolate to be able to carry out her business successfully. 

With her profits she would like to pay for her children's and grand-children's schooling, health and food.

loans.use: to buy milk, coffee, butter, chocolate and sugar.

loans.name: Namawanga Group

texts.en:
Knight’s group has 16 farmers and they reside in Chwele District. Knight is pictured on the right of the Namawanga Group with her hand raised. Knight is pictured amongst the 7 men and 9 women of her group. She will receive input loans capable of planting ½ an acre with sorghum and millet. Knight first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Knight joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and also because One Acre Fund provides the inputs at the right time for her to plant earlier.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Knight was only able to harvest 1 1/2 bags of maize per ½ acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, she was able to harvest 15 bags per ½ acre! She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and buy land. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Knight’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 8 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Nicholas' Group

texts.en: Nicholas is a forty-five year old dryland farmer and father of five children. He and his wife do not have the capital to invest in fertilizers and pesticides for their crops, and the lack of rain reduces yields. Nicholas is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program so that he may educate his children with the profits he receives from his tree farm.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha lives in the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has three school going children. She owns a retail shop which deals in sale of construction materials, mainly building poles.
Asha learnt about Milango through advertisements and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is high cost of transportation.
Asha is applying for a loan of 73,050 Kenya shillings to buy building poles. She believes that the business has improved enough to meet the required repayments for the loan.

loans.use: to buy building poles.

loans.name: Union Y Desarrollo 1, 2 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Maritza is the coordinator of the group called Union y Desarrollo (Unite and Development) 1, 2 & 4, located in the town of Hato Mayor, where their economy depends on farming. It is one of the most rural towns in the Dominican Republic. She lives with her five children and her long-term partner. She enjoys being with her family, taking care of her children and attending to their needs.

Maritza has been selling clothes for around six years. She started her business with her own savings. She is receiving her third loan from Esperanza International after having paid off her previous loan satisfactorily and thereby having taken a step towards the growth of her business. She is planning to invest her new loan in the purchase of clothing, for women, men and kids. Martiza plans to use her profits to invest in her business and continuing saving. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouse, underwear, shirts and other clothing items.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya.
