He is a married father of four and runs an entertainment business, basically dealing in hiring of music instruments and musicians. Francis learnt about Milango through advertisements and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is lack of finance, a problem he sees partly sorted by this loan. Francis is applying for a loan of 83,450 Kenya shillings to purchase chairs. He believes that the business has grown enough to meet the required repayments for the loan and family needs.

loans.use: to purchase chairs to be for entertainment functions.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has five children. She is a fish monger, a business that he has been operating for eleven years.

Annet learnt about Milango through friends who invited her to the group, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. She is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to purchase a new stock of fish. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to buy basic needs and improve on her living standard. 

Her dream is to sell wholesale and become a supplier in the area.

loans.use: to purchase a new stock of fish.

loans.name: Mona Fadhle Group

texts.en:
Mona Fadhle is a group of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan in the amount of YER 160,000 to buy a PC.
Naema, a 29-year-old single woman, is the leader of the group. She lives in Sana'a, Yemen with her parents. Naema is a university student and in great need of a PC to use for her studies in college. Having a PC will help her to do assignments and surf the internet to expand her knowledge. She cannot go to internet cafés because of some social restrictions. The only solution for her is to have her own PC, so she asked for a loan in the amount of YER 50,000 from AMB. Naema looks forward to completing her studies and finding a job so she is able to buy new home appliances for her family.

loans.use: to buy a PC to help her with her studies at university.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. He is a married father of five school going children. He owns rental houses, businesses that he has been operating for eighteen years. Besides this, he is also formally employed. He learnt of Milango from a friend and joined the organization to get credit for business operations.
Justine is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to pay school fees for his children.
The only challenge in the current business is when some customers do not pay their rent on time, but Justine looks forward to overcome this by increasing the number of rental houses.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Maqtari Group

texts.en:
Maqtari is a group of four women from Hodeida, Yemen. They asked for a YER 80,000 loan to pay for purchasing potatoes and a chip fryer.
Ayoash is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Hodeida, Yemen. She is uneducated and lives with her husband. Once she had children, her husband couldn’t cover the living expenses of his family though he works very hard and for long hours. Ayoash is a very caring wife and mother. She couldn’t see her husband working for long hours and not help him. So she decided to help him and start up a small business two years ago. She sells boiled potatoes and chips on the street. Now she wants to buy potatoes and a chip fryer to make better and healthier chips. Thus she applied for a loan in the amount of YER 20,000. Ayoash hopes to make more profits and open a cafeteria.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and a chip fryer.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma's business is running well. She used the previous loan to buy a motorcycle, which has helped to increase/diversify her sources of income. She is currently applying for a loan of 64,450 Kenya shillings to add a new stock of construction materials to her hardware store.
Salma believes this will improve her income and help meet her basic needs and the required loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy a new stock of construction materials for her hardware store.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
The retail shop which Salim restocked using the previous loan has been of great help over last year to the family. He was able to pay for his children's school fees from the extra income obtained.
Salim has seen the business progress with time and is asking for an additional loan to increase the stock in the shop. His desire is to grow the business until it is well stocked like a wholesale shop.
He is applying for a loan of 62,700 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of retail products like sugar, flour, milk, etc.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of retail products like sugar, flour, milk, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Princess

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Princess works hard to support her family.
She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Princess is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.
Princess has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her food production.

loans.name: Rosel

texts.en:
Rosel is 37 years old and married with three children who are in school.
Rosel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell in her general store like snack foods, canned goods, noodles, soap, etc.
Rosel has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.
Rosel aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchased items to sell in her general store like snack foods, canned goods, noodles, soap, etc.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Analiza works hard to support her family.
She sells coconut vinegar in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal and brooms. Analiza is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of coconut vinegar to sell. Analiza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of coconut vinegar to sell.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines.
She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, eggs, soap, milk, coffee, noodles, spices, etc. for her general store.
Annabelle has been in this business for 3 years. Annabelle earns more income from buying and selling fish and vegetables.
Annabelle has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, eggs, soap, milk, coffee, noodles, spices, etc for her general store.

loans.name: Elda

texts.en:
Elda is 59 years old, married and has two children.
Elda is in the agricultural business of buying and selling pigs in the Philippines. Elda requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional pigs to sell.
Elda has been buying and selling pigs for 8 years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.
In the future, Elda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena works hard to support her family. Elena is married and has a general store in the Philippines.
Elena requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks to sell for her general store like canned goods, soft drinks, bread, noodles, eggs, spices, etc..
Elena has been in this business for 4 years now.
In the future, Elena would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy stocks to sell for her general store like canned goods, soft drinks, bread, noodles, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Oñondivepa está en su ciclo número  17  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde dos integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Alberta, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno.  Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que hace Venta de Comestible. Ella comenta que con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo esta saliendo adelante, también cuenta que gracias al buen trabajo que hace, esta ganado los ingresos que necesita para seguir ayudando a su familia.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de panificados, embustidos, mayonesa, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos y también poder así cumplir con sus clientes que siempre compran de ella sus alimentos.
texts.en:
This group, called "Oñondivepa", is in its 17th cycle of the women committee program, where all members work and help each other to get ahead. They took part in the "poverty elimination" survey and two members were found to be below the poverty line.

One of the group’s members is Mrs. Alberta, who was found to be living in poverty level one. She says that she works selling food. She is getting ahead with a lot of effort and sacrifice and thanks to her work, she is making a living and supporting her family.

Alberta is requesting this loan to buy bakery products, cold cuts and mayonnaise. With these supplies, she will be able to make her business plan a reality, improve her income and satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy bakery products, cold cuts and mayonnaise, among other supplies.

loans.name: Qosay Group

texts.en:
Qosay is a group which consists of four ladies who live in Hodeida, Yemen. They have asked for a loan in the amount of YER 80,000 to buy clothes, cosmetics and perfume to resell.

Amina, 39 years old, is a married woman who has seven children and lives in Hodeida, Yemen. She has been selling clothes and perfumes for more than five years to help her family. At the beginning, she was selling perfumes and incense in her neighborhood. After few years, she expanded her business and started selling clothes. Now, she would like to expand her business and buy more clothes and cosmetics to target new clients in new areas, so she applied for a loan of YER 20,000. 

Amina hopes to have her own clothes and cosmetics store.

loans.use: buy clothes, cosmetics and perfume to resell.

loans.name: Dolgorjav

texts.en:
Mrs. Dolgorjav is 54 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a Ger in Huvsgul province of Mongolia. Her husband Olziibayar, age 58, works as a driver in the local market. Her daughter Baasan-Otgon works in a local company. 

The borrower worked as an assistant teacher in a kindergarten and retired in 2010. She used to plant trees and produce organic products in the kindergarten. She is starting to plant seabuckthorn and to produce organic products. 

She is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT to purchase seeds and soils to produce organic fruit products. She is a hardworking, friendly and welcoming woman.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and soils to produce organic fruit products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase equipment and tools to increase the production level of their organic camel wool products manufacturing business.

loans.name: Jocel

texts.en:
Jocel is married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jocel is 28 years old and has two children who are in school.

Jocel has a blacksmith business in the Philippines. Jocel requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials like iron, rod, wood, charcoal, etc for her business.

Jocel has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Jocel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like iron, rods, wood and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase necessary equipment and tools to start his business

loans.name: Los Amigos Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LOS AMIGOS está  compuesto por nueve integrantes siete mujeres y dos varones,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Bertha  tiene 31 años, y dos hijos  que tienen las edades de uno y dos años,  La Sra. Bertha se dedica  a la   venta de cosméticos por catalogo, ella vende sus productos de manera ambulante, visitando domicilios y oficinas públicas y privadas de la ciudad Santa Cruz,  donde ofrece sus productos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Bertha va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de cosmético y joyas por mayor y que se encuentran en promoción y de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Bertha va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de productos de belleza, la Sra. Bertha es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The communal bank LOS AMIGOS is comprised of nine members: seven women and two men.  The president of the group is Bertha, 31, who has two children, ages one and two years old.  Bertha sells cosmetics by catalogue on a door-to-door basis to homes and public and private offices in the city of Santa Cruz.  This loan is her first through the institution and Bertha will use it to buy discount cosmetics and jewelry wholesale.  This way she will be able to provide her clientele with a variety of products so she can increase her income.

The reason she is requesting the loan is to improve her business.  Bertha will use the profits to continue buying beauty products.  She is a very hard-working person who is happy about this opportunity given to her and her group of entrepreneurs, because in some cases they maintain their families on their own.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and jewelry wholesale.

loans.name: Cristo Viene Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento CRISTO VIENE Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Filomena tiene 49 años y es casada con 4 hijos que son de las edades de 16, 14, 12 y 10 años, todos se encuentran en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la venta de la hoja de coca, que es una hoja tradicional, mucha gente la utiliza para curra distintos males de forma de mate o también masticándola para evitar la fatiga, por eso esta hoja es muy consumida, la Sra.  Filomena tiene su puesto de venta en la zona de alto Llojeta,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución Sra.  Filomena va a usar este préstamo para la compra de taques de coca y así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo la Sra.  Filomena enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen varias personas que venden coca, pero para vender este producto se necesita de un permiso la Sra.  Filomena va a utilizar los beneficios compra en seguir surtiendo su puesto de venta, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella y a sus compañeras de grupo.
texts.en:
The entrepreneurial bank CRISTO VIENE is comprised of eight members: six women and two men.  The president of the bank is Filomena, 49, who is married and has four school-aged children, 16, 14, 12 and 10.  She sells traditional coca leaves for a living.  Many people use them to cure their ills, either in the form of infusion or chewing them to avoid fatigue, so it is something that is widely consumed.  

Filomena has a stall in the high area of Llojeta.  This is her first loan through the institution and she plans to use it to buy packs of coca leaves so she can increase her work capital.  Filomena is up against competition since many people sell coca, but in order to sell the product one needs a license.  Filomena will use the profits to continue stocking her stall.  She is happy and grateful to the institution for the support given to her and the other members of the group.

loans.use: To buy coca leaves.

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en:
Mr. Battulga is 41 years old and lives with his wife and 3 children in a house in the Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife Lhagvasuren, age 40, is currently unemployed. His son Mongonshagai, age 17, and twin daughters Oyuntungalag and Otgontungalag, age 14, go to a local school. 

Battulga has been running an inter-city transportation service since 2009. He has a lot of experience in the transportation business and is now requesting 5,000,000 MNT to purchase an eco-friendly energy efficient car to provide a taxi service business in town. He is a hardworking, well behaved and honest man.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly energy efficient car to provide taxi service business in town

loans.name: Bayarbat

texts.en:
Mr. Bayarbat is 32 years old and lives with his wife and son in a rental apartment in Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife, Lhagvasuren, age 32, works as a university professor. His son, Monh-Erdene, age 1, goes to a local kindergarten. This borrower has been running a butcher shop for years, and now he is starting to run a cafeteria and karaoke business in a rental place.

Mr. Bayarbat requested a loan of 5,000,000 tugriks to purchase equipment to start his cafeteria and karaoke business. He is a hardworking, optimistic and decent man.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to start his cafeteria and karaoke business in a rental place

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, onions, salt, margi, tomatoes, pepper, etc., in bulk to add to her current stock

loans.name: Tawopaneh Osusu Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the Tawopaneh Osusu Group. They are small scale businesspeople based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Alimamy. Alimamy is age 35. He was born in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a trader and the couple has five children – four of whom are attending primary schools. Alimamy has been a businessman for 15 years now. He sells cigarettes, biscuits, toothpaste, batteries, etc. Alimamy has applied for this loan in order to expand his business. He will use his share of the loan to buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, biscuits, toothpaste, batteries, etc., in bulk to add to his current stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new bicycle to replace the one he has, and to to buy supplies to make tortillas.

loans.name: Chantsal

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantsal is 49 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children in a house in the Bayanhoshuu province of Mongolia. Her husband and 2 older children run their Mongolian Ger (a traditional Mongolian nomadic felt housing tent similar to a yurt) organic felt cover and insulation material family business in their home and sell them from a rental counter of a local market. Her youngest daughter Badmaarag, age 9, goes to a local school.

Chantsal and her family have been running the Mongolian Ger organic felt cover and insulation material business since 1997. She is now requesting 6,000,000 MNT to purchase inventory for their organic felt cover and insulation material family business. She is a hardworking, well-organized and open-minded woman.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for their organic felt cover and insulation material business

loans.name: Nyevu's Group

texts.en: Nyevu is a thirty-four year old mother of eight children who works as a drylands farmer. Her husband is also a farmer, and their agricultural endeavors face the challenges of drought and lack of capital to invest in their farming. Nyevu is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program so that she may use the profits from her tree farm to build a house for her family and educate her children.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Thabu's Group

texts.en: Thabu is a fifty-year-old dryland farmer and mother of six children. Her farming potential is limited by the lack of capital to buy seeds. Thabu is joining the KOMAZA microforesty program to earn money for her family, change the environment and prevent erosion on her land. She intends to use the profits from her tree farm to send her children to school and build a good house for her family.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Quick Action Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the Quick Action Group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders seeking a loan of  500,000 leones each in order to invest in their respective businesses.

Memunatu is the featured leader of this group. Memunatu is 20 years old. She is married with three children – two in primary school and one in secondary school. Memunatu sells dried fish and has been doing this business for five years now. With the help of this loan, Memunatu will buy a basket full of dried fish to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy a basket full of dried fish to add to her business

loans.name: Super Sport United Group

texts.en:
Mohamed is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. He is 32 years old, married to a trader, and has five children, who attend school  He is from northern Sierra Leone.  Mohamed owns a telephone booth, where he make calls and charges mobile phones for a fee, and a video sport center, where he shows soccer matches for a fee. Mohamed has been running this business for eight years.

With the help of this loan, Mohamed and his group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, attract more customers, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. Mohamed will use his share of the loan (500,000 SLL) to buy  mobile phone chargers and mobile phone accessories and pay Supersport’s monthly subscription fees.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone chargers and mobile phone accessories and pay Supersport’s monthly subscription fees.

loans.name: Harrison's Group

texts.en: Harrison is a twenty-three-year-old kiosk owner. His business lacks the capital to invest in expansion and his customers often do not pay their debts. Harrison is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program so that he can use the profits from his tree farm to raise capital for investment in his kiosk business and to build houses for rental.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy solar energy for home use.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Juan tiene 46 años de edad, esta casado y tiene siete hijos. Desde muy joven ha trabajado en la herrería; lo aprendió de sus padres. También ha trabajado en la agricultura sembrando maíz, frijoles y sorgo; el cual lo hace para consumo de su familia. Con el paso del tiempo, aprendió el oficio de la albañilería siendo ayudante de un albañil, este oficio lo aprendió desde hace 25 años y es de esta actividad que trabaja para recibir los ingresos económicos para el sostenimiento de su familia. Sus hijos lo apoyan mucho en los cultivos agrícolas, gracias a su esfuerzo ha ido construyendo poco a poco su casa, aunque le hacen falta realizarle unos arreglos. Su esposa elabora pan de manera artesanal y cuida pollos y cerdos en su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar arena, cemento, hierro para construir una habitación pequeña y pagar el transporte de los materiales, los bloques ya los tiene solo hace falte otros materiales. Con la inversión, podrá vivir su familia más cómodamente, ya que son varios en su casa y tendrá un poco de espacio. Él desea, ponerle piso a la casa ya que es de tierra y brindarles el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juan, 46, is married and has seven children.  From a very young age he has worked as an ironsmith, a trade he learned from his parents.  He also works as a crop farmer growing corn, beans and sorghum for family consumption.  Over the years he worked as a mason's assistant and learned the trade 25 years ago.  This is the work he does to earn an income to support the family.  His children help with the agriculture and thanks to their help they have been able to build a house little by little, although it is not yet finished.  His wife makes artisan bread and raises chickens and pigs at home.

Juan is requesting a loan through Fundación Campo to buy sand, cement and iron to build a small room, and pay for transport of materials.  He already has the blocks he needs.  With the investment his family will live more comfortably, since there are several members of the family and they are quite cramped.  He wants to put in flooring since the house now has a dirt floor.  He also wants to give his children an education.

loans.use: To buy sand, cement and iron to build a small room, and to pay for materials transport.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad, a 38-year-old married father of two girls and one boy, works in a governmental institution during the day; afterwards he works in his own business making dairy products, as he has a small number of goats and sheep. Now Mohammad is requesting this loan to buy more goats to increase the quantity of his production.

loans.use: to buy more goats.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 44-year-old father of six sons and daughters. After getting experience, Mahmoud started his own business working as a freelancer plumber a long time ago. Now, Mahmoud is applying for a loan to get new tools.

loans.use: to get new tools for his plumbing business.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is living with his parent and siblings. He is still a university student and is studying hard to graduate as soon as possible. He is applying for another loan to pay for his next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay his semester’s fees.

loans.name: La Bendición Zona 10 Group

texts.es:
La señora Nora Liliana es casada tiene 30 años de edad, curso 4 años de educacion primaria, tiene 2 hijos y uno de ellos esta estudiando, ella se dedica a la preparacion y venta de comida, inició este negocio vendiendo ambulante, hasta el momento lleva 6 años de experiencia. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es chofer de camión.

Solicita un prestamos que lo utilizara para la compra de productos para poder preparar los alimentos para la venta, en el futuro quiere ver su nogocio con un restaurante propio y en un buen punto. Las demas integrantes de grupo se dedican a vender comida y a tienda de consumo diario.
texts.en:
Nora Liliana is 30 years old, married, and completed four years of 'educación primaria' (school for children aged 7-14).  She has two children, one of whom is in school.  Nora Liliana's business is preparing and selling food.  She started out selling her products as an itinerant street vendor and has six years experience.  She has the support of her husband who is a truck driver.

Nora Liliana is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for preparing the food that she sells.  In the future, she would like to have her own restaurant in a good location.  The other members of this group sell food and run grocery stores.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Kadzo's Group

texts.en: Kadzo is a 37-year-old mother of five children and a dryland farmer. She grows maize, cowpeas and cassava, but pests infest her crops, and she does not have enough money to buy pesticides. Kadzo says, "I joined KOMAZA because I want to plant trees. I like the trees KOMAZA is planting; they grow very fast." With the profits from her tree farm, she will educate her children and buy a dairy cow for milk sales.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en: Lubna is a 35-year-old single lady. She has five siblings. Lubna works in a private company in the daytime; after that, she goes to work in her small grocery shop. Now Lubna is applying for a loan to expand the shop and bring in more food products.

loans.use: to expand the shop and bring in more food products.

loans.name: Kadzo's Group

texts.en:
Kadzo is a 48-year-old dryland farmer and mother of eight children. Her husband is a farmer, too, and they grow maize, cowpeas and green peas. Their agricultural business suffers from pest infestations, and therefore, low harvest yields. 

Kadzo is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program because, as she says, "The trees KOMAZA is planting are a good investment." With the profits from her tree farm, Kadzo plans to educate her children and build a home with electricity for her family.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Eladia

texts.es:
Eladia tiene 48 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene un hijo. Ella nació en una familia muy humilde, debido a eso siempre ha trabajado muy fuerte en la agricultura, sembrando maíz y frijoles. También, sus padres, le enseñaron a tejer petates a criar cerdos. Sus padres fallecieron y ella se caso a los 18 años de edad, producto de su matrimonio procreo una hija que es mayor de edad. Hoy en día solo vive son su esposo y siempre trabaja tejiendo petates, engordando cerdos y realizando trabajos agrícolas.  Además, vende lociones, lencería, cremas, entre otros productos de belleza. 

Para comprar el tule que es la materia prima para tejer los petates tiene que caminar por las veredas de unos cerros, ya que en donde vive no hay servicio de transporte público y los productos de belleza los compra por pedidos en la cabecera departamental para eso debe abordar un autobús que tarda veinte minutos en llegar. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar madera, tejas, varas de tuza; para mejorar su vivienda ya que la madera que posee esta en malas condiciones y pagar el alquiler del terreno en donde cultiva. Desde hace dos inviernos que ella la ha pasado muy mal, pues su casa se moja por el deterioro que tiene la madera y ya no quiere volver a pasar por eso. También, desea comprar un terreno en donde cultivar y ya no tener que alquilarlo.
texts.en:
Eladia is 48 years old, lives with her partner, and has one child.  She was born into a very humble family and, as a result, has always worked hard farming corn and beans.  Her parents also taught her how to weave 'petates' (bedrolls) and raise pigs.

Eladia's parents died and she got married at the age of 18.  She has one daughter from her marriage who is now an adult.  These days Eladia only lives with her husband.  She is always hard at work weaving 'petates', fattening pigs and doing farm work.  In addition, she also sells lotions, lingerie, creams and other types of beauty products.

In order to buy the palm fibers she needs for weaving her petates, Eladia has to walk along mountain paths because there is no public transport service where she lives.  She buys her beauty products, to order, from the main city in her region.  This involves a twenty minute bus journey.

Eladia is requesting this loan from Fundación Campo to buy wood, tiles and canes so that she can improve her home as the existing wood is in a bad state of repair.  She will also pay the rent on the plot of land she cultivates.  Eladia has experienced difficulties for the past two winters as her house has become damp owing to the bad state of the wood and she doesn't want to experience these difficulties any more.  She would also like to buy a plot of land on which to grow her crops so that she no longer has to pay rent.

loans.use: to buy wood, tiles and canes to improve her home as the existing wood is in a bad state of repair.  She will also pay the rent on the land that she cultivates

loans.name: Tas E Fi Group

texts.en:
Esther is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in northern Sierra Leone. She is 36 years of age. Esther is married to a farmer and the couple has 4 children, 3 of whom are attending primary and secondary schools.

For 12 years now, Esther has been selling palm-oil (the country's most popular cooking oil), rice, etc. This is the first loan that Esther and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Esther will use her share of the loan, 500,000 Leones (SLL), to buy gallons of palm oil and bags of rice to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm oil and bags of rice to add to her current stock

loans.name: Samiha

texts.en:
Samiha is 29 years old and the mother of three kids. She works as a school teacher and also has a humble clothing store. 

Samiha is applying for a youth loan to buy more clothing items with different styles.

loans.use: to buy more clothing

loans.name: Rokel Social Club Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Rokel Social Club,”  a loan group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 500,000 SLL for each. With the help of this loan, members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and improve on their living conditions. 

Rugiatu is the featured leader of this group. The 26-year-old is married with three children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Rugiatu has been a businesswoman for six years now. She sells  palm-oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil) and firewood. Rugiatu will use her portion of the loan to buy gallons of palm-oil and a large quantity of firewood to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm-oil and a large quantity of firewood

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is 42-year-old conservative mother; she asked her son, Suhaib, to appear in the photo instead.

Suhaib is a 21-year-old university student; he is majoring in Finance. Maryam has five children other than Suhaib. She works as a farmer to help in supporting her kids. Now she is applying for an educational loan to pay for her son's next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her son's next semester fees.

loans.name: Sultana

texts.en:
Sultana is a conservative woman, so she asked her husband to take her place in the photo.

Sultana’s husband is a farmer. He owns a tractor that he uses to do his job. He wants to bring in another piece of heavy equipment also to use for his work and to rent out. For that reason, Sultana has applied for a loan to support her husband and get the equipment he needs.

loans.use: get the heavy equipment her husband needs.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en: Abdullah, a 20-year-old single man with seven siblings, has a small shop where he sells a variety of accessories in addition to shawls.  Abdullah is now requesting a youth loan to buy more styles of shawls and head covers for his customers to choose from.

loans.use: to buy new styles of shawls.

loans.name: Marram 4 Group

texts.en:
Marram 4 is a group of four women from Hodeidah, Yemen. A portion of a 140,000 Yemeni Rial (YER) loan will be used to buy dressmaking and embroidery supplies.

Amoan is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of five children who lives in Hodeidah, Yemen. She is a dressmaker. She has a sewing machine, but she needs to buy dress making and embroidery supplies, so she applied for a loan in the amount of 40,000 YER from AMB. She wants to make and sell women's and kids' clothes. Amoan looks forward to making profits to enroll her children in private schools to receive a good education.

loans.use: to buy dressmaking and embroidery supplies.

loans.name: José Alfredo

texts.es:
José tiene 37 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene una hija. Él se ha caracterizado por ser una persona emprendedora que ha trabajado muy fuerte para salir adelante con su vida; gracias a sus trabajos de ayudante de albañil, agrícolas entre otros más, pudo terminar sus estudios de educación básica. Desde hace cinco años trabaja como promotor social en las comunidades, de ahí obtiene los ingresos para su familia. Debido a su reputación a José le donaron un terreno para que construyera su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar madera, varas de tuza para la pared; arena, cemento, hierro, bloques y piedras para construir los baños y un muro de contención para nivelar el terreno. Con la inversión podrá trasladarse a su casa propia, debido a que donde vive no es de él; estarán más seguros que nadie los sacara pues ya será propia. Él desea,  continuar mejorando su casa y brindarle el estudio a su hija.
texts.en:
José is thirty-seven years old, is in a relationship, and has one daughter.  He has been characterized as being a very enterprising person who has worked very hard to get ahead in life.  Thanks to his jobs as a bricklayer's assistant, in agriculture, and in other sectors, he was able to complete his basic education.  

For five years, he has worked as a community organizer in the surrounding communities, thereby making an income for his family.  Because of his reputation, they have donated a piece of land to José so that he can build his house.  

The loan that he is requesting from Fundación Campo will be used to buy wood, corn husk rods for the wall, sand, cement, iron bars, blocks, and stones to build the bathrooms and a retention wall to level the land.  With this investment, he will be able to move himself to his own house, since where he currently lives is not his; his family will be sure that nobody will kick them out, since this house will be their own.  

His wish is to continue improving his home and to offer an education to his daughter.

loans.use: to buy wood, corn husk rods for the wall, sand, cement, iron bars, blocks, and stone to construct the bathrooms and a retaining wall to level the land.

loans.name: Mairenia

texts.es:
Mairenia tiene 22 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene un hijo. Vive en casa de sus suegros. Ella es empleada desde hace tres años en una empresa atunera. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar materiales para terminar de construir su casa. Con la inversión ella poseerá su propia casa para vivir con su familia e independizarse de sus suegros.
texts.en:
Mairenia is 22 years old, married, and has one child.  She lives with her in-laws and has been employed at a tuna-packing company for three years.

Mairenia is requesting this loan from Fundación Campo to buy the materials she needs to finish building her home.  With this investment, she will own her own home in which she can together live with her family, independently from her in-laws.

loans.use: to buy materials with which to finish building her house.

loans.name: Haneen

texts.en: Haneen is a 21-year-old lady. She has 4 older married siblings and a younger single brother. Haneen attends a private university to study accounting. Now Haneen is applying for an educational loan to pay for her next semester's fees.

loans.use: to pay for her next semester's fees.

loans.name: Sultan

texts.en: Sultan is a 22-year-old single guy, and he is the oldest among four other siblings. He is a university student majoring in finance and banking. He has applied for another educational loan in order to pay for his upcoming semester's fees and continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester's fees.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en: Alaa, is 24-year-old single guy. He is the oldest among 4 siblings. Alaa works and goes to a private university to study and become a teacher. He is applying for this loan to pay for his upcoming semester's fees.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester's fees.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 42-year-old mother with one boy and three girls. Her husband is a taxi driver and she sells clothes and perfume from home. 

Sajida is requesting a loan to buy more perfume and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy more perfume

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en:
Raeda is a 29-year-old conservative woman, so she asked her husband to appear in the photo instead. 

They have four kids to support, and to be able to do so, Raeda opened a small grocery store where she sells a few types of food products, while her husband works in buying and selling sheep besides his daytime job in a company.  

Now, Raeda is applying for a loan to increase the quantity of goods she has in her store and add new types of food products to have more variety.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of goods in her food shop.

loans.name: Ekhlas

texts.en: Ekhlas is a 21-year-old single lady with 10 siblings. Being a member of such a big family helped her to develop a strong personality and character which led her to enroll in the university for Media Studies. Now Ekhlas is requesting an educational loan in order to pay for her next-semester fees.

loans.use: to pay her fees for next semester.

loans.name: Musaab

texts.en: Musaab, who is still a university student, is applying for another education loan to continue with his studies and pay his next-semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Maram

texts.en:
Maram is a 23-year-old single lady. She has seven siblings.
 
Maram is a university student majoring in Telecom Engineering. She is applying for an educational loan to pay her next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her next semester fees.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 51 years old and single. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a business of raising pigs for sale in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over eight years and earns 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

She joined GDMPC in the year 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. And now, she has requested a loan of 17,000 PHP to purchase feeds for her pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Oyunkhuu

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyunkhuu, 55 years old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her husband have retired from work and get a state pension. Her son has been working as a waste manager at a heat station. 

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repair. She is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to renovate her house. The house renovation includes but is not limited to ceiling installment, interior decoration, updating windows and repairing the plumbing. As a result, the family can live in a more comfortable and warmer place, which will enable the family to burn less coal thus, contributing to the efforts against air pollution by emitting less smoke. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to install a ceiling, decorate the interior, update the windows and repair the plumbing system in her house.

loans.name: Las Rosas De Sacamilaj Group

texts.es:
La señora Santos es casada tiene 46 años de edad, estudió 3 años de educacion primaria, tiene 4 hijos ni uno de ellos estudia, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de tomate, inició este negocio por iniciativa propia y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de tomates para incrementar su negocio, en el futuro quiere tener un local grande en el cual se distribuya tomate a pequeños comerciantes. Las demas integrantes del grupo se dedican a la venta de animales, verduras y productos de consumo diario.
texts.en:
Santos is 46 years old, married, and completed three years of 'educación primaria' (school for children aged 7-14).  She has four children, none of whom attend school.  Santos' business is buying and selling tomatoes.  She started this business through her own initiative and has 10 years experience.

Santos formed a group to request a loan which she will use to buy tomatoes in order to boost her business.  In the future, she would like to have large business premises which she could use for distributing tomatoes to small retailers.  The other members of this group work selling animals, vegetables and groceries.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes

loans.name: Willian Mauricio

texts.es:
Willian tiene 22 años de edad, esta soltero.  A los ocho años de edad, su padre le enseño las actividades agrícolas; durante el invierno realiza sus cultivos y en el verano trabaja en las estructuras metálicas. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar un aparato de soldadura y hierro para fabricar puertas y portones. De esta manera, podrá disponer de materia prima para fabricar más puertas, balcones, portones y todo lo relacionado con estructuras metálicas, podrá satisfacer la clientela. Su propósito, es comprar un terreno y varios animales.
texts.en:
Willian is 22 years old and single. When he was eight years old, his father taught him all about farming. 

During the winter Willian takes care of his fields, and in the summer he makes items out of metal. The loan he is seeking from Fundacíon Campo will be used to buy welding equipment and iron to make doors and gates. As a result Willian will have on hand the materials he needs to make more doors, balconies, gates and everything else related to his job working with metal. He will be able to satisfy his customers. He also intends to buy land and some animals.

loans.use: buy welding equipment and iron to make doors and gates

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, a 60-year-old married mother of three, lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, where she owns and operates a motorcycle transport service to make a living. In business for over six years, she earns PHP 20,000 every month.

Teresita, who joined GDMPC in 2009, has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Gemima

texts.es: Gemima, de 30 años de edad , es casada y  tiene 2 hijos  a quienes quiere y busca darles lo mejor. Vive en su casa propia en compañía de su familia.El trabajo que realiza Gemima es la elaboración y venta de panes, oficio que aprendió estudiando en un centro de capacitación ocupacional. Empezó su negocio, para lo cual cuenta con un  horno artesanal de barro ubicado en su hogar, pero por desgracia tuvo un problema y se derrumbo, para lo cual está elaborando un horno a gas alquilado.  Viene realizando éste negocio hace más de 02 años, tiempo en la cual ha llegado a ser  muy conocida, por la calidad de sus productos, para dicha actividad cuenta con la ayuda de su hermana ya que ella le  ayuda en la elaboración y la venta de los panes. Gemima considera rentable a su negocio porque le permite saciar sus necesidades, y dar una buena educación a sus hijos,sin embargo no le gusta  el cansancio que hornear panes le ocasiona, pero esto no la desanima y nos comenta que espera seguir creciendo para  construir su  propio horno.Este es el  préstamo número 03 con Kiva y se siente agradecida de recibir un apoyo financiero que le permitirá avanzar con su negocio.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 600  nuevos soles para la compra de ingredientes que le sirven para elaborar sus panes tales como harinas, mantecas, levaduras entre otros.
texts.en:
30-year-old Gemima is married and has two children.  She loves her children and strives to provide them with the best.  She lives in her own home together with her family.  Gemima's business is making and selling bread.  She learned this trade by studying at an occupational training center.  Gemima has a hand-made clay oven in her home which she uses for her business.  However, unfortunately it experienced a problem and collapsed.  For this reason, she is currently using a rented gas oven.

Gemima has been in this business for more than two years and, during this time, she has become very well known for the good quality of her products.  Her sister helps her in the business, making and selling bread.  Gemima considers her business to be profitable because it allows her to cover her needs and provide her children with a good education, though she does not like how tired she gets baking bread all day.  However, she doesn't become discouraged and says that she hopes to continue growing her business and build her own oven.

This is Gemima's third loan through Kiva and she feels grateful for the financial support which enables her to make progress in her business.  On this occasion, she is requesting 600 soles so that she can buy ingredients that she uses in baking her bread such as flour, butter, yeast, etc.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for baking bread

loans.name: José Abdon

texts.es:
José tiene 71 años de edad, es casado y tiene seis hijos. Él tiene 45 años de dedicarse a realizar trabajos agrícolas, lo aprendió de sus padres, antes trabaja en los beneficios de café.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar sácate para alimentar a las vacas que posee y comprar dos vacas más. Con la inversión dispondrá de alimento para su ganado para todo el verano y al mismo tiempo que aumentara el número de vacas para que le produzcan leche y también venderlas o destazarlas. Lo que más desea don José es mejorar su casa y ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José is a 71-year old man, married and father of six children. He's been working in agriculture for 45 years and learned the job from his parents. He used to work with coffee before. 

He's requesting a loan to Fundación Campo to purchase forage to feed his cows and to buy two cows more. Thanks to this investment, he'll have enough food for his livestock for the whole summer and, at the same time, he'll increase the number of cows to produce milk, be sold or cut up. Don José's biggest dream is to improve his house and to help his children.

loans.use: to purchase forage to feed his cows and to buy two cows more.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
Elisa tiene 23 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la crianza de vacas; lo aprendió de su padre que es ganadero. El ganado lo compra en las plazas más cercanas a unos veinte kilómetros de su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar dos vacas lecheras y comprar medicina para la enfermedad de su suegra. Con la inversión ayudara a mejorar la salud de su suegra y podrá producir más leche que le permitirá procesarla para vender lácteos y también las vacas. Lo que le generara un mejor ingreso para la alimentación de su familia y poder comprar un terreno para construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Elisa, age 23, is married and has one child.  She has been raising cows for ten years.  She learned from her father, a rancher.  She buys the livestock at the nearest market places, which are 20 kilometers from her house.

The loan that she is requesting from the Fundación Campo is to buy two dairy cows.  She will also buy medicine for her sick mother-in-law. She will help to improve her mother-in-law’s health with this investment .  She will also be able to produce more milk.  This will allow her to process the milk and to sell dairy products and the cows.  This will generate better income for her in order to feed her family.  She will also be able to buy a piece of land in order to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows and to buy medicine for her sick mother-in-law.

loans.name: Santos Carolina

texts.es:
Santos tiene 29 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene tres hijos. Junto con su compañero de vida se dedican a la agricultura desde hace unos 15 años. Se levanta muy temprano a preparar el desayuno, luego viste a uno de sus hijos para que se vaya para la escuela y los otro dos los lleva donde su mamá para que se los cuide. Al medio día regresa a preparar el almuerzo y compartir la tarde junto sus hijos ayudándoles en sus tareas escolares y su hijo mayor tiene una discapacidad. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para pagar el alquiler de la tierra en donde cultiva maíz y frijol;  y comprar semilla, abono, herbicidas. Así, ella asegurara el lugar en donde realizara sus cultivos para obtener maíz y frijol para la alimentación de su familia. Su sueño es que su hijo se pueda graduar de la universidad; para que trabaje de una manera diferente a ella. Además, quisiera construir una vivienda de ladrillo, ya que la que posee es de lámina y techo aserrado.
texts.en:
Santos is a 29-year old woman who lives with her partner and has three children. Together with her life partner, she's been working in agriculture for 15 years. She wakes up very early to prepare breakfast, dress one of her children for school and take the other two to her mother's house. She comes back to make lunch and shares the afternoon with the kids helping them with homework. Her older child has a disability. 

She's requesting a loan to Fundación Campo to pay the rent of the land where she cultivates corn and beans, and to buy seeds, fertilizer and herbicides. This way she can ensure some space to cultivate and obtain corn and beans for her family. Her dream is for her oldest child to graduate from university so that he can have better work conditions that she does. She also would like to build a house made of brick (her current one is made of layers and serrated ceiling).

loans.use: to pay the rent of the land where she cultivates corn and beans, and to buy seeds, fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Débora

texts.fr: Débora vit avec son mari transporteur et leurs 07 enfants tous scolarisés à Lomé. Âgée de 40ans, elle exerce comme activité la vente de mais, de pagnes et des bijoux.  Elle a démarré en 2002 et le fait à domicile et de façon ambulante. Afin d’éradiquer au problème de rupture de stock de marchandises, elle sollicite un troisième crédit à WAGES pour renforcer son stock. Avec le profit qu’elle va réaliser, elle espère réinvestir dans l’activité et contribuer au coté de son mari aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Debora lives in Lomé with her husband, who works in cargo transport, and their seven children, all of whom are in school. She is 40 years old and sells corn, traditional “pagnes” fabric and jewelry. She launched her business in 2002 and works out of her home and as a street vendor. In order to avoid running out of stock, she is seeking a third loan from WAGES to reinforce her stock.  Thanks to the resulting revenues, she hopes to reinvest in her business and to help provide for family needs alongside her husband.

loans.use: to buy traditional fabrics, [sewing supplies], etc.

loans.name: Baby Jane

texts.en:
Baby Jane sells various kinds of vegetables within her local community. She has been doing this kind of business for three years. Baby Jane is 35 years old, married, with three children. Two of her children go to school, while her youngest child is still an infant.

Baby Jane would like to take out a loan of PHP 5,000 which allows her to buy vegetables, such as eggplants, string beans, and bitter gourds to sell. 

She and her husband work together to create a better way of living, educate their three children, and obtain better income to cover all their household expenses. Baby Jane hopes for continuous access to financial services, so she can attain her goals in life and in business.

loans.use: to buy various kinds of vegetables for her vegetable business.

loans.name: Manilyn

texts.en:
Manilyn, a 46-year-old married mother of four, lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, where she owns and operates a food-selling enterprise in the local community to earn a living. In business for over seven years, she earns 9,000 PHP every month.

Manilyn joined GDMPC in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting this loan to purchase more food to sell, and plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional food to sell such as pork, beef and chicken.

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en: Merilyn is 40 years old, married with five children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She raises pigs for sale in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over five years and earns 11,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2010 and now she has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase feed for pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her  pigs

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina lives in the village of San Manuel. She is happily married with three children. She describes herself as an industrious and determined woman. Carina has operated a business selling fruits and vegetables for six years.

Carina is thankful to God because, through her hard work and determination, she has been able to improve her business. Since her business has grown, Carina is also in need of more capital to keep her business progressive. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000. She will use this loan to buy various kinds of vegetables such as eggplant, squash and bitter gourd for her vegetable-vending business.

Carina believes by offering a greater selection of vegetables, this will enable her to earn a greater income and get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy various kinds of vegetables such as eggplant, squash and bitter gourd for her vegetable-vending business.

loans.name: Melonie

texts.en:
Melonie is 47 years old and married with four children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She has owned and operated a retail business for more than eight years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. 

Melonie joined GDMPC in the year 2008 to gain access to financial services and to improve her ability to engage in business activities. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Latifjon

texts.ru:
Латифчон мужчина в возрасте 37 лет, он женат имеет 3 детей. Он занимается откормом скота. Этим видом деятельности Латифчон занимается почти с детства. Этим ремеслом занимались и его родители. Он знает все преимущество этого дела.   Его жена и невестки каждые пол года стригут овец и коз, летом и осенью продают пряжу. Одна из невесток выносит пряжи на продажу в город, у нее там есть постоянные клиенты. Латифчон кредитуется а Арванде с 2004 года, он очень пунктуальный и ответственный человек.
 В этом году Латифчон планирует приумножить скот, потому что у него увеличиваются клиенты на покупку шерсти. На настоящий кредит он планирует закупить несколько коз и овец, с учетом что его скот увеличиться в два раза.
texts.en:
Latifjon is a 37 year old man, he is married and has 3 children.  He raises livestock.  Latifjon has been in this business since almost his childhood.  His parents also worked in this trade.  He knows all the advantages of this business.  His wife and daughters-in-law  shear the sheep and goats every 6 months, in the summer and fall they sell yarn.  One of the daughters-in-law brings the yarn to the city for sale, she has regular customers there.  Latifjon has been a borrower of Arvand since 2004, he is a very punctual and responsible person.  

This year Latifjon plans to increase his livestock count, because he has more customers for his wool.  He plans to use this loan for the purchase of several goats and sheep, planning to double his livestock count.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Sadatou

texts.fr: Sadatou est une femme âgée de 44 ans. Elle est mariée à un commerçant  et mère de famille. Elle revend  des produits d'alimentations générale à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Sadatou a requis son 1er crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. Dans les prochaines années, Sadatou voudrait ouvrir une boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Sadatou is a woman of 44 years old. She is married to a businessman and is a mother. Sadatou sells general grocery supplies from her home. She buys her merchandise from Lomé.

Sadatou has requested her first loan from WAGES to purchase grocery supplies. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, Sadatou would like to open a shop. She says that with the income she earns from her business, she expects to be able to care for her family.

loans.use: to purchase general grocery supplies.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a responsible wife who dreams of becoming successful in life. She is 36 years old and married with one child. To raise her family, Marilyn is engaged in a direct selling business. She has been in this business for six years. 

Marilyn is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 50,000 to buy more products to sell such as lotion, perfume and deodorant. Marilyn hopes that she can obtain her desired loan so she can further improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell such as lotion, perfume and deodorant.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 33 years old and married with one child. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. She has been in this business for more than four years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. 

Maricel joined GDMPC in the year 2010. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and tires. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires.

loans.name: Sigaran Indah Group

texts.en:
The Sigaran Indah group includes 13 people who are requesting a loan to buy piglets and feed.

Ni Made, as the head of the group, will use her portion of the loan to buy three superior piglets. She also plans to purchase a sow using her own money. The price for a superior pig is currently very expensive, ranging from IDR 400,000 - 500,000. These pigs will be maintained for five months for fattening. 

Ni Made expects that during the loan period, the pig will be able to develop properly, without being attacked by disease. In the future, she dreams of fixing her house.

loans.use: To buy three superior piglets and feed.

loans.name: Ressielyn

texts.en:
Ressielyn is a hog-raiser in the village of Paddad. She has been in this business for three years and usually earns about PHP 2,500 per head. Ressielyn is 21 years old and married, with one child. 

At this time, she is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 20,000 to buy feed, vaccines, and additional piglets to raise. She hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is 41 years old and has two children. She is from the village of San Antonio. Pilar is engaged in a food processing business. She usually sells "toccino" and "langgonisa" in her village. She wants to have more frozen food to sell. 

To this end, Pilar is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000 to buy hot dogs, ham, "toccino" and "langgonisa" to sell. She hopes to grow and expand her business as well as improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy hot dogs, ham, "toccino" and "langgonisa" to sell.

loans.name: Yewavi

texts.fr: Yewavi est une jeune dame de 37ans. Elle est mariée et maman de 03 enfants tous scolarisés. L’ainé a 18ans et le dernier 05ans. Afin de contribuer aux besoins du ménage, elle revend des pagnes qu’elle achète chez les grossistes au Grand Marché de Lomé. Avec une ancienneté de 11ans, elle a de  nombreux clients dans la ville à cause de la qualité de ses marchandises. N’arrivant plus à les satisfaire, elle sollicite un second crédit à WAGES pour achat de pagnes. Le profit tiré de la vente lui permettra de réinvestir dans son activité et assurer l’avenir des enfants.
texts.en:
Yewavi is a young woman of 37 years of age. She is married and the mother of three children, all of whom attend school. The eldest is 18 and the youngest is five years old. To contribute to the needs of her household, Yewavi sells pagnes (traditional West African printed cloth) that she buys from wholesalers in the Grand Market of Lomé.

With her experience totaling 11 years, Yewavi has a large number customers in the city due to the quality of her goods. As she can no longer meet the demand of her customers, Yewavi is requesting her second loan from WAGES so that she can purchase a supply of pagnes. The income Yewavi earns from selling her merchandise will allow her to reinvest in her business and ensure a bright future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase pagnes (traditional West African printed cloth)

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 55 years old, married and blessed with four grown-up children. All her children are married and have their own families. Pacita's spouse's work is farming while she is engaged in food production.

Pacita would like to expand the special dishes she offers due to the harvest season but her capital is not enough. With regards to her situation, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to allow her to buy ingredients such as meat, vegetables, glutinous rice, sugar and condensed milk for her food production.   

Pacita knows that through increasing the dishes she offers she can earn more profit and be able to provide customer satisfaction. Pacita is hoping for approval of her requested loan so she could improve her way of living and save some for emergency purposes when she and her husband get weak.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, vegetables, glutinous rice, sugar and condensed milk for her food production

loans.name: Alou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Alou est âgé de 37 ans,  marié et père de 6 enfants. Il vit dans une famille polygame avec ses deux épouses, ses enfants et ses parents à Ouelessebougou.
Il mène des activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente de pièces détachées depuis maintenant 5 ans. Il est très sollicité et apprécié à Ouelessebougou et environs.
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse et exigeante, il décida d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son quatrième prêt, après avoir correctement les trois prêts précédents.
Alou compte utiliser ce nouveau prêt pour acheter un important stock de  pièces détachées auprès des grossistes de Bamako. Il effectue ses ventes au marché de Ouelessebougou à une clientèle constituée de chauffeurs et de mécaniciens.
Il espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 100.000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
Alou is 37 years old, married and the father of six children. He lives in a polygamous family with his two wives, his children and his parents in Ouelessebougou. He has been running a business buying and selling spare parts for the past five years. He is valued and very sought after in Ouelessebougou and the surrounding area.

In order to satisfy the demand of his ever-increasing customer base, Alou decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. He is currently on his fourth loan cycle, having fully repaid his three prior loans.

Alou plans to use this loan to buy a large stock of spare parts from the wholesalers in Bamako. He sells his merchandise at the market in Ouelessebougou to a customer base of chauffeurs and mechanics. Alou hopes to earn an average monthly income of 100,000 FCFA, which he will use to meet his family's expenses and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Nubar

texts.en:
Nubar is a 48-year-old IDP woman, who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with her parents. She is a farmer and has grown seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 8 years. She chose this business because it is profitable and fresh crops are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served at every table in Azerbaijan families and are also used to make fresh punch.

Nubar sells her crop in the central bazaar. Her monthly income is 100 AZN. She is dependent on her father a lot, because he helps her to grow the crops.

As her products are in high demand, Nubar plans to expand the business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover the market demand. For this purpose, she applied for 1800 AZN. She will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers. This will be her second loan, and she has good client history.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Asiya

texts.en:
Asiya is a 34-year-old young woman with three children. She is very kind, caring and also very energetic in her work. Asiya raises cattle, fattens them and sells them for a profitable price. Her husband is the major support for her in this business.

Asiya sells meat at the central bazaar for a profit. In Azerbaijan, there is a high demand for meat, because it is used in a lot of dishes, such as 'kufta' (soup), kababs, 'dolma', etc. Her income from this business is 200 AZN per month. In order to fully support the family, Asiya is looking forward to expanding the business and making it a very successful business. 

She has for the second time applied for a loan of 2000 AZN with Aqroinvest, to buy two calves. At this very young age and with a great passion and energy, Asiya plans to become a successful businesswoman in the town. Her good client history is a little proof of this.

loans.use: to buy two calves to expand her business

loans.name: Khanimnaz

texts.en:
Khanimnaz is a 48-year-old woman who has two sons. Her husband is a laborer and her elder son is the only one helping her to grow vegetables and fruits to sell. She is a very hardworking woman and is confident that by running her business successfully, she can support both her sons to get a good education.  

Khanimnaz has been growing fruits and vegetables for nine years. She believes that the service she provides is very useful to her community. She even sends blessings to her competitors who grow such fruits. Azerbaijani people often use vegetables in dishes and eat fruit for dessert.

With her son's help, Khanimnaz strongly believes her business will become more successful in the coming years. She has applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN from Aqroinvest in order to invest more in her business. This is her second loan and she has a good loan history.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en:
Arzu is a 33-year-old married woman with two adorable daughters. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP). She is engaged in poultry breeding. She has 5 years in this field. She got married very young, and it was hard to cover the family's needs. Her husband is a laborer and he doesn’t have a permanent job. So Arzu decided to start her business. With the help of AqroInvest, Arzu bought chickens. Now her business brings her a stable income of about 130 AZN a month. 

Poultry is very popular among Azerbaijani people, because it is considered very healthy and dietary. Every season each kind of poultry has its demand. For instance, goose is popular in autumn and winter, while turkey is in demand in autumn and spring. Chicken is popular at all times. 

Arzu applied for 2000 AZN to purchase more chickens and increase her monthly turnover. She has a long history with AqroInvest and proved herself as a trusted client.

loans.use: to buy more more chickens to cover her customers' demands.

loans.name: Esther Ofelia

texts.es:
Esther es una mujer con 62 años, viene de un hogar del norte del Ecuador, Bolívar, pero cambió su domicilio desde muy joven por el trabajo de sus padres, tuvo varios obstáculos en sus estudios y por los escasos recursos económicos terminó solo la escuela primaria. Se casó muy joven y se dedicó a los quehaceres del hogar y fue muy triste para ella no poder tener hijos. Éste y otros motivos fueron la causa de su divorcio que fue una etapa muy difícil de sobrellevar. Sin embargo esta mujer ejemplar ha salido adelante y ahora vive en el Cantón Santo Domingo de la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas. Santo Domingo se encuentra conectando la Región Sierra con la Región Costa del Ecuador, es una ciudad que se ha convertido en un eje comercial con varios sectores en crecimiento y como prueba se tiene a varias familias emprendedoras que hace algunos años comenzaron con pequeños negocios y ahora son microempresarios que aportan a la generación de empleo. Los estudios revelan que todos los negocios en su mayoría, empezaron empíricamente y han tenido acogida por el paso de turistas, empresarios y viajeros que se trasladan de una región a otra y además que es la tercera ciudad más habitada en el país. 
Esther desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y artículos para el hogar. La mayoría de sus clientes son mujeres. Con las ventas ella gana premios de artículos que le sirven para uso personal. Dedica varias horas cada día en la mañana y en la tarde recorriendo las largas calles de su ciudad para tomar los pedidos de sus clientes, ofrecer los productos y realizar cobranzas de sus ventas anteriores. Ahora requiere un crédito que lo utilizará en compra de mercadería al por mayor y de esta forma podrá obtener mayor descuento y así ofrecer precios competitivos a sus clientes. Con los ingresos extras que se generen, Esther pagará algunas deudas y además realizará arreglos que su casa necesita tanto en la fachada como en las instalaciones del interior. Gracias a Fundación Alternativa que a través de Kiva le ayudarán a financiar este sueño, ella se siente tranquila, pues además de recibir un buen trato, su ejecutivo le ha asesorado y le ha brindado agilidad y confianza con el trámite. Esther dice a todas las personas que alrededor del mundo colaboran para financiar sueños, que sigan creyendo en la gente, porque cuando dejen de creer se podrán perder muchos emprendedores.
texts.en: Esther, who is 62, was originally from Bolívar in the north of Ecuador but moved away from there on account of her parents' work.  She faced a number of obstacles during her education and, as money was tight, received only a primary education.  She married young and became a housewife  but, to her distress, was not able to have children.  For this and other reasons, she and her husband divorced, and this proved a difficult time.  However, this inspirational woman has risen above it all and now lives in Santo Domingo Canton in Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas province.  The city of Santo Domingo lies between Ecuador's mountain region and the coast and has become a commercial hub with various growth industries. Proof of this can be seen in the number of enterprising families who set up small business a few years ago and now are microentrepreneurs who play their part in generating employment.  Studies show that a hands-on approach was employed in the setting-up of these businesses which have been well-received by the tourists, business people and travellers who travel between regions.  Furthermore, Santo Domingo is the third most populous city in the country.  For the last 6 years, Esther has sold cosmetics and household items, chiefly to women.  Her sales earn her bonuses in the form of toiletries and other items for her own use.  She spends several hours each morning and afternoon walking around her city's long streets taking orders from her customers, promoting her products and collecting payments for previous sales.  She is now requesting a loan which she will use to buy merchandise in bulk.  This will enable her to qualify for a bigger discount, and, as a result, offer competitive prices to her customers.  With the extra income, Esther will pay off some debts and, in addition, will  have much-needed repairs carried out on the exterior and interior fittings of her home.  Thanks to Fundación Alternativa who, via Kiva, will help her finance this dream, she feels calm because, in addition to being well treated, she has been assessed by her officer, who has instilled in her agility and confidence in dealing with official procedures.  Esther asks all those, the world over, who work together to finance dreams, to continue believing in people because, if they stop believing, many entrepreneurs could be lost.

loans.use: to buy products in bulk and have repairs carried out on her home.

loans.name: Bella

texts.es:
Bella, de 40 años de edad, está casada con Luis quien es comerciante y padre de sus hijos con quienes vive en en su propia casa , la cual fue comprada con mucho esfuerzo.
La actividad que realiza Bella es la venta de pescado fresco, empezando muy de temprano ya que se dirige al puerto de pescadores a comprar su mercadería para venderlo en su puesto del mercado de la ciudad, a su vez atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes porque sabe que así se ganará sus preferencias y le seguirán comprando.
Se inició hace más de 08 años con un capital propio, el cual invirtió comprando en pequeñas cantidades, luego   fue comprando en aumento.
Decidió a empezar con su negocio por la necesidad de apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar y pagar los estudios de sus hijos , por lo tanto viendo los buenos resultados que tiene, desea mantener su negocio y continuarlo pues es su única fuente de ingresos.Este es el préstamo número 04 con Kiva y esta muy agradecida con el apoyo financiera que recibirá para que su negocio siga creciendo.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 nuevos soles para la compra de pescado fresco, buscando así mejorar su calidad de vida .
texts.en:
Bella, 40, is married to Luis who is a salesman and the father of her children. They all live in their own house, bought with a lot of effort.

Bella sells fresh fish. She starts early in the morning by going to the harbor to buy it and then sell it in the city’s marketplace. She is kind to her customers, aware that they will appreciate it and will continue buying from her.
