When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the workshops on health and loans.

loans.use: to buy handbags.

loans.name: Palomitas Blancas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PALOMITAS BLANCAS” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Hilda es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de quinua, tienda de barrio, venta de pantalones, venta de ganado vacuno, artesanía, taller de costura.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Hilda es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de costura; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su esposo hace tres años atrás, posteriormente decide implementar su propio espacio de costura.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de máquina de coser) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su propio domicilio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato. 

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en: Communal group 'Palomitas Blancas' (the name means 'White Doves') is starting its sixth cycle with field partner Pro Mujer, in the framework of the focus centre of Patacamaya. It has nine members and an executive board, with Hilda as president. The members of the group are engaged in various activities, among them quinoa sales, grocery shop, trousers sales, cattle sales, an artesan's workshop, and a sewing workshop. This loan will thus benefit a group of very small entrepreneurs with diverse businesses. Hilda tells us that she has been working with Pro Mujer for five cycles. She got to know this field partner thanks to a spokesperson, who came to visit her at her house. Hilda has a sewing workshop, a trade she learned from her husband three years ago. She then decided to have a workshop of her own. She needs this loan in order to increase her working capital and buy a sewing machine. She will buy it from wholesale sellers in La Paz and then sell what she sews at her home.The income Hilda derives from her business enables her to help with household expenses, since she is married. When asked what she likes about working with Pro Mujer, she talks about the training received on topics such as health and credit options.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Guapa esta en el ciclo 3, su encuesta de eliminación muestra que todas ellas están en el nivel medio, y que quieren poder ir mejorando sus vidas, es por ello que se esfuerzan todas de manera unida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Olga, quien cuenta que entre el trabajo que ella hace es de confitería, por las tardes, y los domingos prepara variadas comidas para la venta a la hora del almuerzo.  Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que por medio de su trabajo quiere salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. Su sueño es poder ser una buena microempresaria.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para seguir haciendo los alimentos que vende, como ser harina, carnes, condimentos, verduras y demás, ya que con eso puede seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
The group called Kuña Guapa is in its 3rd cycle. Their survey shows that all of these women are in the mid-level and that they want to be able to continue bettering their lives, which is what they strive for in unity.
One of the members is Olga, who says that among the work that she does is confectionery in the evenings and Sundays she prepares a variety of foods for sale during the lunchtime. She is a very hardworking and entrepreneurial person. Through her work she wants to succeed and help her family. Her dream is to be able to be a good entrepreneur.
She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of consumables to continue making the food that she sells, like flour, meats, condiments, vegetables and more, so that she can continue with her work.

loans.use: Comprar  harina, carnes, condimentos, verduras y demás.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Delia is 35 years old and has three children who are in school.

Delia has a direct selling business (Avon and Fuller Life products) in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional products like lotion, body spray, lipstick, etc. to sell.

Delia has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like lotion, body spray, lipstick, etc. to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Lolita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for two years now. In the future, she would like to save more money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco de 48 años de edad es una agricultor residente en una vereda del municipio de Sonsón, Colombia. Vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos, de los cuales dos son menores de edad. Labora diariamente desde las cinco de la mañana hasta las cuatro de la tarde, en una finca de propiedad familiar. En la actualidad tiene sembrados de papa criolla y tomate de árbol, cultivos que se han convertido en la fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar. 
Francisco ama su trabajo, razón que lo llena de motivos para dar lo mejor cada día y agradecerle a Dios por su inmensa bondad y el regalo de compartir con una familia maravillosa. 
Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará en la adquisición de insumos para realizar nuevos sembrados y abonar los ya existentes. Espera poder generar mejores ingresos y satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia.
Uno de sus mayores retos es luchar contra los cambios climáticos que afectan sus cultivos y le ocasionan grandes pérdidas monetarias.
texts.en:
Francisco, 48, works in agriculture and lives in a small community located in the municipality of Sonsón, Colombia. He lives with his wife and four children, two of them underage. Francisco works every day from 5 am to 4 pm, in a farm that belongs to the family. He is currently growing papa criolla [a small, yellow type of potato] and tamarillo, which have become a source of income and a way to support the family. Francisco loves his work, something that motivates him to work harder and harder every day. He thanks God for his immense goodness and the gift of having a wonderful family.

Francisco is requesting a loan to buy the supplies needed to expand his plantations and fertilize the ones he already has. He hopes to increase his income and satisfy his family’s basic needs. One of his major challenges is the changing weather, which affects his crops and causes economic losses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a 34-year-old married woman, who has been working since 2009 selling Vinyl Plastic Table Covers. She helps her husband in making their living and covering expenses. Linda is working in the same business as her husband, who travels among villages to sell his products, whereas she sells her own products at home to neighbors, relatives and friends. 

Linda is working on increasing her business capital for special spring and summer released designs by applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. It will be her second loan cycle. 

Her previous loan helped her a lot in increasing her husband's and her business capital, which reflected positively on improving their income and developing their social living. She hopes to keep on expanding her business as much as she can, in order to keep on developing her social and financial living.

loans.use: to increase her business capital for special spring and summer released designs

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 35 years old, and she is now applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2001 with her own working capital of $200. She earns a good income from her business.

She will use her loan to buy some stock to keep in her store such as eggplant, cabbage, papaws, onions and tomatoes. She is a very hardworking woman, and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 12 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy eggplant, cabbage, papaws, onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a 49-year-old, married woman and a mother of five children, from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in the fishing business, together with her husband, for more than ten years now. This is the source of their income. 

Elvira is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the boat. With this loan, they will be able to improve their fishing business and augment their income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the boat.

loans.name: Lovelyn

texts.en:
Lovelyn is 23 years old and married with one child. With one child currently in school, Lovelyn works very hard to provide for the family.

Lovelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 18,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc., to purchase more stock like snacks foods, soft drinks, vinegar, cooking oil, etc. to sell in her general store.

Lovelyn has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snacks foods, soft drinks, vinegar, cooking oil, etc.

Lovelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like snacks foods, soft drinks, vinegar, cooking oil, etc., to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.en:
Alfonso is 44 years old and has one school-aged child. He aims to improve the family's standard of living in order to give his family a better life. In addition to farming, he owns a motorcycle repair shop within their community. This is his way of generating additional income for his family. 

Alfonso plans to improve the business and make it viable source of income. Due to inadequate capital, he is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy materials needed in the repair shop. This includes items such as wheels, sprockets and motorcycle accessories which are needed to provide a better service. 

Alfonso believes that this loan will be a great help to him in improving the business and hopes that he will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials needed in the repair shop such as wheels, sprockets and motorcycle accessories

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 56 years old, widowed, and has one child. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Marilou has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money, to repair and renovate her house in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more items to sell including snacks, beverages and other goods.

loans.name: Rosas Visalaya Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS DE VISALAYA”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nora es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: pescadora, tienda de barrio, venta de leche, venta de cerveza, venta de queso.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nora es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de queso; cuenta que este negocio lo heredó de sus padres hace varios años atrás.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital(compra de vaca) que adquirirá de las ferias las comunidades aledañas y posteriormente a la crianza y a la elaboración de queso lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijas.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta le gusta el ahorro.

En la fotografía se encuentra el hijo de la señora Catalina, que se encuentra con una chompa naranja.
texts.en:
The communal bank "ROSAS DE VISALAYA" will begin its second loan cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Copacabana regional office. This group is composed of 8 members and is led by a board of directors with Nora serving as the President. The businesses that the members of the communal bank undertake are varied; among others there are the following: fishing, neighborhood grocery store, milk sales, alcohol sales, cheese sales.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small business owners such as the member Nora. She says that she has been a part of Pro Mujer for 1 year, joining by an invitation from a consultant of the institution who went to visit her at her home. Currently, she has a business making and selling cheese; she says that she acquired this business from her parents several years ago. 

The loan that she will take out is to increase her capital to buy livestock that she will acquire from fairs in neighboring communities.  She raises the cattle and makes cheese, which she sells in her place of business. This form of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her home as best as possible since she is married and has two daughters.
 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the savings.

In the photograph, the son of Catalina can be seen wearing an orange sweater.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
Basilisa is 66 years old and widowed with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Basilisa has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippine peso) loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, sugar, rice, soft drinks, candies, canned goods and other groceries in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Basilisa has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, sugar, rice, soft drinks, candies, and canned goods in her general store

loans.name: Merlin

texts.en:
Merlin is a hard-working entrepreneur, who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 25 years. She earns additional income from raising pigs and from buying and selling bananas. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Merlin has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 36 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is in school. Mary Ann is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in the pig fattening business for 18 years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Mary Ann would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase film and drip tape

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George's previous loan was a big help in his business. He was able to buy more tanks of LPG and gallons of water. He has been in this business for eight years and has already established a name in the community. He and his wife are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

George is requesting another loan for 40,000 PHP, which he will use to pay for additional stocks of mineral water and LPG tanks needed in his business. More items to sell will result in better profit. His profits from his business will help him to sustain the family's daily needs and educational expenses of his children. 

George hopes for continuous success for his business. He meets with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase mineral water and LPG tanks needed in his business.

loans.name: Nieva

texts.en:
Nieva works hard to support her family. She is married and has a direct selling business with Natasha (company name) in the Philippines.

Nieva requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippine pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like shoes, pants, shorts, and beauty products to sell.

She has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Nieva would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like shoes, pants, shorts, and beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Suren

texts.en:
Suren is a 46-year-old farmer from Lukashin village. He lives with his wife, daughter and son, who help him with agricultural work. He has been involved in agriculture for more than 15 years, and it is his only source of income. Suren's farm currently includes 30 chickens, a mother pig, 60 lambs and 8 cows. He also owns some agricultural land, where apricot, plum and pear trees are grown. He works hard to gather good harvests and sell his produce in the local market.

Because Suren has insufficient funds to increase the number of his livestock, he has applied for this loan. With the loan's help he will purchase nine bulls, which will help him to earn more agricultural income. The expansion of the farm is very important, for Suren to be able to sustain his family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for 9 bulls

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a moto-tricycle driver from Getafe, Bohol. He has been engaged in this business for more than three years. This is the source of his income. Joseph is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for the tricycle, like nuts and bolts, tires and fuel.

In the future, Joseph hopes to make his business a success. Moreover, he wants to save money for the future schooling of his child.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the moto-tricycle, like nuts and bolts, tires, and fuel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more items to resell, such as snacks, beverages, and the like

loans.name: Zoila Esperanza

texts.es:
Zoila tiene 53 años de edad su estado civil soltera vive con su mamá tiene 3 hijos vive en la Ciudad de Ventanas en la Provincia de los Ríos

La V.R.C. 25 de Febrero, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto el Guabito  de la Parroquia Zapatol, Pertenece al Cantón  Ventanas se Dedica a Labores Agrícolas.

Zoila se dedica al negocio de cacao y la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, café, además se dedica a la crianza de animales como gallinas, cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar de urea, liquido mata plagas, insecticida. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. La compra los realiza quince y mensualmente en Ventanas.  El sueño es trabajar mucho para el bienestar de mi familia. Los desafíos a los que enfrenta son las plagas y cultivos. En el  tiempo libre le gusta cantar el carnaval.
texts.en:
Zoila is 53 years old, single, and has three children. She lives with her mother in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. She is a member of the "25 de Febrero" [February 25] Communal Bank, which is located in the Guabito precinct of the parish of Zapotal, in Ventanas Canton. She works in agriculture, including cacao, and she grows corn and coffee. She also works raising animals such as chickens and pigs.

Zoila is requesting this loan to buy urea, liquid pesticide and insecticide. With the help of the loan she will be able to buy what she needs for her agricultural activities. She buys what she needs in Ventanas every fifteen days or monthly. Her dream is to work very hard for her family’s wellbeing. The challenges she faces are the pests that harm her crops. In her free time she likes to sing traditional carnival songs.

loans.use: to buy urea, liquid pesticide and insecticide.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.en:
A $600 loan is offered to Carlota to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as coffee, sugar, noodles, cigarettes, salt, Coca-Cola, Fanta, Sprite and books. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2012. She feels so comfortable in running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Carlota independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, noodles, cigarettes, salt, Coca-Cola, Fanta, Sprite and books.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a freezer and a cooler.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is a 38-year-old man from Kakamega County, which is found in the western part of Kenya. He supports five people in his family and is married to Catherine, who is a teacher. He is blessed with two children who are 6 and 2 years old respectively.

Antony has a retail shop where he sells general goods. He has been doing this business for the last three years and makes a monthly income of 10,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). He is taking his first loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase more items of goods like sugar, salt and cooking oil in bulk for sale. He will use the anticipated profit to open up another new business.

He has a dream of expanding his business into a wholesale one to earn more income to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, salt and cooking oil in bulk for sale.

loans.name: Mujeres Rumbo Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
Este es el  grupo Mujeres Rumbo al Progreso; Juliana es miembro del grupo. Ella tiene 43 años es conviviente con 03 hijos, su esposo trabaja como comerciante, con el fin de generar más ingresos para su familia ella lo ayuda trabajando en su tienda de abarrotes, antes su trabajo era mas sacrificado porque viajaba a provincia llevando productos para vender,en la actualidad alquila una tienda donde tiene su negocio; allí vende toda clase productos de primera necesidad; gracias a su trabajo su familia goza de algunas comodidades y también puede brindarle a sus hijos una buena educación, el préstamo que ha solicitado a EDAPROSPO lo utilizará para comprar granos y preparar cereales que luego venderá en su tienda, en el futuro desea poder comprar una tienda propia donde establecer su negocio.
¡Juliana les agradece su apoyo! En la foto viste polo color turquesa.
*Se adjuntan las fotos del Sr. Nolasco y la Sra. Antonia al lado derecho e izquierdo de la fotografía respectivamente.
texts.en:
This is the Mujeres Rumbo al Progreso group. Juliana is a member of the group. She is 43 years old and has a partner with whom she has three children. Her husband works as a merchant with the goal of generating greater earnings for their family. She helps him out by working in their grocery store. Before, her work required greater sacrifice because she traveled through the province carrying her products to sell. 

Their business is currently located in a store where they rent. There she sells all types of basic needs products. Thanks to her work, her family enjoys some comforts and she can also provide her children with a good education. The loan that she has requested from EDAPROSPO will be used to buy grains and prepare cereals to then sell in her store. In the future she hopes to buy her own store location where she could establish her business.

Juliana thanks you for your support! In the photo she is dressed in a turqouise blouse. 

The photos of Nolasco and Antonia have been attached to the lower right-hand side and to the lower left-hand side, respectively, of the group photo.

loans.use: to buy grains to prepare cereals.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar gracias a su crédito anterior con Kiva pudo equipar mejor su negocio con productos de todo tipo para dar a sus clientes una mejor variedad. El es muy trabajador y comenta que su meta es poder seguir agrandando su negocio y tener mayores ingresos.
Solicita nuevamente de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, lácteos, verduras, carnes y demás, con lo que podrá surtir su negocio y seguir dando a sus clientes la variedad a la que estan acostumbrados. Agradece por la nueva oportunidad que esta recibiendo, ya que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Cesar, thanks to the previous loan from Kiva, was able to better equip his business with products of all types so he could give his customers a better variety. He is hard-working and says that his goal is to be able to continue growing his business and to earn more income. 

He is requesting a new loan to invest it in the purchase of drinks, dairy products, vegetables, meats, and more. With these he will stock up his business and continue giving his customers the variety to which they are accustomed. He is grateful for the new opportunity that he is receiving, since it will be a great help to him.

loans.use: to buy drinks, dairy products, vegetables, meats, and more.

loans.name: Tynchtykan

texts.ru: Тынчтыкан 44 года, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Тынчтыкан в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 25 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 20,000 KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Тынчтыкан в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 1 корова, 1 бычок и 5 овцематок, продажа молока приносит около 5,000 KGS в месяц. Каждый год Тынчтыкан обрабатывает 1,35 га где ежегодно сажает фасоль.   В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Тынчтыкан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 бычка и 5 овец целях увеличения доходов от перепродажи скота, на остаток средств Тынчтыкан планирует купить минеральные удобрения. Доходы от кредита Тынчтыкан будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Tynchtykan is 44 years old, married, and has four children. As a main source of income for her family, Tynchtykan has been engaged in raising livestock for the last 25 years, starting this business with a sum of 20,000 KGS. Through hard work, Tynchtykan now has one cow, one bull, and five ewes, and sold milk brings in about 5,000 KGS a month. Every year, Tynchtykan works 1.35 hectares where she annually plants beans. 

With the goal of further developing her business, Tynchtykan turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy a bull and five sheep to increase revenue from the resale of livestock. Tynchtykan plans to use the remaining balance to buy mineral fertilizers. Доходы от кредита Tynchtykan will invest income from the loan to further grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase a bull, five sheep, and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Lelis Yolanda

texts.es: Doña Lelis, tiene 42 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo, tiene 7 hijos, reside en el municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa. Ella lleva 8 años de generar ingresos para la manutención de su familia, su actividad de negocio es la compra y venta de pescado fresco. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante en su aldea. Ha mantenido estable su actividad mediante la inversión de varios prestamos el que solicita actualmente es por 4,000 lempiras y es el cuarto ciclo con ODEF y comenta que le ha ido muy bien. Va comprar pescado para vender ya que tiene buena demanda. Su plan es continuar con su negocio para mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia
texts.en: Lelis is 42 years old, lives with her long-term partner, has seven children, and lives in the town of Santa Cruz de Yojoa.  She has been earning a living to support her family for eight years now and her business is buying and selling fresh fish.  She does her selling on foot in her town.  She has kept her business stable by investing several loans.  The one she is currently asking for is for 4,000 lempiras and it is her fourth loan cycle with ODEF and she tells us it has been going very well for her.  She will buy fish to sell as she has a good demand.  Her plan is to continue with her business to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Julían Dario

texts.es:
Julián Darío de 26 años de edad, es un joven que tras haber prestado su servicio militar en el Ejercito Nacional de Colombia, decidió dedicarse al mundo de los negocios y montar su propia empresa. Con sus ahorros y con mucho esfuerzo optó por abrir en su sector una sala de internet, en donde presta servicio de internet, venta de accesorios para celular y comercialización de dulces, debido a que en su barrio no se contaba con este servicio.
Asegura que su mayor deseo es poder mejorar y ampliar su negocio por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito a fin de invertir en la compra de mercancía y realizar la reparación de dos CPU que se encuentran en mal estado. Julián espera que con dicha inversión sus ventas mejoren y el flujo de personas aumente, garantizándole a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y económicas.
texts.en:
Julián Darío is a 26-year old young man who, having completed his military service with the Columbian National Army, decided to earn his living in the world of business.  He started his own business.  With his savings and a lot of hard work, he opened an internet cafe in his neighborhood, where there was previously no such service offered.  He offers internet service and sells cell phone accessories and sweets.
Julián affirms that his greatest desire is to improve and expand his business, which is why he is requesting a loan.  He plans to invest in the purchase of merchandise and to repair two CPUs that are in disrepair.  Julián hopes that with said investment, his sales will improve and the flow of people coming through will increase, which would guarantee his family improved life and financial condition.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise and to repair two CPUs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 49-year-old married woman, and a mother of three children. She is from Getafe, Bohol. 

Josephine and her husband have been operating a rice farming business together for more than 10 years. She also runs a rice milling establishment. 

Josephine is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. In the future, Josephine hopes of expanding their business to make it a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en:
Moussa is a 32-year-old single man, who works as a car electrician, and is working hard on improving his skills. Moussa is well known in the region with his good reputation and special talents in his domain.

Moussa is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, for a sixth loan cycle, in order to make necessary repairs and maintenance to his house to keep it a healthy living place. His previous loans helped him a lot in improving and developing his business, through buying new updated and developed tools that helped him a lot in expanding his working place.

He hopes to keep on expanding and developing his business to attract new customers in the future.

loans.use: to make necessary repairs and maintenance to his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store, such as canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene is 56 years old, and is married with three children.

Rene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and has been running the business for twenty years.  She also earns an income from food vending.

She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries, such as rice, snack foods, sugar and and school supplies. Rene has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Rene aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries like rice, snack foods, sugar and and school supplies.

loans.name: Reinelda Serena

texts.es:
Reinelda tiene 58 años de edad su estado civil union libre tiene 6 hijos vive con los hijos y el conyugue en la Ciudad de Ventanas en la Provincia de los Ríos

La V.R.C. 25 de Febrero, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto el Guabito  de la Parroquia Zapatol, Pertenece al Cantón  Ventanas se Dedica a Labores Agrícolas.

Serena se dedica al negocio de cacao y la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, guineo, además se dedica a la crianza de animales como gallinas, cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar de urea, liquido mata plagas, insecticida. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura para tener una buena producción. La compra los realiza quince y mensualmente en Ventanas. 

 El sueño es trabajar mucho para que mi producción sea muy buena. Los desafíos es esforzase mucho. En el  tiempo libre le gusta bailar acostumbra ver jugar a los moradores.
texts.en:
Reinelda Serena is 58 years old.  She is in a common law relationship and has six children.  She lives with her partner and children in Ventanas, in Los Ríos province.  The "25 DE FEBRERO" ["February 25"]  Communal Bank is located in El Guabito precinct, Zapatol parish, Ventanas canton.  The members are engaged in agriculture.  

Reinelda Serena is in the business of agriculture.  She grows cacao, corn, and bananas and also raises animals such as chickens and pigs.  She is requesting the loan to purchase urea, liquid pesticide, and insecticide.  With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy what she needs so that the farm will have a good production.  She makes her purchases every fifteen days or monthly in Ventanas.  Her dream is to work hard so that her production is very good.  The challenge is to work hard.  In her spare time, she enjoys dancing and usually watches the neighbors play.

loans.use: to purchase urea, liquid pesticide, and insecticide.

loans.name: Willaim Alcivar

texts.es:
Alcivar tiene 35 años de edad su estado civil unión libre vive con su esposa  tiene 2 hijos vive en la Ciudad de Ventanas en la Provincia de los Ríos.

La V.R.C. 25 de Febrero, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto el Guabito  de la Parroquia Zapatol, Pertenece al Cantón  Ventanas se Dedica a Labores Agrícolas.

Alcivar se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao, naranja, guineo. Además se dedica a la crianza de animales como gallinas. Solicita el crédito para comprar de urea, líquido mata plagas, insecticida, morocho, vacuna para las gallinas. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura para dar un buen mantenimiento a las cosechas. La compra los realiza mensualmente en Ventanas.  El sueño es seguir trabajando  mucho para sacar la producción adelante y a la familia. 

Los desafíos son con el trabajo y la familia para que la producción sea cada día mejor. En el  tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
Alcivar is 35 years old, lives with his long-term partner, has two children, and lives in the city of Ventanas in the Los Ríos Province. 

The 25 de Febrero Communal Bank is located in the El Guabito Precinct of the parish of Zapotal, in Ventanas Canton.  He works in farming for a living.

Alcivar grows corn, cacao, oranges, and bananas for a living.  He also raises livestock, such as chickens.  He is asking for this loan to buy urea, liquid weed killer, insecticide, a varietal of corn, and vaccines for his chickens.

With the help of the loan he will be able to buy the farming supplies he needs to take good care of his crops.  He makes his purchases monthly in Ventanas.  His dream is to keep working a lot to increase his yield and get his family ahead.

The challenges he faces are with work and family, as he wants his yield to be better every day.  In his free time he likes to play indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy urea, liquid weed killer, insecticide, a varietal of corn, and vaccines for his chickens

loans.name: Avon Group

texts.en:
Ludmin is the featured borrower of Avon's group. She got together with the other group members to get a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua. The group members are friends since they came to work in Lebanon and they trust and care for each other.

Ludimin is a 31-year-old divorced woman. She is the mother of one child and has been working as a housekeeper and in beauty cosmetics sales in Lebanon to provide her son with the best education ever. Ludimin is the second from the right. She will invest the loan she applied for in increasing her beauty cosmetics stocks with specially released spring and summer collections. She hopes to increase her income and make sure that her son will have the education that she is sacrificing her life to provide him with.

Leonida Dela is a 47-year-old married woman who works as a housekeeper and sells mobile phones prepaid cards for additional income. Leonida Dela is the first one from the right. Through this loan she will increase her stock of prepaid cards to make sure that she will always be capable of transferring money to her family in the Philippines.

Josephine is a 40-year-old single woman who works as a housekeeper to provide her family in the Philippines with the best living. The applied for loan will be sent to her family because she wants to make sure they are getting everything they need. She is trying to start and additional business of her own. She is the second from the left.

Rossana is a 45-year-old divorced woman who works as housekeeper to provide her family back in the Philippines with the best living ever. The applied for loan will be sent to her family in order to make sure they are getting what they need.

loans.use: to increase her beauty cosmetics stocks with special products released for spring and summer

loans.name: Besik

texts.en:
Besik is 31 years old. He is married and lives with his wife, his 4-year-old daughter and 8-year-old son in small village in the Zestaponi district. 

The only source of income for the family is from the agricultural activities. In particular, they have two pigs and sell piglets seasonally. In addition, they have a vineyard with 600 samples of wine trees. They produce wine for selling locally. There is hardly enough income to buy food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Besik requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time, because of their low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Besik has now requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, and are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the credit received, Besik will purchase a minibus. After purchasing a minibus, Besik will be able to work for a private company, which produces metal equipment. Besik will transport the equipment with his minibus and increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus to be able to transport metal equipment.

loans.name: Neneth

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Neneth works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store.

Neneth is seeking to borrow 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell for her fish vending business. Neneth successfully repaid her previous loan, and she is now requesting a new loan to further build her fish vending business.

Neneth has been sustaining her business activities through her previous 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business, which will enable her to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing additional fish to sell

loans.name: Sos

texts.en:
Sos lives with his wife Shoghakat in Urasar village, in Lori region. 

Together with his wife, Sos is involved in agriculture. He keeps six cows and cultivates wheat and potatoes. Sos gets milk, and his wife uses that milk in cheese production. They work hard to make a good harvest and sell their produce to local market retailers. Agriculture is the only source of income for this family, so it is very important for Sos to get high income to cover his and his wife's daily costs.

Sos has applied for this loan to purchase five bulls and potato seeds for cultivation. This will significantly increase Sos's agricultural income and will help him to ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase five bulls and potato seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: Melchorita

texts.en:
Melchorita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

Melchorita has successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall. 

NWTF is re-listing Melchorita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Mariana Isolina

texts.es:
Mariana tiene 62 años de edad su estado civil soltera tiene 7 hijos vive con los hijos  en la Ciudad de Ventanas en la Provincia de los Ríos.

La V.R.C. 25 de Febrero, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto el Guabito  de la Parroquia Zapatol, Pertenece al Cantón  Ventanas se Dedica a Labores Agrícolas.

Mariana se dedica al negocio de cacao, a la siembra de maíz, además se dedica a la crianza de animales como gallinas, cerdos, ganado. Solicita el crédito para comprar de urea, liquido mata plagas, insecticida. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura para tener una buena producción. La compra los realiza cada 8 o 15 días en Ventanas.  El sueño es trabajar mucho para el bienestar de mi familia. Los desafíos a los que enfrenta son las plagas en los cultivos. En el  tiempo libre le gusta ver  televisión y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Mariana is 62 years old, single, and has seven children. She lives with her children in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. She is a member of the “25 de Febrero” [February 25] Communal Bank, which is located in the Guabito precinct of the parish of Zapotal, in Ventanas Canton. She works in agriculture, including cacao, and she grows corn. She also works raising animals such as chickens, pigs and cattle.

Mariana is requesting this loan to buy urea, liquid pesticide and insecticide. With the help of the loan she will be able to buy what she needs to have a good harvest. She buys her supplies in Ventanas every eight or fifteen days. Her dream is to work very hard for her family’s wellbeing. The challenges she faces are the pests that harm her crops. In her free time she likes to watch television and play sports.

loans.use: to buy urea, liquid pesticide and insecticide.

loans.name: Nehemías

texts.es:
Nehemías de 23 años, es un joven soltero que vive con sus padres y sus hermanos menores. Su vivienda es propia la cual esta  construida con material rústico y se ubica en un anexo rural.
De niño apoyaba a sus padres en la limpieza y en la cosecha de sus productos. Como sus padres veían lo efectivo de su trabajo decidieron otorgarle su propio terreno. Es así que empezó a sembrar arvejas, habas, papas y hortalizas. “Es un negocio rentable, pero también se invierte mucho en semillas, abono y peones”, comenta.Nehemías ya tiene clientes conocidos y son compradores de un caserío a 40 minutos de su zona. Sus ganancias las invertía en sus estudios de mantenimiento de maquinarias, ahora que ya culminó, continúa dedicándose a la agricultura y manejando vehículos grandes hacia la selva central. 
Nehemías es un joven de planes claros, para el futuro espera comprar más terrenos agrícolas para sembrar en mayor cantidad con la ayuda de su familia, que siempre lo apoya. Éste es el cuarto préstamo con Kiva, menciona sentirse agradecido por la ayuda que recibe de la entidad, por eso promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000 soles para la compra de abono orgánico y asi poder iniciar su propia siembra.
texts.en:
Nehemías, 23, is a single young man who lives with his parents and younger siblings.  He lives in his own house, built of rustic materials and located in a rural annex.

As a child he helped his parents weed and harvest their crops.  His parents saw how effectively he worked, so they decided to give him his own plot of land.  This is how he began to grow peas, beans, potatoes, and vegetables.  "It's a profitable business, but you have to invest a lot in seed, fertilizer, and labor," he says.  

Nehemías already has known customers, buyers from a hamlet about 40 minutes from his area.  He was investing his profits in his studies of machine maintenance.  Now that he finished studying, he continues making a living in agriculture and driving heavy vehicles to the central jungle area.

Nehemías is a young man with clear plans.  In the future he hopes to buy more plots of farmland to plant larger quantities with the help of his family, who always support him.

This is his fourth loan with Kiva.  He says he's grateful for the help he receives from the organization, so he promises to make his payments punctually.

Currently he'll request 2000 soles [PEN] to buy organic fertilizer to be able to start his own planting.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is a 53-year-old widow with six children.

Raquel works hard to provide for her family. Specifically, she buys and sells cosmetics in the Philippines. She has been running her cosmetic sales business for 20 years, and she also earns additional income buying and selling charcoal and raising pigs.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 22,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more inventory, such as lotions, perfumes, and colognes, to sell. Raquel has borrowed and repaid 17 previous loans from NWTF. Raquel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to expand her business by purcashing additional inventory (e.g., lotions, perfumes, and colognes) to sell

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 46-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and three children. He is the main income provider of the family and works really hard to be able to handle their expenses. 

He has been involved in construction for many years. He is well known in his town and has gained a fair number of clients so far. 

Today he is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, to purchase a quantity of wood needed for his business, in addition to some construction tools and supplies. This will definitely allow him to achieve his work competently and be able to present good quality services to the clients. He works on a freelance basis, and hopes to take bigger projects and increase his earning in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a quantity of wood needed for his business, in addition to some construction tools and supplies.

loans.name: Simplicia

texts.en:
Simplicia is 61 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Simplicia is borrowing 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to pay for her laborer's salary and to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Simplicia has been in this business for six years and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried coconut meat.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for her laborer's salary and to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Narciso

texts.en:
Narciso is a fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He is a married man and a father of three children. Narciso has been in the fishing business for more than 15 years now. This is the source of his income. Narciso is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the boat and to pay the school fees of his children.
Narciso hopes to make his business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the boat and to pay the school fees of his children.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan works hard to support her family. Susan is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Susan requested a 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net and other fishing materials for her business.

Susan has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Susan would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net and other fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a 35-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She and her husband have a 9-year-old daughter.

To generate income, she is engaged in the retail business. She sells various goods and items to people in her area.

Mary Jane is now asking for a loan to buy additional inventory, such as plastic wares, straw, ropes, and pots, to sell. With the loan proceeds, she expects to be able to improve her sales and profits. In the future, Mary Jane hopes to make her business more successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional inventory (e.g., plastic wares, straw, ropes, and pots)

loans.name: Santos Oswaldo

texts.es:
SANTOS  tiene 57 años de edad su estado civil unión libre vive con su esposa  tiene 4 hijos vive en la Ciudad de Ventanas en la Provincia de los Ríos.

La V.R.C. 25 de Febrero, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto el Guabito  de la Parroquia Zapatol, Pertenece al Cantón  Ventanas se Dedica a Labores Agrícolas.

SANTOS  se dedica al negocio de cacao, café y la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao, café  además se dedica a la crianza de animales como gallinas, cerdos, pato, pavo. Solicita el crédito para comprar madera, cemento y para comprar de urea, liquido mata plagas, insecticida, semillas. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura para tener una buena producción y comprar material para arreglar la finca. La compra los realiza cada 15 días en Ventanas.  El sueño es trabajar mucho para el bienestar de mi familia. Los desafíos a los que enfrenta en el trabajo es la siembra. En el  tiempo libre le gusta jugar naipes y carnaval.
texts.en:
Santos is 57 years old, lives with his long-term partner, has four children, and lives in the city of Ventanas in the Los Ríos Province.

The 25 de Febrero Communal Bank is located in the El Guabito Precinct of the parish of Zapatol in Ventanas Canton.  He is a farmer.

Santos is in the business of cacao, coffee, and farming, growing corn, cacao, and coffee.  Additionally, he raises livestock, such as chickens, pigs, ducks, and turkeys.  He is asking for this loan to buy wood, cement, urea, liquid weed killer, insecticide, and seed.

With the help of the loan he will be able to buy the farming supplies he needs to have a good yield and to buy material to fix up the farm.  He makes his purchases every 15 days in Ventanas.  His dream is to work a lot for the wellbeing of his family.  The challenge he faces in his work is the sowing.  In his free time he likes to play cards and he likes Carnaval.

loans.use: to buy wood and cement and to buy urea, liquid weed killer, insecticide, and seed

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Edna explains that she has been in this business for five years, and that she earns additional income by farming (growing and selling vegetables) and raising pigs.

She is seeking to borrow a loan in the amount of 22,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase materials, such as paint, spare parts, and iron, for the maintenance of her business's vehicles. Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to service her business's vehicles by purchasing materials (e.g., paint, spare parts, and iron)

loans.name: Oliva's Group

texts.en:
Oliva's group is comprised of 9 hard working women. Oliva is 20 years old and lives in the town of Mubende in Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past 3 years, Oliva has been working hard to manage her small fruit business.
To help expand her business, Oliva has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugarcane, and bananas to sell, and will help Oliva to generate greater profits and boost her business and add different fruits. Oliva hopes that in the future she will be able to live a better life.
Oliva is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more sugarcane and bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and pay for the maintenance her rubber trees.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. Teresita is married and has a bakery in the Philippines.
Teresita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy ingredients for bread production.
Teresita has been in this business for 15 years now.
In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for bread production.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 40-year-old, married Lebanese woman. She lives with her husband and their four children. Three of her children are in school.

Sanaa seeks to manage her family’s affairs and to cover her children’s education fees with the cooperation of her husband. Her husband has been working in the construction field for many years.

She started to work very hard to be able to afford her family's living expenses. Indeed, in 2009, Sanaa opened a coffee shop in her town. She explains that she has loyal customers, who always meet at her place to have fun and to enjoy each other's company.

With the requested loan proceeds from Kiva Partner Vitas s.a.l, she would like to purchase a new espresso machine and other products and materials, such as coffee and glasses. In this way, Sanaa believes that the loan will enable her to attract new customers and to boost revenues. One of her greatest dreams is to save enough money to provide her children with anything that they need.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing a new espresso machine and other goods (e.g., coffee and glasses)

loans.name: Holger Rigoberto

texts.es:
HOLGER  tiene 50 años de edad su estado civil unión libre vive con su esposa  tiene 5 hijos vive en la Ciudad de Ventanas en la Provincia de los Ríos.

La V.R.C. 25 de Febrero, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto el Guabito  de la Parroquia Zapatol, Pertenece al Cantón  Ventanas se Dedica a Labores Agrícolas.

 HOLGER se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, café, guineo, Además se dedica a la crianza de animales como ganado. Solicita el crédito para mejorar mi finca y dar mantenimiento y para  comprar de urea, liquido mata plagas, insecticida. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura para tener una buena producción. La compra los realiza quincenalmente en Ventanas.  El sueño es trabajar mucho para el bienestar de mi familia. Los desafíos a los que enfrenta son las plagas y cultivos. En el  tiempo libre le gusta jugar y disfrutar del carnaval.
texts.en:
Holger is 50 years old, is in a common law marriage with his wife and has five children. He lives in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. He is a member of the “25 de Febrero” [February 25] Communal Bank, which is located in the Guabito precinct of the parish of Zapotal, in Ventanas Canton. He works in agriculture and grows corn, coffee and bananas. He also works raising animals such as cattle.

Holger is requesting this loan to improve and maintain his land and to buy urea, liquid pesticide and insecticide. With the help of the loan he will be able to buy what he needs to have a good harvest. He buys his supplies in Ventanas every two weeks. His dream is to work very hard for his family’s wellbeing. The challenges he faces are the pests that harm his crops. In his free time he likes to play volleyball and enjoy the carnival.

loans.use: to improve and maintain his land and to buy urea, liquid pesticide and insecticide.

loans.name: Neneth

texts.en:
Neneth is married and works hard to support her family. She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from an internet cafe that she owns.

Neneth is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase more items for her inventory, like bags, pants, and other ready-to-wear clothing.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF, and more recently, from Kiva lenders. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items for her inventory, like bags, pants, and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Harriet's Group

texts.en:
Harriet's group is comprised of six hard-working women. Harriet is 20 years old and lives in the town of Mubende, in Uganda. She is single and has two children, one of them currently in school. For the past two years, Harriet has been working hard to manage her faming business. 

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. She will use the loan to buy more seeds for planting, such as beans and maize. The additional seeds will help Harriet to generate greater profits, and to acquire a restaurant. Harriet hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Harriet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more seeds for planting, such as beans and maize

loans.name: Angel Teodoro

texts.es:
Angel  tiene 65 años de edad su estado civil unión libre vive con su esposa  tiene 3 hijos vive en la Ciudad de Ventanas en la Provincia de los Ríos.

La V.R.C. 25 de Febrero, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto el Guabito  de la Parroquia Zapatol, Pertenece al Cantón  Ventanas se Dedica a Labores Agrícolas.

Angel  se dedica al negocio de cacao y guineo a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, café, naranja, guineo. Además se dedica a la crianza de animales como gallinas. Solicita el crédito para comprar de urea, líquido mata plagas, insecticida, morocho. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. La compra los realiza cada 15 días en Ventanas.  El sueño es seguir trabajando y salir adelante. Los desafíos  es en el trabajo luchar para que la producción rinda. En el  tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Angel is 65 years old, lives in a common-law relationship with his wife and he has three children.  He lives in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.  The 25th of February communal bank is located in the Guabito district of the parish of Zapotal which belongs to the Ventanas Canton.  They work in agriculture there.

Angel works in the business of cacao and banana and in agriculture planting corn, coffee, oranges and bananas.  In addition he works breeding animals such as chickens.  He is requesting the loan to purchase urea, liquid pesticide, insecticide and corn.  With the help of the loan he will be able to buy what is necessary for agriculture.  He makes his purchases every fifteen days in Ventanas.  

His dream is to continue working and to get ahead.  He struggles with the challenges in his work so that the production gives good results.  

In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to purchase urea, liquid pesticide, insecticide and corn.

loans.name: Valeri

texts.en:
Valeri is 27 years old from the small village in the Gurjaani district. He has a large family: parents, wife, an infant son, brother, daughter-in-law and nephew. Valeri requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

The only source of the income for the family is from the agricultural activities. In particular, they have a vineyard and a plot of agricultural land, where 70 peach trees are grown. In addition, Valeri has a tractor, which is used for tilling services. Valeri serves local people for tilling services and earns money. It is hardly enough to provide food for such a large family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Valeri requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country’s rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit Valeri will open an auto parts shop. He plans to purchase a stock of automotive parts for selling in his shop. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to open an auto parts shop to help support his large family.

loans.name: Filomeno Serapio

texts.es:
Filomeno es un hombre de 54 años, vive en la ciudad Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con su hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su hijo, ya que Filomeno siempre ha sido padre y madre para él; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Filomeno no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Mecánica Automotriz, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Pollo al Horno para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Filomeno trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, brindando servicios de transporte en su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien porque conoce las zonas donde encontrar mayor cantidad de pasajeros.
Filomeno se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea hacer el tarrajeo y la puesta de piso de concreto en una habitación de su hogar, ya que esta actualmente se encuentra deteriorada y desea brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propia mototaxi y su empresa de transporte.
texts.en:
Filomeno is a 54-year-old man who lives in the city of Ica in the district of Parcona with his son, whom he loves and who is his main reason for being.  He is a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who puts all his effort toward getting his son ahead, as Filomeno has always been both mother and father for him.  Unfortunately, because of a lack of financial resources and the need to work since he was very young, Filomeno was not able to study to be a professional auto mechanic.  In his free time, he likes to watch movies and sometimes he makes delicious baked chicken to share with his family. 

On his own initiative, with a great deal of effort and dedication, Filomeno works as a mototaxi driver, offering transportation services in his city.  He works every day for around 12 hours and he thinks it is going well because he knows the areas where he can find more passengers.  

Filomeno is very thankful to Kiva's lenders, as it is thanks to their help that he will be able to make improvements to his home.  He wants to plaster and pour a cement floor in one room of his home as it is currently run down and he wants to offer his family greater safety and wellbeing.  To that end, he will keep working and putting in effort to achieve his greatest dream of having his own mototaxi and transportation business.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
As a married woman, Aurelia works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from pig fattening.  Aurelia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF, to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her food preparation and sales business

loans.name: Diana Tamara

texts.es:
Diana tiene 25 años de edad su estado civil unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con la pareja, hijos en la Ciudad de Ventanas en la Provincia de los Ríos.

La V.R.C. 25 de Febrero, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto el Guabito  de la Parroquia Zapatol, Pertenece al Cantón  Ventanas se Dedica a Labores Agrícolas. 

Diana  se dedica al negocio de cacao y la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao, además se dedica a la crianza de animales como gallinas, cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar de urea, liquido mata plagas, insecticida. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura para darle un mejor mantenimiento al producto. La compra los realiza mensualmente en Ventanas.

  El sueño es trabajar mucho para que la producción sea muy buena y poder solventar las necesidades de la familia. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta cada día en el trabajo es la competencia y en la familia darle tranquilidad y todo los que se merecen los hijos. En el  tiempo libre le gusta leer y ver las costumbres de mi comunidad  y las festividades.
texts.en:
Diana is 25 years old, is in a common law marriage and has two children. She lives with her partner and children in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. She is a member of the “25 de Febrero” [February 25] Communal Bank, which is located in the Guabito precinct of the parish of Zapotal, in Ventanas Canton. She works in agriculture, including corn and cacao. She also works raising animals such as chickens and pigs.

Diana is requesting this loan to buy urea, liquid pesticide and insecticide. With the help of the loan she will be able to buy what she needs to better care for her crops and animals. She buys her supplies monthly in Ventanas. Her dream is to work very hard so that her harvest is very good and she can pay for the needs of her family. The challenge she faces every day in her work is competition, and in her family, it is to free them of worries and give her children everything they deserve. In her free time she likes to read and see the traditional culture and festivals of her community.

loans.use: to buy urea, liquid pesticide and insecticide.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is a 47-year-old, married man and a father of four children, from Talibon, Bohol. He has been engaged in the fishing business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of his income.

Rolando is asking for a loan to pay for the repair of the fishing boat. With this loan, he will be able to maintain the good working condition of the boat, thus improving his business. In the future, Rolando hopes of making his business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of the fishing boat.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a single Lebanese man living with his parents and three siblings. He’s a 23-year-old hard worker looking to support his family, especially his father, as their only income provider. Ali has many years of experience in his recent job.  He’s a painter who works with high professionalism. He works on different projects and always tries to offer his customers the best results he can. He’s known for being punctual and well-organized. 

Today, he’s asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase a new electrical generator. He will be utilizing the loan to facilitate and carry on his work in a proper way. Ali is grateful for all the good things God has given him. In the near future, he looks to take on more projects, maybe outside the country if this will help him learn new designs and better develop his business.

loans.use: to purchase a new electrical generator

loans.name: Zyraj

texts.en:
Zyraj is from Kosovo. She lives in a Roma community, where loans have helped this area to improve their life and business. She is married and has three adult children. Her husband works as construction worker with a very low salary and Zyraj performs with a tambourine, during the summer, for wedding celebrations.

They all live under extremely poor and unhealthy conditions in a small, old house. Zyraj really wanted to have a more comfortable environment for her family. The income that they generate is not enough to support the needs of her family. 

The loan she is taking will be used to buy the building materials for building another room, to expand her small house. The loan will help her family to improve their living condition. Her goal is to keep improving her home, to have more comfort and live in a pleasant environment with her family. 

Zyraj really appreciates all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to buy the building materials for building another room, to expand her house.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is married and works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from a general store and a restaurant. Emma is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF, to buy fishing gear for her fishing business.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF, and more recently, from Kiva lenders. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to build and expand her business enough to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is 58 years old, married, and has six children. She is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Trinidad has been buying and selling livestock for nine years, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business activity. She would like to save more money in the future, to expand her business further.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
This is Elsie. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP (Philippine peso) loan that she used to buy materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy nail polish, cuticle remover cream, a cuticle pusher, nail clippers and other materials needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elsie dreams that her children will finish their studies and hopes that her business will continue to grow. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for nail polish, cuticle remover cream, a cuticle pusher, nail clippers and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Ayitbek

texts.ru: Айытбек – 35-летний фермер, женат, имеет 3 детей. В целях обеспечения своей семьи средствами дохода, 15 лет назад Айытбек начал свой бизнес практически с нуля. На сегодняшний день, благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Айытбека имеются 3 коровы и земельные наделы. Айытбек имеет ежемесячные доход в размере 10,000 - 15,000 KGS от животноводства и дополнительно имеет доход от полеводства. В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса и увеличения доходов от полеводства, Айытбек обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 KGS на подготовку к весенне полевым работам  и на приобретение КРС. Доходы от кредита он планирует вложить в расширение своего хозяйства и строительство нового дома.
texts.en:
Ayitbek is a 35-year-old farmer. He is married and has three children. 

In order to provide his family with a means of income, Ayitbek 15 years ago began his own business from scratch. Today, through hard work, Ayitbek has on his farm three cows and land allotments. Ayitbek earns a monthly income of 10,000 - 15,000 KGS from raising livestock and additionally has income from field crops. In order to further expand his business and to increase income from field crops, Ayitbek turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS to prepare for the spring field work and to purchase of cattle. 

He plans to invest income from the loan in the expansion of his farm and building a new home.

loans.use: to purchase cows and prepare for spring field work

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has four children. The eldest is nine years old and the youngest is three years old. She is engaged in a food business. She has been in this business for two years now. This is the source of her income. Her husband is a fisherman. 

Teresita is requesting a loan to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the boat. This will help her to catch more fish when they go fishing. By the help of this loan, she will be able to buy new fishing net and to supply more fuel for her boat. In the future, Teresita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the boat.

loans.name: Ediopaguita Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 58 años de edad su estado civil actual unión libre vive con su esposo  tiene 5 hijos vive en la Ciudad de Ventanas en la Provincia de los Ríos.

La V.R.C. 25 de Febrero, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto el Guabito  de la Parroquia Zapatol, Pertenece al Cantón  Ventanas se Dedica a Labores Agrícolas.

María  se dedica al negocio de víveres en el domicilio, a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y Además se dedica a la crianza de animales como los pollos. Solicita el crédito para comprar de urea, liquido mata plagas, insecticida, morocho. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura para tener un negocio propio. La compra los realiza semanalmente  en Ventanas.  

El sueño es aumentar mi negocio y salir adelante. Los desafíos a los que enfrenta son las plagas y cultivos. En el  tiempo libre le gusta atender el negocio y reunirme con la familia.
texts.en:
María is 58 years old.  Presently, she is in a common law relationship.  She lives with her partner and five children in Ventanas, in Los Ríos province.  The “25 de Febrero”[February 25th] Communal Bank is located in the El Guabito precinct, in Zapatol parish in Ventanas canton.  The members are engaged in agriculture.  

Maria is in the business of selling supplies from her home.  She also works in agriculture  planting corn and raises animals such as chickens.  She is requesting the loan to purchase urea, liquid pesticide, insecticide, and “morocho” [a type of corn].  With the help of the loan, she will be able to purchase what she needs for the farm in order to have her own business.  She makes weekly purchases in Ventanas.  Her dream is to grow her business and get ahead.  The challenges that she faces are blight and cultivation.  In her free time, she enjoys taking care of her business and getting together with her family.

loans.use: to purchase urea, liquid pesticide, insecticide, and “morocho” [a type of corn].

loans.name: Jaafar

texts.en:
Jaafar is a 20-year-old single man. He has been working as a baker since 2001, specializing in traditional Mankousheh preparing, baking and selling. This is a delicious Lebanese special, made of breakfast dough folded with several toppings, as the customer requests.

Jaafar is applying for a Youth Loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to make necessary maintenance for his bakery, in addition to opening a new business to increase his income and develop his living. He wants to open an espresso shop, in addition to offering hookah, which is attracting a lot of customers these days.
