He is planning to start delivery service to customers in all of his business sectors -- bakery, cafe and hookah -- to please his customers as much as he can.

He hopes to keep on expanding his business and increasing his income, to develop his living.

loans.use: To make necessary maintenance for his bakery, in addition to opening a new espresso shop

loans.name: Luis Renelmo

texts.es:
Luis tiene 62 años de edad su estado civil unión libre vive con su esposa  tiene 5 hijos vive en la Ciudad de Ventanas en la Provincia de los Ríos.

La V.R.C. 25 de Febrero, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto el Guabito  de la Parroquia Zapatol, Pertenece al Cantón  Ventanas se Dedica a Labores Agrícolas.

Luis se dedica al negocio de cacao y la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao, además se dedica a la crianza de animales como gallinas. Solicita el crédito para comprar de urea, liquido mata plagas, insecticida. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura para la siembra de cacao. La compra los realiza cada 15 días en Ventanas.

El sueño es trabajar mucho para el bienestar de la familia. Los desafíos a los que enfrenta trabajar mucho para salir adelante. En el  tiempo libre ver noticias ver las costumbres de mi comunidad que es el carnaval.
texts.en:
Luis is 62 years old and lives in a common-law marriage. He and his wife have 5 children. They reside in the City of Ventanas in Los Rios Province.

His rural communal bank, called “25th of February,” in Recinto el Guabito, Zapatol Parish, is located in Ventanas Canton. It is dedicated to promoting agricultural efforts. 

Luis is in the cacao and general agriculture business. He sows corn and cacao, plus he raises farm animals, including chickens. Luis is requesting a loan to buy urea, liquid plague killer, and insecticides.

With the aid of this loan, he will be able to purchase the necessities for planting more cacao. He buys what he needs every 15 days in Ventanas.

Luis' dream is to work as hard as he can for the well-being of his family. The challenges he confronts require him to work a great deal to get ahead. In his free time, he likes to participate in the customs of his community, including Carnaval.

loans.use: to buy urea, liquid plant plague killer, and insecticides for his new cacao plantings.

loans.name: Kaed

texts.en:
Kaed is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married, and the father of two children. He works hard to provide his children's school fees, by selling spare parts for all types of vehicles in his small shop. He has been in this field for almost three years. He established his business in 2010. Kaed has gained an excellent reputation in his neighborhood and has hired an employee.

Kaed is requesting a loan of 2,100 USD. He will use this loan to rent the next-door shop, in order to expand his business. This loan will result in an increase of sales, which will increase his profits. By the increasing his profits, Kaed will finally be able to educate his children easily and provide for all of their other needs.

loans.use: to rent the next-door shop, so he can make his vehicle spare parts business larger

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 56 years old and a married woman.

She is in the agricultural business in which she farms sugarcane in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippine peso) loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She has been farming sugarcane for eight years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence's group is comprised of two, hard-working young women. Florence is 18 years old and lives in the town of Mubende, in Uganda. For the past two years, Florence has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells items like rice, sugar, and biscuits. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more commodities to resell, such as sugar and rice, and will help Florence to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her younger siblings. Florence hopes that, in the future, she will be able to improve her standard of living.

Florence is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to stock more commodities to resell, such as sugar and rice

loans.name: Yolanda Raquel

texts.es:
La Sra. Yolanda vive en Guayaquil, tiene 29 años de edad. Ella empezó su negocio comprando artículos para uso personal. Poco a poco comenzo a generar mas ingresos y asi comenzo a invertir más en el negocio. 

En la actualidad vende artículos para el hogar, realiza su trabajo junto a la hermana todos los días de 1:00 de la tarde hasta las 18:00 de la tarde. La dificultad que tiene es la enfermedad de su hijo menor de 3 años de edad.

Es una mujer soltera con dos hijos uno de 9 años y el otro de 3 años sola se ha esforzado por darles lo mejor a sus hijos ya que ha sido padre y madre para sus hijos. 

Quiere el préstamo para comprar comprar articulos de hogar como juego de cucharas, licuadoras, lavadoras. El sueño de ella es que quiere construir su casa de dos pisos, comprarse un auto y hacer crecer su negocio. Para tener mayores ingresos de dinero.
texts.en:
Sra. Yolanda, age 29, lives in Guayaquil. She started a business that involves buying personal use products. Over time, she began generating more income and now she has started to invest more into her business.

At the moment, she sells household goods with her sister. They work every day from 1:00 in the afternoon until 8:00 in the evening. The challenge she faces is dealing with the illness of her three-year-old son. Yolanda is a single woman with two children, ages 9 and 3. She strives to provide the best for her children since she alone must be both father and mother to them.

Yolanda requests a loan so that she can buy more household goods such as flatware sets, blenders, and washing machines. Her dreams include building a two-story house, buying an automobile, and growing her business. She also hopes to have more income.

loans.use: to buy flatware sets, blenders, and washing machines to sell.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Belinda works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Belinda is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and supplies.

Belinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva lenders. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, paint, and other equipment and supplies for fishing

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a married woman who has seven children, two of them in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 55 years old.

Wilma has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF, to purchase ingredients for her food preparation and sales business.

She would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food preparation and sales business

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en:
Bridget is 18 years old and lives in the town of Mubende in Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past three years, Bridget has been working hard to manage her small food business, which sells fresh food. 

To help expand her business, Bridget has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more fresh food to sell, and will help Bridget to generate greater profits, expand her business and add more different foods to sell. Bridget hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Bridget is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for lifeskills training.


"

loans.use: to stock more fresh food to sell.

loans.name: Eva Almina

texts.es:
Eva, requiere de un nuevo préstamo, por la necesidad de invertir más en el negocio, venta de medicina natural y  lociones. Con ello le permitirá comprar vitaminas tales como foscrol, neuroferrical, calsihid entre otras. 
El crédito anterior le ayudo a obtener mas ingresos e incrementar su clientela; las condiciones de vida familiares se mantienen al igual sus condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
Eva is requesting another loan because she needs to invest more into her business. She sells natural medicines and lotions. With this loan, she will be able to buy vitamins such as “Foskrol”, “Neuro Ferrical”, “Calsihid”, and other brands.

With her previous loan, Eva was able to generate more income and increase her clientele. She was able to maintain her family’s living conditions as well as her financial condition.

loans.use: to buy vitamin products.

loans.name: Brehima

texts.fr:
Monsieur  BREHIMA  est âgé de 41 ans et vit avec ses quatre enfants et son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à SIMIDJI, un des villages de la sous préfecture  Ouelessebougou, Région de Koulikoro.
BREHIMA n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente de céréales et autres article divers. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand commerçant de céréales et d’article divers. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son premier prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter, 2 tonnes de riz, 5 sacs de sucre et 2 cartons de thé auprès des grossistes de BAMAKO qu’il revend en détail à SIMIDJI à crédit et au comptant a une clientèle mixte.
BREHIMA espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50.000. FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mr. BREHIMA is 41 years old and lives with  his four children and wife in a traditional family in SIMIDJI, a village in the sub-prefecture of  Ouelessebougou, Région de Koulikoro.
BREHIMA did not have the chance to go to school. Early on, he became interested in revenue-generating businesses, especially in the buying and selling of grains and a variety of other goods. He learned this business from his maternal uncle, who used to be a major merchant of grains and various goods. 

Concerned about satisfying his clearly growing customer base, he decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He is on his first individual loan, which will be used to purchase 2 tonnes of rice, 5 sacks of sugar, and 2 boxes of tea from Bamako wholesalers. The goods will be sold for cash or on credit at the retail level to a mixed customer base in SIMIDJI.
BREHIMA hopes to make an average monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA that will be used for repaying the loan, and the rest will be for reinvesting in his work.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods, such as rice, sugar, and tea.

loans.name: Sunde

texts.en:
Sunde is a married woman and mother of two young children, from Trinidad, Bohol. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for almost a year. She also engages in a food vending business.

Sunde is asking for a loan to buy feed for the pigs. She hopes to make her business a success in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. 

She operates a retail business where she sells honey. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located by a busy highway and her primary customers are local residents. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to purchase more honey to sell. Her business goal is to grow to be a wholesaler within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. This is her second loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM).

loans.use: to purchase more honey to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie works hard to support her family. Rosemarie is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Rosemarie requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Rosemarie has been in this business for ten years now. In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Rubia Yolanda

texts.es:
Rubia Yolanda es una joven madre emprendedora y maestra de educación primaria de 25 años de edad. Día a día enseña el pan del saber a los niños de su comunidad (kinder) y se esmera porque cada día sea mejor que el anterior. Ella es casada y agradece a DIOS por el esposo que hoy tiene ya que juntos han emprendido un proyecto que es el de mejorar su propiedad y sus cultivos de café. La tierra en la que ella cultiva fue heredada por sus padres mismos que le enseñaron a trabajar la agricultura desde muy pequeña y apoyaron para que ella pudiera estudiar. Su producto es comercializado en pequeña escala en el mercado local, con los vecinos y demás que lo caracterizan como un producto de calidad, limpio y sano. Ella tiene un hogar bien formado y junto a su esposo se dedican a esta actividad por mas de 12 años también tienen un hijo el cual esta en el Kinder.

Yolanda hoy en día solicita ayuda para compra de fertilizantes, abono, bombas de fumigación para mejorar su producción de café de esa manera obtener mejores ingresos para ella y su familia.

Su meta es que por medio de esta ayuda ella pueda abonar y ampliar sus cultivos de café para que esta próxima cosecha ella pueda obtener una mejor producción y aumentar el área de su terreno. Su sueño es poder darle a si hijo una mejor educación para que el pueda tener mejores oportunidades de empleo, un mejor estilo de vida y que también el pueda cumplir y ver hechos realidad sus metas y sus sueños.
texts.en:
Rubia Yolanda is a 25-year-old mother and primary school teacher with an entrepreneurial spirit. Each day she teaches the kindergarten children of her community, putting in a lot of effort and care so that each day is better than the last.

Rubia is married and is thankful to God for her husband. They have undertaken a project together to improve their property and their coffee crops. 

The land that Rubia cultivates was inherited by her parents and it was they who taught her from a young age how to work in agriculture. Her parents also supported her so she was able to study. 

Rubia’s coffee is sold on a small scale in a local market. Her neighbors and others describe her coffee as high-quality, pure and healthy. Rubia has a well-organized home life and together with her husband she has worked cultivating coffee for more than twelve years. They also have a son who is in kindergarten. 

Rubia is requesting this loan to buy fertilizer, manure and pesticide sprayers to improve her coffee harvest and earn more income for herself and her family.

Rubia’s goal is to use this loan to fertilize and enlarge her coffee crop and improve her next harvest so that she can increase the size of her field. Her dream is to give her son a better education so that he can have better employment opportunities, a better quality of life, and that he too can see his goals and dreams become reality.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure and pesticide sprayers to improve her coffee harvest.

loans.name: Rosa Piedad

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 54 años de edad su estado civil unión libre vive con su esposo tiene 1 hijos vive en la Ciudad de Ventanas en la Provincia de los Ríos

La VRC  Solidaria, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Gabriel, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

Rosa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar de urea, liquido mata plagas, insecticida. Yo cambiaria mi negocio con el apoyo del préstamo trabajando más  en mis cultivo

Con la ayuda del cerdito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. La compra los realiza en Ventanas.  El sueño es tener su propio negocio de ventas de cerdos. Los desafíos a los que enfrenta es  a las plagas y cultivos. En su tiempo libre le gusta cocinar.
texts.en:
Rosa is 54 years old and in a common-law relationship with her husband. They have one child and live in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

The Communal Bank “Solidaria” is located in the neighborhood of San Gabriel in the canton of Ventanas. The members are farmers and ranchers.

Rosa is a farmer who grows corn and rice. She is requesting a loan in order to buy urea, liquid weed killer, and insecticides. Rosa switched over into this line of work and now she can focus more on her crops with the help of this loan.

The loan will help her buy what she needs for her farming activities. Her purchases are conducted in Ventanas. Rosa’s dream is to have her own business of selling pigs. The challenges she faces include dealing with pests and maintaining her crops.

In her free time, Rosa enjoys cooking.

loans.use: to buy urea, liquid weed killer, and insecticides.

loans.name: Leonilda

texts.es:
Leonilda es una mujer de 65 años de edad, a la que le sobran  ganas para salir adelante. Gracias a su esfuerzo y pujanza ha logrado montar su propio negocio dedicado a la comercialización de calzado. Actividad que le genera recursos para su sustento, ya que vive sola y nunca pudo tener hijos. 
“trabajar para vivir es algo que muchos hacen por no decir la gran mayoría en nuestro país y en el mundo, por lo cual, seguiré haciendo mi trabajo hasta el final de mis días”. Con estas palabras, Leonilda manifiesta que no tiene ningún apoyo económico y que para poder sobrevivir necesita laborar.
Su mayor sueño es poder mejorar sus ventas debido a que los ingresos que genera en la actualidad no son suficientes para el sostenimiento de su hogar y esto se debe a la poca variedad e inventario que posee. Por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará en la compra  de calzado para aumentar el nivel de ventas y mejorar su condición económica,
texts.en:
Leonilda is a 65-year-old woman, who has an overflowing desire to succeed. Thanks to her effort and strength she has managed to set up her own business working in footwear sales. It's an activity that generates resources for her livelihood, as she lives alone and has not been able to have children.

"To work to live is something that many do, if not the vast majority in our country and in the world. As a result, I will continue to do my job until the end of my days". With these words, Leonilda shows that she has no financial support and in order to survive you need to work.

Her greatest dream is to be able to improve her sales, since the income generated at present is not sufficient to maintain her home, and this is due to the narrow range and stock that she has.  For this reason she is applying for a loan that will be used to purchase footwear to increase the level of sales and improve her financial state.

loans.use: to buy footwear

loans.name: Kamissa

texts.fr:
Née vers 1979 à BAMAKO, Kamissa  vit avec ses 4enfants et son époux dans une  famille monogame dans le quartier N’tentou de la ville de Ouelessebougou. 
Enseignante de profession,  très vite Kamissa s’est  intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente d’habits, de gingembre, 
d’encens et de savons. Après avoir correctement remboursé le prêt précédent, Kamissa est à son deuxième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité  importante de gingembre, 2 douzaines d’habillement 3 cartons de savons auprès des  grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché Ouelessebougou à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Kamissa  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born around 1979 in BAMAKO, Kamissa lives with her four children and husband in a monogamous family in the N’tentou district of Ouelessebougou City.

A teacher by profession, Kamissa soon became interested in revenue-generating work, especially in the buying and selling of clothing, ginger, incense, and soaps. 

After having correctly repaid the previous loan. Kamissa is on her second loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. The loan will be used to purchase a significant quantity of ginger, 2 dozen pieces of clothing, and 3 boxes of soaps from wholesalers. Accepting cash or credit, she makes her sales to a customer base composed of men and women at the Ouelessebougou market.  

Kamissa hopes to make an average monthly profit of 75,000 francs CFA that will be used for helping her husband to meet family needs, repaying the loan, and reinvesting in her work.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods, such as clothing and soap.

loans.name: Siyaratou

texts.fr: Siyaratou est une femme âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée à un enseignant et mère de famille. Siyaratou travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2004. Elle vend des produits d’alimentation générale pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé et travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock. Siyaratou a requis son cinquième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. Dans les prochaines années, Siyaratou voudrait devenir grossiste. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Siyaratou is a 36-year-old woman. She is a mother with a family and is married to teacher. She has been working as a retailer since 2004. She sells grocery items to any customer in her store. She purchases her goods in Lomé and works alone. At the moment, her main difficulty is a shortage of inventory. Siyaratou has requested her fifth WAGES loan to purchase some groceries. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, she would like to become a wholesaler. She says that, with the profits, she plans on ensuring her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and sacks of  of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Julian David

texts.es:
Julián es un joven de 22 años de edad, el cual tiene claro que estudiar es su gran prioridad. Su familia no contó con la suerte del dinero pero si con la pujanza que caracteriza a los colombianos, por lo cual, aunque no pudieron ofrecerle educación él decidió trabajar para pagarse su estudios universitarios.
Gracias a su disciplina, Julián ahorró y compró máquinas tragamonedas, las cuales se han convertido en el pilar de su sostenimiento económico. Su madre las administra en un pequeño local mientras el estudia.
En la actualidad, se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de una máquina tragamonedas, con el fin de mejorar su condición económica y ofrecerle a su madre una mejor calidad de vida.
Sueña con poder terminar su carrera y graduarse como un gran profesional.
texts.en:
Julián is 22 years old and his top priority is his university studies. His family does not have much money, but he says they have the strength that characterizes many Colombians. Since his family could not pay for Julián’s education, he decided to pay for his university studies himself. 

Julián is very disciplined, so he saved to buy slot machines, which have become his main source of income. His mother oversees them in a small commercial location while he studies. 

Julián is requesting this loan to buy a slot machine in order to improve his economic situation and to give his mother a better quality of life. His dream is to finish his university studies and graduate to become a distinguished professional.

loans.use: to buy a slot machine to finance his university studies and to give his mother a better quality of life.

loans.name: Mujeres Victoriosas 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  Mujeres Victoriosas II está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 de las miembros están mejorando sus vidas para poder salir del nivel uno. Están ahora en su cuarto ciclo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Sebastiana es una de las miembros que esta en nivel uno, ella trabaja en la venta de ropas interiores. Cuenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado, ya que hay mucha competencia, pero que se esfuerza al máximo por salir adelante. Ella está consciente de que debe esforzarse mucho por crecer y eso está haciendo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de ropa interiores, los cuales podrá vender y tener los medios para ayudar a su familia y también cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group called Mujeres Victoriosas II (Victorious Women II) is making an inquiry into eliminating poverty, where three of the members are improving their lives in order to pull out of level one. They are in their fourth cycle.

One of the members is Sebastiana. She is one of the members in level one. She works selling undergarments. She says she makes sacrifices for her work, as there is a lot of competition, but she puts forth her best effort in order to get ahead. She knows that she needs to do her best in order to grow and she is doing it.

She is asking for this loan in order to invest it in the purchase of undergarments which she will sell and to have the means to support her family and also to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy undergarments to sell.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is 50 years old and has a host of children, but only one child attends school. Lawrence operates a carpentry workshop which is located in Kagadi town. It is a business he has been doing for the last 20 years, as a major source of income. He started this business to supplement the income he gets from car driving at one of the schools in Kagadi, in order to adequately meet the demands of his extended family, including relatives.

Lawrence wants a loan of UGX 3,000,000/= (three million shillings) to buy building materials to complete his residential house and have a good environment for the family.The challenge he is facing includes the high prices for the construction materials which has made the house stay incomplete for so long. 

He thanks God for UGAFODE, whose services came at the time he needed them most. With the loan, he will finally be able to occupy his new house. His family is excited because very soon their status will change from living in a mud-and-wattle house to living in a permanent house. Lawrence thanks UGAFODE and Kiva lenders for the partnership. 

In the photograph, Lawrence is with the UGAFODE staff in the front of the house to be completed.

loans.use: to buy building materials for the completion of his residential house.

loans.name: Ledin

texts.es: Ledin, tiene 22 años de edad, soltero, vive con un hermano en una aldea del municipio de Macuelizo Santa Bárbara. Anteriormente Ledin trabajaba en un cibercafé donde obtuvo experiencia, y hace un año logro establecer su propio negocio de cibercafé y también presta el servicio secretarial de laminado, encuadernado y fotocopias. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo de 11,000 lempiras para comprar tintas, memorias, papel, Cd y adaptadores para su negocio. El espera que esta inversión le ayude a mejorar los ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ledin is 22 years old, single and lives with a brother in a village in the municipality of Macuelizo Santa Bárbara.

Ledin used to work in a cybercafé where he gained experience and a year ago he was able to start his own cybercafé. He also provides secretarial services such as laminating, binding and photocopying.

Ledin is requesting a loan of 11,000 HNL to buy ink, memory cards, paper, CDs, adaptors and other supplies for his cybercafé business. He hopes that this loan will help him improve his income and his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ink, memory cards, CDs, adaptors and other supplies for his cybercafé business.

loans.name: Kylym

texts.ru: Кылым 71 год, замужем, воспитала 7 детей. Только младший сын проживает с ними. Остальные дети самостоятельные. Кылым на протяжении 30 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с приобретения 4 глов овец и 1 коровы. Благодаря упорному труду Кылым в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день развтое хозяйство которое приносит ежемесячный доход около 10,000 ежемесячно. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кылым обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 90,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 дойных коров и овец, что позволит ей увеличить надои и доходы от продажи молока. Доходы от кредита Кылым планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Kylym is 71 years old, married and has raised seven children. Only the youngest son still lives with them. The other children are independent. 

Kylym has worked with livestock breeding for a period of 30 years, after having started this business with the purchase of four sheep and one cow. Thanks to persistent work, Kylym today has a developed business which brings in a monthly income of around 10,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Kylym turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 90,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of two dairy cows and sheep, which will allow her to increase the yield and income from selling milk. Kylym plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of household animals.

loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows and sheep

loans.name: Vincent Paul

texts.fr:
Monsieur  VINCENT  PAUL est âgé de 49 ans et vit avec ses trois enfants et son épouse dans la sous préfecture de Ouelessebougou, Région de Koulikoro.
VINCENT PAUL n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente des  boissons et autre article divers. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand commerçant de boissons et d’article divers. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son troisième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter un réfrigérateur et  50 casiers de boissons alcoolisées et des soda, auprès des grossistes de BAMAKO qu’il revend en détail à Ouelessebougou et villages environnants à crédit et au comptant à une clientèle mixte.
VINCENT PAUL espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 60.000  FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mr. VINCENT PAUL is 41 years old and lives with  his four children and wife in the sub-prefecture of  Ouelessebougou, Région de Koulikoro.

VINCENT PAUL did not have the chance to go to school. Early on, he became interested in revenue-generating businesses, especially in the buying and selling of beverages and a variety of other goods. He learned this business from his maternal uncle, who used to be a major merchant of beverages and various goods. 

Concerned about satisfying his clearly growing customer base, he decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He is on his third individual loan, which will be used to purchase a refrigerator and 50 cases of alcoholic beverages and soft drinks from Bamako wholesalers. The products will be sold for cash or on credit at the retail level to a mixed customer base in Ouelessebougou and in surrounding villages.

VINCENT PAUL hopes to make an average monthly profit of 60,000 francs CFA that will be used for repaying the loan, and the rest will be for reinvesting in his business.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and variety of beverages to sell

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru: Наргиза родилась в высокогорном селе Кыргызстана. Замужем и воспитывает одного сына. Наргиза родилась в простой семье фермера. Она была младшей дочерью и всегда помогала матери по уходу за домом, отцу по уходу за скотом, так как старшие сестра и братья были взрослые и проживали отдельно со своими семьями. После того как вышла замуж они с мужем начали бизнес животноводстве с 30,000 KGS. Сейчас в хозяйстве у Наргизы имеется две дойных коровы и 9 овец, позволяющие семье иметь ежемесячный доход от продажи молока и перепродажи скота в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS), четыре теленка и четыре лошади. Для увеличение поголовья скота и площади сарая, Наргиза обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на приобретение овец и коров. В планах у Наргизы – дальнейшее успешное развитие ее бизнеса, которое поможет реализовать ее мечту – построить дом.
texts.en:
Nargiza was born in a mountain village in Kyrgyzstan. She is married and raising one son. Nargiza was born in a simple farmer family. She was the youngest daughter and always helped her mother to care for the house and her father to care for the livestock, as her older sisters and brothers were adults and lived separately with their own families.

After she got married, she and her husband started a business of livestock breeding with 30,000 som (KGS). Currently Nargiza has two dairy cows and nine sheep on her farm, allowing the family to get a monthly income in the amount of 10,000 som (KGS) from the sale of milk and reselling livestock. They also have four bulls and four horses. 

To increase the number of livestock and the size of the barn, Nargiza turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase sheep and cows. Nargiza plans to further successfully develop her business, which will help her realize her dream of building a house.

loans.use: To purchase cows and sheep

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 57 years old and married with three children. Mildred works very hard to provide for them.

Mildred runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.  Mildred has been in this business for 15 years, and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar and other groceries. 

In the future Mildred would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.
